This is my second one - spilled a drink on the old one. Great keyboard - just can't hold it's liquor ,-)
summary: This keyboard is the most bang for the buck, bar none!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am editing my original 2 star review to 4 stars.  The manufacturer read my review and contacted me immediately.  I had replacement keys a couple days later, no hassle, no fuss.  Thanks!!

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
I very much like this keyboard and had I wrote this review several month ago probably would have given it 5 stars.  The last time I purchased a keyboard was 2007 so it lasted 10 years. And even then the keyboard functioned perfectly but the padded palm rest in the front was cracked and destroyed so I searched long and hard for a suitable replacement and chose this one due to the size, backlit keys, and dedicated hit keys on the top.

This keyboard is barely 6 months old and the paint is already chipping/rubbing off the keys. I have to assume it's only going to get worse and eventually the keys will be unreadable.  While I really do like everything else about this keyboard, the paint is a big one for me. Especially with the backlit keys, it makes it even worse. I'm dreading how this will look a couple years from now.

reviewText:

UPDATE:
Keyboard DIED before the first year anniversary. Lights up but none of the keys are responsive. Too late to send back. DO NOT RECOMMEND

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I prefer lit up keyboards since I do lots of typing and easier to see the characters on the keys when they are lit up. This keyboard lights up a dim blue...really nice and quick to connect via USB 2.0 jack on the computer. One thing about this keyboard unlike other lit up keyboards I did not have to worry about, this keyboard lit up at once and worked the first time around when connected to my Windows 7 computer. Prior lit up type keyboards I had from several other makes, took at least 4 computer restarts to start working on my computer....but not this one as this Azio keyboard worked as soon as I connected it to my computer the first time around. There is a decent-sized volume knob on this keyboard which actually works to adjust the volume to whatever music I am playing from my computer, a very nice feature. It also comes with an attachable plastic wrist rest thingie also...which I do use a lot. It's a great keyboard...lights up in a blue...not sure if you can change colors...I have never tried yet. 5 stars I gave this keyboard and got another one as a spare.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
As others have noted, the rubberized finish on the keyboard is a lint and dust magnet. The adjustable flip-up feet on the bottom don't really make much difference in the angle of the keyboard, so I had to find some little rubber feet to stick onto the back of the keyboard to reach a comfortable position. It's a little noisy, and the key response isn't well designed for fast typers (I typically do 80-90wpm) but your average hunt-and-peck typer won't notice this. The key tops are mostly flat, without the concave dish shape of my previous keyboard, so again, as a fast typist, I'm finding I have to settle into a new comfort position for this keyboard.

All that said, I love the huge lettering on the keys, and the backlighting is a very nice addition. Two features which really help my aging eyes. I chose the model with variable backlight intensity, and I'm glad I did. With it adjusted to full brightness, it's really, really, distractingly bright! After a few minutes of fussing with the color choices and intensity settings, I settled into a combination that was comfortable to look at and not distracting, but still provides sufficient key lighting to be useful.

Overall, I would recommend this for someone who doesn't do a bunch of typing, or types at slower speeds, or anyone else with aging eyes!
summary: Delivers what I expected for the price point

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've had this keyboard for about a year now and for the most part LOVE it. I have large fingers and Lance-Adams Syndrome (tremors) which makes laptop keyboards useless to me. I love the large type on the keys of this keyboard, and it has served me well... with one exception. About 2-3 months ago, I noticed that the keyboard would randomly become unresponsive. I have since discovered, as the issue has become more and more frequent, that the cord going into the keyboard seems to have worked into a loose connection. I would MUCH prefer a wireless keyboard, but have not been able to find one with the features I need; so I have ordered my second replacement for this keyboard. Somebody PLEASE make a wireless keyboard with keys large enough for a person with larger hands to use!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Big illuminated letters.  There is no "white" backlight.  The Advert can be misleading depending on the resolution & colors of your monitor.  I thought one of the backlight colors was white.  The 5 colors are: Purple, Aqua (greenish/blue), Puke Yellow, Blue, Orange.  Its a loud & clunky full sized KB, but illuminates well in the evening & the letters are HUGE.  Has dimmer for backlight.  Has Programmable keys for misc windows functions.  Semi-sleek design.  I wish this had a "white" backlight.
summary: I wish this had a "white" backlight - colors disappoint

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The keys are a little bit larger than a regular keyboard but the letters or characters on them are way larger than usual. It helps to see them at night. I like the blue color but the red seems to be better for working at nigh. I tested it in windows and linux.

The only problem I have is that there is no way to turn off the back-light of the keys. The provided button only switches between three colors but it does not include an off option. So at night, the keyboard remains with its back-light on, despite the desktop is off. It is a waste of energy and it will reduce the lifespan of the LEDs.

UPDATE
found it! the same button you have to press to change among the different colors, if you hold it for a couple seconds, it does turn off the LEDs. I wonder why this feature was not included on the guides. So, this is it. A very nice keyboard for who works or plays at night. I just wish it comes with other layouts since I use French and Spanish characters as well. We are very happy with this keyboard and would recommend it to our friends.
summary: Great but there is no way to turn off the backlight, unless unplugging the keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is the third back-lit large font keyboard I have purchased and is the only one I would recommend. This is only slightly more expensive than the others but the quality is worth every penny of the price differential. Five selectable colors (prefer the chartreuse myself) and easily adjustable light levels. Keys have a good solid feel and good tactile response.  The only minor nit is that the non-letter keys where the shift does not put you in caps mode but rather symbol mode seem to be inverted. By this I mean that the 7 key shows a smaller "&" at the bottom of the key, whereas I think it should be located at the top of the key since I think of shift as going up.  I am completely satisfied with this keyboard and expect to use it for a long time

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Utterly awesome keyboard.

I've been using computers since the 70's and have gone through more keyboards than I can count. The ultimate best was Saitek Eclipse which finally disintegrated after almost a decade - Mad Catz took over Saitek and totally ruined the perfect back lit keyboard. For the next 6 years I was averaging a new keyboard a year trying to find one I liked with no luck.

Enter the Azio - Once again I have a perfectly awesome keyboard with the added advantage of large letters on the keys and really great adjustable black lit lighting which is a great boon to my aging geeky geezer eyes! The action is a little lighter than I was used to but it didn't take long to adapt.
summary: Best backlit Keyboard for Geeky Geezers.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My wife loves it. Works perfectly and the keys are very firm and responsive.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've only used this keyboard for a few days now, but so far I must say it's been a pleasure to use and is vastly superior to the old unlighted HP keyboard that came with my system.  I was unaware that lighted keyboards had been "invented" and were readily available for purchase.  I bought this keyboard because I do a lot of work in a low light environment, and seeing the keys on my unlighted keyboard was becoming more and more difficult as my eyes weaken with age.  This keyboard has solved that problem.  The keys are brightly illuminated and you can change the illumination color by simply pushing a button on the keyboard.  The color choices are blue, red, cyan, chartreuse, and pink.  You can also adjust the intensity of the illumination by turning a dial on the keyboard.  Unlike some reviewers, I have not experienced any "sticking" keys.  All of the keys on my keyboard operate very smoothly.  The "feel" of the keys is a little different than my old HP keyboard, but not in a bad way -- just different.  There are also a number of "hotkeys" that allow you to directly interface with the internet and your media player.  Those keys work well and are a nice convenience.  This keyboard makes using my computer a lot easier and more enjoyable.  I just wish I would have bought it years ago.  Price paid:  $26.82 USD.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I am a fan of Azio products in general. They are reliable and I have had no issues with mine. I have a mechanical and regular membrane keyboard from them, and they still work like new. That being said, my father has started to have worse and worse eyesight with time and already was never that savvy with computers so he needed a keyboard that was easier for him to see and use. This Azio keyboard fits that bill perfectly. The night that I gave it to him, he contacted me and told me how much he loves this keyboard and it seems to have made his life easier. I say if I can spend $25 and make my father's life easier and better, then it is well worth it!
summary: It Has Made My Father's Computer Usage Easier and Less Stressful.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This obviously isn't a top of the line keyboard for typing if that's what you're looking for..........but it is great for anyone who needs backlighting or big lettered keys! I bought this for my mom because her computer is in a somewhat dark area and she couldn't see well enough to type, especially at night. The backlighted keys are awesome and the color options are super helpful for personally preference! If you don't want them lighted, just hold the button that changes the color and they will turn off completely. The only downside (after having this for a few years) is that the keys start wearing off. You can still tell what they are, but the ones that get used a lot have lighted circles in the center where fingers have worn them off. Other than that, it's been a great keyboard and serves its purpose well.
summary: Great for anyone who needs backlighting or big lettered keys!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Loved the lighted keys. Other keyboards including the large key versions will eventually wear the letters and numbers off this one will not. Now for the bad part.  I can not hit correct letters or numbers no matter how careful I am. My wife, who was a great typist as a young woman, says this is the worst keyboard she ever used. It's just one mistake after another. Either the keys are too close together or the circuitry cause various mistakes in hitting the correct letter. I am typing this review on a new keys U can see keyboard.  I will keep buying these even though the keys will someday lose their painted on letters.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Would be nice if you could dim it as the light is very bright and it would be nice if it had a light blue or green hue but it doesn't it only comes with a bright purple,a bright fire red and a bright blue. The purple is the only color I can look at. Easy to read and easy to use. would be great for an older person. Oh I guess that would be me.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Great lighted keyboard, it's now my favorite. (I'm a computer consultant)
The stand up legs that tilt the keyboard could be a little longer.
They are also somewhat flimsy and I already broke one side.
Palm rest is perfect size. Key action is above average.
The price and ease of viewing the keys at anytime of the day makes
it a five star candidate.
summary: Search for a great keyboard is over !

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I only had this for a week now and I got to say I love  the Extra Large font on the keyboard and the number pad!!!  2nd Reason:  the keys are so smooth in typing.  I feel that my past purchases of keyboards was a trial and error in that I did not have to punch the keys for decent keystrokes.  3rd reason: The colors are so EASY to switch, press a button and change the color, that is it!  4th reason, there is no little foot pads for the angle of the key pad, it is gone so now my keyboard does not move.
5th reason, those great nubs on the F and J keys feels great for my placement of my fingers
Again, I would highly recommend this Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U) for those of us who has a problem with our eyesight!
The only problem I may foresee is how long the letters will stay on the keyboard without being rubbed out, especially in constant use!
summary: Great KeyBoard with Everything the Mfg stated in their Description- I love it

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Bought for easy key visibility in a darker corner.  I am using it on a Mac mini with no problems.  When I first attached it, up came the Mac menu for adding  keyboards.  Mac could not find this model, (there is a blank space on the keyboard next to the shift key that they wanted pressed for keyboard id) but I continued on and just chose a  normal default language on the next screen, and it works fine.  I like that you can turn off the backlit colors  when you want.  I chose the red glow, because it's really more of a pale peach and less distracting to my eyes than the blue or purple. The keys are a little clicky, but I don't mind that.  I'm going to buy another one for my sister for Christmas.  The volume hot keys at the very top do work with my Mac. Have not investigated if any other hot keys will work.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: WOW! This  is really superb. We're retirees and wife recently got a new 15.6" HP laptop but we couldn't see the keyboard in the evening or in a darkened room while watching TV. Always wanted a backlit keyboard and this one is superb. Lights up good and bright with five colors. I like the blue and she likes the pink. Keys have a nice smooth positive feel to them that invites you to write novels. A word of advice: if your going to sit this on top of your laptop's keyboard (like we do), be sure to disable the laptop's keyboard in device manager first. Otherwise strange things can happen. We recommend this nicely lit keyboard for older folks and others in need.

reviewText: So far, so good. I really like the backlights, the multimedia and task keys, and the BIG letters. Some of the reviews mentioned rather unresponsive key motion, but I haven't noticed anything out of the ordinary, and I'm a fairly fast touch typist. Durability will be the test, but, for now, this keyboard can't be beat for the price. Thanks to previous reviewers for identifying that the back lights can be turned off by holding down the LED key for 3 seconds--it really should be mentioned by the manufacturer, somewhere.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Some key lights look a little dimmer if keyboard is at a certain angle. Accidently spilled a cup off coffee on it. Quickly disconnected keyboard and tried to pour as much coffee out of it into the sink. Gave it a rinse of water, blew everything off with compressed air, took keyboard apart keybord, Blew some more compressed air into it and let it dry for 24 hours. Put it back together and everything works!
summary: Passed the accidental hot spilled coffee test! (Now I keep all liquids away from keyboard. Don't want to test a keyboard again.)

The backlit keys are just what I needed. I was having trouble finding home row in the dark on my other keyboard and consequently made a lot of typos. The one thing I don't like about this keyboard and it's not really that big of a deal is that the shifted character is below to the right of the non-shifted character. It can be a little confusing if you are not familiar with the typical placement of keys. Speaking of which, I have seen that a lot of manufacturers seem to think that the \ character should be left of the Enter key instead of above it. This alone makes this one a solid find.

Buy it. You won't regret it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Terrible Design
Really bad idea

When you hold the "shift" key and tap a letter key you expect to see either a capital letter or if you hit the 8, you expect to get the *, the asterisk
Not on this keyboard.
The labels are all opposite and upside down.
Without shift hit the 3 key you get the hashtag  "#"
When you should get the actual number 3

This is supposed to be easier on the eyes and bigger labels. So confusing.

This is a poor design that no senior, no person with bad eyesight could ever use.
I have used typewriters and computer keyboards for over 40 years I have never seen a design like this and I can't imagine why reversing the labels on a standard keyboard would ever make sense to anyone.
Avoid this product it will give you a headache and force you to start typing opposite how we learned.
summary: Poor quality / reversed key labels / poor design

reviewText: We had a Logitech lighted keyboard that finally gave out.  The keys started sticking and some of the letters were wearing off of the keys.  I was looking for a replacement when I found this one on Amazon and thought I would give it a try.  I LOVE IT!  The fact that I can change the color of the keyboard as well as the intensity is just a bonus.  The keys are very receptive and I like the large letters on them as well.  If you are in the market for a lighted keyboard, this one is a great choice.  It is also much less expensive than the Logitech keyboard and has more bells and whistles to offer.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Update Oct 4, 2016--
I have been using this keyboard now for ~2 months and I still like it a great deal.  Despite the problems others nhave experienced, the keys on mine work well with no sticking.
Complaint__ there are two gripes I have after using this for a while.  I use it for websurfing and playing online PC video games which is the main reason I needed to see the letters well.  I use a Logitech G13 and mouse for main game controls but the keyboard is a necessity for all the extra game functions.
1) Not having my hands on the keyboard all the time because it is in a different position eliminates touch typing and its gets shoved around, I often need to see where I am putting my finger. My keyboard is not the same as the photos included with the body of the sales page.  The LETTERS and NUMBERS are aoll large and wonderful but the pure function keys (, <  . >  / ?  ; :  ` ~  ,etc) are all smaller than then pic indicates and HARDER to read than a regular keyboard.
2) The indicator lights for num lock, caps lock and scroll lock are apparently soldered directly to the component board below a hole through the case.  This works if you are sitting with your eyes at only a slight angle from said hole but at the angle I use the keyboard, I need to lift it to see if those lights are on.  I have jury rigged it by putting a piece of masking tape over the hole so the light diffuses passing through the paper and makes a discernible light spot.  Except, why should I have to jury rig a brand new item to use it comfortably. Do the Chinese even have engineers except for making weapons?
--- I still like the keyboard and it performs well despite some small engineering ... umm ... oversights.
============================================================================
An excellent keyboard with large backlit letters.  I am retired ~10 years and my eyes seem to reaching their use-by date and the large letters are a boon that will keep me using the computer a while longer.  I bought a 60" TV back a year or more ago to use as a computer monitor and that helps the visual end a lot also although TVs do not handle text as well as good monitors.  The colors are not excessively bright which was a concern I had from seeing other keyboards which lit up like a carnival.  The brightness is somewhat directional-- brightest looking straight down onto the keys and the dimmest at an oblique angle as when the key board is flat on the desk, away from your body a little.  Propping it up with the feet or a wedge stand will help make it brighter if you need to.  ALL the keys work very smoothly but I no longer can touch type and others may have a problem
Just 2 very small complaints that I knew about before the purchase-- I could not dock 1/2 star so it gets 5.  This keyboard is NOT wireless and the backlight choices are Lt Blue, Lt Purple, Red and off-- the blue is not bad but I would have preferred white as an option

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
At first I found this to be good keyboard. I especially liked the lit keys with different color options. As I gamed with it more and more I found two design factors that left me unhappy with this keyboard.
#1 the space bar is too low next to the wrist rest. In gaming I would often be unable to hit the spacebar properly since my hand would first hit the wrist rest. A design problem.
#2 the windows key is placed in a way that allows it to be pushed by mistake when using the shift key. In a game that will close the game screen taking me to desktop.
These problems kept happening and even changing the position and angle of the keyboard could not fix the problem.
This is good keyboard for just typing but not for gaming
summary: average keyboard for the price not good for gaming

reviewText: I am used to using a backlit keyboard on my other computers and wanted one for this machine as well.  The letters are big and well lit.  The colors can be changed by a single press of the LED COLOR button.  There are 5 different colors to choose from.  You can also turn the backlighting off by pressing that same button and holding a few seconds until the LEDs go off.  Overall, I am very satisfied with this keyboard and am glad I made the choice to purchase this one.  If you are on the fence, jump off and choose this one!
summary: I am very satisfied with this keyboard and am glad I made the ...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I ordered 2 of these keyboards a little over a year and a half ago.  One keyboard was for my mom, and the other was for my aunt.  They are both getting older and were having trouble seeing the keyboard at night while they play canasta online and chat with one another.  They arrived in the standard cardboard keyboard box.  At the time both were running Windows 8.  After plugging it in, Windows detected it immediately.  All functions like volume, favorites, ect. worked without setup.  Both have since upgraded to Windows 10 and there have been no issues.  The buttons are large and clearly marked.  I am used to my compact laptop keyboard, so I do occasionally make typing mistakes, but both mom and aunt say that they got used to it very quickly.  The back lighting is the best feature.  With all the lights out, it is easy to see what you are typing.  I bought the 3 color model, and don't think the extra colors are necessary.  Both my mom, and aunt always keep the light blue.  My only complaint is how short the cord is.  Sometimes I like to browse the internet with the keyboard on my lap, and the cord just isn't long enough to do so.  It would all depend on how you have things situated, but in a smaller computer desk, there isn't much extra cord.  I wouldn't keep the cord length from purchasing these again for their intended recipients, just be aware of the 5' cord.  Overall I would recommend this keyboard.
summary: Nice keyboard with great features, just know the cord is on the shorter side.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have had this for a little over 4 months, and already some of the keys are having "holes" appear in the black part.  Not an actual physical hole, but the LED under the key is shining through.  The one on the "N" key is likely from use, but I'm at a loss as to how the hole in the Caps Lock key has started.  In addition to this lack of durability, the keyboard sometimes misses letters that I type (apparently I type too fast for it, I'm around 65 WPM).  For the price it's not bad, I love the adjustable brightness lights and colors, and the large letters on the keys, I just wish it was more durable.  I wouldn't recommend it for someone that needs a keyboard frequently, like for school or work purposes.
summary: Great lights and letter size, but horrible durability

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I've never had a backlit keyboard before. The normal keyboard I got with my Asus PC recently has dark grey on black keys. Hard to see unless you have light shining directly on it. So I decided to try a backlit.

This one arrived on time, perfect condition. Plugged it in, and away it went. Types well, easy to see. What's not to like?

Highly recommended.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keyboard is good but not meant for the industrial typists.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm very pleased with this keyboard! The keys are all in the right place, the letters and numbers are easy to see, and the touch of the keys is really easy on the fingers (I love to type FAST!). It's easy to change the color or change the brightness of the keys. It is slightly wider and deeper than the one I had before (HP model that came with my computer), but still fits on my keyboard shelf, leaving enough room for my mouse. The symbol keys look a little different, but I think I'll get used to those in no time! I usually leave the overhead light off in my computer room at night, since I'm in and out of there all evening. I no longer have to keep a flashlight handy! The packaging is very nice, the box describes all the features. They've also included a user guide that has 2 pages of info about the keyboard, and then a page about support and warranty info. And there's a little card included that asks if you're happy or troubled with your keyboard, and then lets you know what you can do in each instance.  I definitely recommend this keyboard if you're looking to replace your standard keyboard with a backlit keyboard.
summary: Great replacement keyboard for your standard-sized keyboard!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great key board love the lights, love the on /off switch. This keyboard doubles as a night light in my office. The clacking of keys isn't that bad for 25 bux this is a great deal and I plan to buy my family members this keyboard for birthdays and Christmas.. I am editing this as of July  9th . I bought a second keyboard for sons birthday  and it is as good as the first but i cannot write a review for some lame reason. Take this 5 star review and double it for both keyboards 10 / 10 would buy again.. Absolutely amazing product !!!
summary: Inexpensive Backlite Keyboard with letters you can actually see.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
It's very easy to change the colors and brightness.  It has a nice gradual (seems analog) progression from off -> dim -> bright.  The brightness is changed with a dial. To change the color, I just press the color change button and it flips between the five colors. The large size of the characters is very helpful.

Viewed from an angle leaning back in my computer chair, the LED's can be seen but not a problem.  There's no light bleeding like other backlit keyboards I've used.

The feel is not the clicky kind. This is a preference thing any my preference changes so I welcome the easy feel.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I'm a writer. And my computer is in a dark corner of the room. I'm always working at night, and was forever getting my fingers on the wrong keys, then having to backspace over all of that and try again. This keyboard cured that. With the keys lit up (day and night) they look HUGE!

Great keyboard!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's great, I can see the keys without my glasses, and I can change the backlit key color to suit the room.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: For visibility and backlighting this keyboard is a 5 star, As an actual keyboard you need to use instead of a book you are reading it's about a 2. The keys are almost flush like a laptop but think of what a laptop would be like without springs. Pretty close. Very easy to strike the wrong key or more than one key because although the keys are good sized there is no space between them. I was constanly turning off the caps lock which I would accidentally press. Frankly when typing there isn't much more frustrating than typing a paragraph and looking up to see it is all in caps. Some typist may like the superlight key press but it was not for me. Overall it just felt low quality. However, for visibility at it's price point it is pretty hard to beat. Definitely not a great gaming keyboard either. BTW my clerk at work tried it and shares the same opinion.
summary: Feels cheap and flimsy. Lot's of errant keystrokes for large fingers.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Good solid product bought it for my mom and she loves it!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's great for what I bought it, it lights up nicely, easy to see in the dark, in each of the colors, and the brightness varies with the dial just as promised. The big problem is that the keys are only 1/3 to 1/2 the normal height of keys and somehow that caused me to make many more typos than normally.  The keys were so short that a pen resting above the F keys kept rolling off the kb.  With an average kb, it will stay  there for hours.  I used it for about 8 hours over 3 days until I went back to a standard Dell keyboard.  I'm pretty sure I could learn to use it, like anything else, but all I wanted it for was so I wouldn't have to get up and turn on the light when it got dark, so not much incentive.  Still, I'll probably try it again, rather that waste my money.  BTW, with AutoHotKey or KeyRemapper, you can assign multimedia functions to unused keys, so you don't have to use a special multimedia kb.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am  typing on it right now.

But it almost went back.

Amazon is the best, but they are not perfect. They have a really annoying habit off showing me choices that don't match the parameters they offer to narrow something down, and then they try to trick me into buying stuff that is not what I wanted in the first place. That, alone, should be a category for free returns, if they aren't ever going to change their ways. And they aren't. Too busy launching rocket ships, I guess.

I needed four attributes: backlit, large print, Mac OS, full keys. And not cost a million dollars. That keyboard apparently does not exist. This KB is not Mac OS, which is stupid, because it takes very little coding to make a product accept 100% of situations rather than 75%.

But after a lot of cursing, I found a program called Karabiner that allows one to remap the keys, so if you want it for Mac OS, that is an annoying but effective method to make this keyboard work just fine for Mac OS.
summary: Asked for Mac OS capability; got this instead

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
It's okay for what it is. I like the backlight for when I can't have lights on because my daughter is sleeping.

I liked the feel and the extra media buttons! I miss those buttons now that this keyboard broke on me. This is the second one. I won't be buying another. It's just not worth it. It can't stand up to my needs and so far the basic Logitech keyboard that comes with a desktop is feeling better and lasting longer.

Spill something once on the Azio and it's basically over. The keys are hard to remove, it's hard to clean, and half the time trying doesn't make a difference except now the keys are weirdly set back in, if not broken completely.

Oh well.
summary: Okay for what it is, but won't buy again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
UPDATE 2018-04-24
I purchased this keyboard on April 4, 2016, and now two years later with daily use (>8hrs) it is still working with only a couple of very minor exceptions :

1) The left-side SHIFT key sticks every so often
2) The left-side CTRL key's surface is showing wear, this is probably due to how the plastic key cap is manufactured.,

Other than that the keyboard is works very well, and if I can get at least a couple more years of use out of it I would likely by another to replace it.

-------- Original Review ---------
I've been wanting a keyboard like this for some time now... I originally bought one at retail and was initially doubtful regarding how well the backlight and large print keys would work for me. But after plugging it in and using it for a few days my doubts disappeared. I purchased a 2nd one from Amazon.

The backlight brightness can be changed with a dial on the keyboard, additionally the color can be changed with a nearby button. Even with the light dimmed to its lowest setting(off)  the large print keys are easy to see in a reasonably lit room. The feel of the keys initially seems a bit clunky but that's easy to get used to and it seems that the clunkiness diminishes with use.

I like the layout of the keys, their size, and relative placement. The extra functions keys work without any special driver which is nice. The cord is a good length which is nice for reaching a PC under a desk and running the cable over the back of it. I also like the larger hand rest at the front of the keyboard, although if you've got limited space it might be an issue.

On some PCs the keyboard may stay lit when the PC is powered off. It's not a keyboard issue, the PC is powering the USB connectors.

The box says its USB cable is four feet and the instruction pamphlet says five feet, didn't measure it. I am using a three foot extender cable as my desktop is not near my screen. My only gripe is, I wish the Enter key would be larger, I keep hitting it and the \ key at the same time.  Once I thought I had a defect and the dash key wouldn't function so I called support and soon a friendly English speaking man answered, problem turned out to be I was on a government website that would not accept a dash.

Been using it three weeks and glad I bought it.  Amazon has been discounting this board and selling at $28 to $24.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This seems like a decent keyboard as far build quality goes, but personally I hate it.  First it has to be the LOUDEST keyboard I have ever used in over 20 years of computing.  OH MY Gosh!  This is LOUD!  This thing is so loud that people in the next room might think you are having the roof re-shingled.  I have never understood why some people like loud keyboards, but if you are one of those people, you will love this keyboard. The second thing I don't like about this keyboard is the symbol layout.  The symbol (SHIFT function) is the opposite of every other keyboard I have ever seen.  The shift function symbol is on the bottom of the key, where as on every other keyboard, it is on the top.  This drives me crazy.  Other then these two things, the keyboard is fine.

Bottom line:  If you like loud keyboards with a non-standard symbol layout, this keyboard will do you fine.  If you are like me and like more quieter keyboards with a standard symbol layout, this keyboard is not for you.
summary: Extreme LOUD with non-standard key symbol layout.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
TL;DR: I recommend it. The good far outweighs the bad.

PROs:

1. Nice large font.
2. Illumination is good.
3. Keys are all in the "normal" place. Many of the illuminated keyboards move the backslash, make the enter, spacebar, and/or backspace key narrow, or otherwise put things in confusing places.
4. Can still see the text on the keys even with illumination all the way down.
5. No batteries required (it gets enough power from the USB).

CONs:
1. Wrist rest isn't removable, so it takes up a lot more desk space than I'd like
2. Keys seem to be recessed
3. Placement of the "shifted characters" is lower right on each key instead of the standard of putting it above
4. Keys are a bit loud
5. After 10 months, the cord became flakey and has to be wiggled a bit until there is a connection. Luckily, since the keyboard is illuminated it is easy to see when it is "working" again.
6. Minor nit: there's no English on the BACKSPACE key and no arrow on the TAB key.

NOTEs:
1. Some people have complained that a few of the keys start to stick after a month or three. Do what another Amazon reviewer mentioned and dab a small amount of petroleum jelly with a Q-tip!
2. If you can't tell from the pictures, there is a "LED brightness wheel" at the top right of the keyboard (5 color version of the product) which can dim the brightness all the way to "off". They wheel is totally recessed and there is no handle to break off. The small button to the right of this selects among the 5 colors.
3. Chromebox/Chromebook users: The Shortcut Keys at the top that work: Home, Bookmarks, Volume (up, down, mute), show all tabs, full screen.  The Shortcut Keys at the top that don't work: Mail, Play/pause, PrevTrack, NextTrack, Stop. The Music key (to the right of Mute) does something (flashes the screen) but doesn't seem to do anything useful.
summary: This is the best of the corded illuminated keyboard choices

If you spend all day on the PC and type a lot, you may find it a little mushy/imprecise, but for occasional email and browsing, it's perfectly fine.  For the money, I think this is an excellent value and recommend it, especially given the insane prices of some of the lighted keyboards I researched.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
WOW, Big type on the keyboard keys make it very easy to see.  Also with back lighting that makes its visible in the dark or where the light is just not enough to see the keys.  I started out looking for a simple PC USB keyboard and came across this one with big type.  I appreciate the big type.  Once you have experienced back lighting, you will always want it.  So that's what I purchased, the Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with large printed keys.

This keyboard is replacing my unusable Logitech K750 solar keyboard which I loved until it no longer held a charge anymore and became inoperable. The Azio key action is one of a cheaper keyboard when compared to the Logitech, but for work and the large printed keys with back lighting at about half the price of the Logitech, you can not go wrong.
summary: Backlit with Big Printed Keys Makes for a Great Work Keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This puppy is awesome! I bought it for my husband who has been wanting a lit keyboard for a while now. The keys have larger print, which is very helpful, and the lighting works great. I'm including photos of each of the three colors. Also, it feels very sturdy, and the keys work perfectly -- no sticking or anything. It has action buttons at the top, as well, which will control the volume, play or pause your music, pop up a calculator, and access webpages for you. This has been such a great buy. We are both really pleased with this item!
summary: Great keyboard for a great price!

summary: The action is not as nice as the old one

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
My mother has been using this keyboard for about a month now and loves it, especially the large print. I was worried the keys would feel cheap since the previous keyboard was a solid chunky mechanical type from way back. To my surprise, it feels like a quality product. The layout is clean and attractive. The option to change the colors or shut the lights off completely is a nice touch. I like this so much better than the large print keyboards with the ugly yellow print.

A minor tech tip...
When I first plugged it in, the lights would stay on when the computer was turned off. Since this is a bedroom, it was not desirable. After checking my computer's motherboard manual, I found there was a jumper that controlled whether the USB port maintained power when the computer turned off. Switching the jumper solved my problem. I never use the keyboard to turn the computer on so this works for me.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Here's a heads up for you who might be trying to decide between the 3 and 5 color Azio USB keyboards. I first ordered the 3 color and, because of some peculiar lighting and seating arrangement in my office workspace, was not happy with the limited range of colors and visibility of the keys. I did, however, find the quality of the product to be pretty good compared to others I had looked at. Azio claims in their advertising that the chartreuse on the 5-color model is more highly visible than the other colors, so I ordered that model with the intent of returning the 3 color board if the 5 color better suited my needs. What I found was that the 5 color, though similar, is clearly made by another manufacturer and is inferior to the 3 color keyboard in almost every respect. Particularly the "resolution" (if that term applies) of the key letters/numbers, which are much more distinct on the 3 color. So now I am returning the 5 color and keeping the 3 color. My preference would have been a backlit keyboard with SIMPLE/TRADITIONAL WHITE LETTERING, but the Ivation board I initially ordered from Amazon turned out to be junk and I could not find another listing for one I liked.
summary: If you don't need the extra two colors, stick with the 3 color keyboard!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
A particularly nice full-sized keyboard.  The color selection and the adjustability of the key lighting are nice.  The feel of the keys and the keystrokes is just right.  I have been using built-in and Bluetooth keyboards exclusively for a long time so this one seems very large to me, but I like it.  I bought it mainly for troubleshooting  I have used it on Windows 7 64-bit and Windows 8.1 32-bit computers with no problems.  I have had several Azio products for a number of years and I have been impressed with product quality and support.  I will keep it plugged in, not just for troubleshooting.

Jim

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'd been using a Logitech G105 backlit board for sometime, but found the lighting a bit dim for my tastes. I read the reviews for this Azio and found a used 'very good' unit direct from the factory for a great price, so I decided to give it a go. The board arrived in perfect 'like new' condition and fully functional. Best of all, was the well lit oversized key lettering. No problem seeing these baby's in any lighting conditions. My only issue is the light dimming wheel is a bit stiff to adjust. I also appreciate the fact that this board has dedicated multimedia keys eliminating the need to use a 'function' key first. All in all, this was a great purchase!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Excellent keyboard, It is perfect for someone with a visual impairment - Seems incredibly sturdy and the backlight works well with the large print. Nice to have a choice of red, blue, or purple. I find the purple one which seems more like pink is the easiest on the eyes. This is the ONLY keyboard I have seen (in this price range) that has a FULL SIZE backspace key. If you've ever tried using the one with the half size it can be annoying, especially when they place another key beside it which is typical.**IMPORTANT NOTE - "Off" Button is the SAME BUTTON you use to switch LED colors - only you hold it down for about 3 seconds. I looked for this in the instructions and could not find it - although LEDs are long-life bulbs - I use my computer only a couple of hours a day, so I worried having it on for 22 extra hours per day would severely decrease the functional life of the keyboard. Problem solved - hold the color change button down until it turns off - same button turns it back on. Finally - The back has two small feet that you can flip up to raise the back of the keyboard. Overall a fantastic keyboard for the price - highly recommended!
summary: Excellent keyboard, It is perfect for someone with a ...

reviewText:

I knocked off one star because an all-white mode would have been great in addition to all of the colored LEDs. My parents settled on the cyan/blue as the easiest to see, but I really would have preferred a simple white setting as well.
summary: Great for older people and those with vision issues. Could use an all-white color mode.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Pros: illumination is bright enough and adjustable. The large print is very good. Has multimedia keys. Palmrest is textured to reduce sliding. Cons: you'll instantly know it feels cheap. Keys rattle and have flimsy feedback. My P key is hard to press. CTRL keys are in an awkward location. Multimedia keys are faintly lit. Does not turn off in sleep/hibernation mode. Overall I like it, but the quality could be much better. The Logitech Illuminated Keyboard K740 feels much better, but is not as bright and has small print.
summary: The large print is very good. Has multimedia keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U): I bought this keyboard to replace a keyboard that the letters and numbers had started rub off the keys. I wanted to get a backlighted keyboard for my recording studio as the control room is dimly lighted. Overall appearance of the keyboard looks grate. The letters and numbers are defiantly large! Letters are about 3/8 inch in tall and the numbers function keys are about 5/16 inch tall. The numeric key pad numbers are also about 3/8 inch tall along with the arrow keys. There are some other keys at the top, launch email client, browser home, add page to favorites, along with media player keys, volume and mute, launch media player, my computer, calculator, and change backlight color. There are some dray backs I discovered! The indicator lights for Num lock, caps lock scroll lock are sit do low inside the key board and are hard to see unless you look directly down at the keyboard. Also the lighted keys are brightest looking directly over the keyboard. There is a rest at the bottom of the keyboard or at least I think thats what it is. Its about 1 3/8 wide and runs the width of the key board. The problem is that the pads on the bottom do not touch the surface of a desk and it slides around. There are another set if pads under the keyboard directly behind the first set that don't touch the desk at all unless you drop the first set over the edge of the desk. Looking at the underside of the keyboard it looks as though the rest could be removed but unfortunately you cant remove it. I just dropped the first set of pads over the edge of the audio mixers desk and it works just fine. The legs under the keyboard to tilt it could stand to be just a little longer. Over all I am satisfied with this key board.
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a good keyboard, well made still working and no issues.  All keys still light up and after spilling like two drinks on it already and being dropped a couple of times ( from like 2 to 3 feet off desk)  And it was cheap.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have a black-glass desk with an under the counter keyboard holder so the keyboard was hard to see.  Plugged the keyboard into a usb slot, lights came on, and I have been in business since it arrived.  Just what I needed.
summary: It's working just like I hoped.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
It has been 5 months since I received this keyboard and it is just as nice as when it arrived.  I am on my PC 8 to 10 hours a day with constant use of the keyboard. The keys are so plain to see and the letters do not rub off as they do on conventional keyboards. As far as the sticking keys I have seen complaints about? I've had one stick so far and did what one of the users suggested: popped the key off and put so petroleum jelly on the backside of it; problem solved! I also read that the keys seem larger than normal but I do not think this is the case, I believe it is the perception because the lettering is so nice and large.  I am a touch typist at over 85 wpm and have not had any slow downs because of the keyboard at all. Another mentioned the angle of the keyboard and it needing to be propped up more on the rear; I thought so at first too but after a couple of days I realized that my wrist were at a much better angle than ever before and I do not have the typing fatigue as I used to have!

I do not believe you can go wrong purchasing this keyboard. It has proven itself to me and if and when it succumbs to old age I hope to replace it with another one exactly like it! I never leave a comment of more than a sentence but felt like this product deserved my wholehearted approval. Oh! The backlit function is awesome too!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I think the typiing position is poor.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

widow  for regular typing. My Wireless Keyboard died after 4 years. This keyboard is great. I received it today but it is too early for a full review. Sedt up was just plug and play. The keys are great they don't just depress by touching them. You need to excert minimal pressure which is a good thibng, it decreases the amount of placing letters by just sliding the keys. It has a 3 year manufacturer warranty. That is very good. I like the's  large lettering this is a plus for me, and definitely for my aging parents and inlaws. Large home so the parents are in their late 70's and mid to late 80's we have the extended family and they are very well computer literate. So far I'm glad with the purchase.

Specific to Mac users, the command and option keys are flipped, the top right three shortcut keys are not usable and the drop menu key is not usable. Surprisingly, the volume and media keys work correctly right out of the box.

Its not at all a bad keyboard, but I'll be returning it to Microcenter and getting a normal Apple keyboard instead.

The large letters/numbers makes it easier to see.  And the different light choices makes typing at night a breeze. You can even adjust the brightness of the lights on the keys.  The keys react just the way I need them.  I have worked on Hundreds of keyboards and this is one of the best I have ever used.  This is a must have keyboard for Elder People like me.  Thank You Azio for creating such a great keyboard.  Now if you can just add gaming keys to the left side of the keyboard for us old gamers, it will put this keyboard over the edge.  :-)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Worst keyboard in the world.  Ok, maybe a slight exaggeration.  But seriously, do not waste your money.  If you only browse the web or do email, it might be ok for you, but if you do ANY typing, ANY gameplaying, ANY work, at all, buy something else.  This keyboard was recommended at the time, so I got it, but the keys have no action (and I mean none), the keys are too close, and it's too breakable (ESC key broke inside a month).  It is a cheap keyboard, made somewhere in Asia (I'm guessing) to look cool, but for anything approaching serious users, it is a terrible, terrible keyboard.  A waste of your hard-earned cash.  I am now in search of something better.  The colors are cool, but you end up using only one.  The large letters are nice, but if it's a cheap, no-action, breakable keyboard, it does not matter.  Any long-term computer user who has used other (quality) keyboards will agree with me.  I'm an 18-year veteran in the IT industry, and this keyboard was a huge disappointment.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Received it yesterday and installed it immediately.  So far, as a "two finger" typist,  I just love it. Also as a senior over 65, my eye sight isn't as good as it once was.  The larger, backlit keys are great, especially after dark when my room no longer has any daylight.  The hand rest is very comfortable.  I wish I had a keyboard like this ever since I bought my first IBM PC (62 k ram with no hard drive) in the early 1980s (there weren't peripheral sellers back then).

Note, this is a wired USB keyboard (which I prefer to wireless as I don't have to worry about remembering to turn off to save batteries).  The only thing I am slowly getting use to is the placement the lower placement of the !,@,#... on the "shift" 1, 2, 3... keys etc.

As another reviewer mentioned, if you wish to turn off the backlit keys, just press and hold the LED COLOR button.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Like the LED backlighting which can be dimmed and changed to any of 5 different colors. A problem with this keyboard is that the key identifiers for the character with the shift key depressed are reversed. So instead of the & showing at the top of the 7 key it is at the bottom. Where this can get quite confusing is with the characters for comma, quote, apostrophe, etc. where the normal orientation is that the character at the bottom of the key is the one that will be typed normally and the one at the top is generated with the use of the shift key.

There is a also a firmware bug that causes the Paragraph notation to be switched on with Microsoft Word when using the shift key inside the program. More than a little annoying to have to keep turning this back off.

It is the noisiest keyboard I have ever encountered in my 33 years of typing on a wide range of OEM and third party keyboards.

With the reversed characters on the keys and the high level of noise I will be replacing the keyboard with another one next week.
summary: Good design but incredibly noisy when typing and characters are reversed on the keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I've been using this keyboard for a few months now and I love it. The large, backlight keys are very easy to see and touch is light and fluid (I'm a touch typist). I know some reviews say sometimes keys stick. I have not experienced that (luckily). I bought two of Azio's slightly larger keyboards (KB506) for my wife and it sounded like one of the keys on one of the keyboards might have been sticky on one occasion, but she loves them as well. They look good and seem well made for such a low price.

I highly recommend this keyboard for anyone wanting a keyboard that's easy to read in any lighting conditions. BTW, you might be asking "If you're a touch typist, why do you need to see the keys?". When I copy text or compose stories and things like reviews I don't need to look at the keys. But much of my time is spent working with 3D modeling and animation programs, Photoshop, coding, and Second Life. That means my hands are not always in the touch type position and in any case I'm either typing snippets of text or using hot keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I rarely fall in love with a purchase right out of the box, but this one I did! As soon as I had it in my hands,m I knew it was going to going  to be good. It seems sturdy which most keyboards no longer do. The tactile feel of the keys is very good, and the lighting is outstanding. As I seem to have gotten older, the lighting and large letters are a very valuable feature. Most of the necessary features are designed in, and all are helpful inn saving keystrokes and time.l am now trying to figure out how to configure the email hot key. They tell you of it,m but the instructions give no hint of how to tell I want Hotmail.com or Gmail,com. Well a good challenge for a rainy day and today is a RAINY day in central Texas.
The only major question in my mind is how it will treat me after some usage. After a few months of use, I will update with some durability observations.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I really like this Keyboard. The numbers are much larger than what I was use to. But that's good. And not too (over-bearing) bright, and that's good. And all the extra buttons across the top is also handy. I would by it again.

That said, the keys have huge letters (awesome! Mama says Yippee!) and overall it's a nice product.

If it had more colors, or just BRIGHTER colors, then I'd say, you know what, this is the (***)! This is really cool, bro! Get one for your mama who wears glasses!

reviewText: Looks nice but I didn't hook it up because it wouldn't fit on my desk or in my large backpack. It's two inches wider and 2 inches deeper than my full-sized Viewsonic keyboard. I forget the brand of full-sized illuminated KB I operate in camera club meetings (in a dark auditorium) which fits in my  backpack. At home, for photo-editing, I prefer to work in a darkened room with a dim, illuminated KB. I have KBs with and without numeric keypads and don't  find them worth the extra space they take.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
***Packaging***
I've opened two of these and Azio packs this keyboard in a nice, sleek black box with the keyboard wrapped, cord concealed below a cardboard flap, and instructions included.

***PROs***
Solid design: later revisions offer a hefty feel, pleasant textures, and lite/fast key response. The dedicated multimedia buttons all work on the two I purchased. There is a sixth (hidden) color, green. You can get it by switching to Cyan and dimming down about 1/2. No drivers needed: (I can vouch for Win7 and Win8.1) and all the lighting controls are on the keyboard itself, not in some program.

***CONs***
No USB passthru, No Audio Ports, No Detachable cable. The textures make this device a DUST MAGNET!

***Usage***
I've had this keyboard for a couple months, but a family member has had one for around six months. Neither are showing any signs of ware.

***Summary***
For what you pay (less than $30) this is a good keyboard. It will NOT impress anyone used to mechanical switches (or RGB backlighting) as the keypress offers minimal feedback and if you press to bedrock, this thing gets loud. Unless there is a huge quality control problem at Azio, this is a solid choice for anyone wanting a backlight desktop keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Bought this as a gift for an 80 year old friend with large hands.  Installed it for her - just plug in USB port.  Didn't need any downloads.  Just plug and play.

Oversized keyboard compared these small wireless ones.  Large letters and numbers with your choice of backlight - red, purple, or blue.  Can work in the dark with it.  Lighted Caps Lock, Num Lock, and Scroll.  Every senior should own one of these.  Helps prevent striking the wrong keys and locking up your computer.  I may get one for myself.  Really great product and price.

-It will take me some time to get used to the the tactile feedback, to me, is kind of "cheap plastic" feel. Well, it is lower priced compared to others

-biggest drawback for me: the keyboard stays lighted up even when your computer is in sleep mode, or completely off! I don 't like the fact that  I have to manually turn in off every time.

Well it had a short life and beyond Amazon's return policy. My  wife's PC has the same keyboard and has nToday I just had a bad experience with this product.  I had my system up and running but I could not bring it up because the the system went down hard and issued a Microsoft vague message, 'restoration needs to be done', press "Enter", but the "Enter" key was not responding.  Then my wife noted when she came home the utility company was working in our neighborhood.  Guess what!!!  We had a brief power outage and my PC went down and did not recover. .

I find it a bit to big and the keys just a tad to far apart to type above 40 words per minute and  a tad sticky.  It does slow your typing down.  But for minor typing it works ok. For elderly or slow typist, a much better product.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is a nice keyboard for the price.  We keep our desktop in our living room and occasionally use it when watching television.  The backlit keyboard comes in handy in the darkened room.  I am used to using a keyboard with more substantial keys, so it took a little getting used to this one as it has the more subtle touch keys, but it works fine once used to it.

We use Amazon for most of our purchases and I update my reviews if anything changes with the products. I do this so other Amazon users can get a real feel for the life of the product. I am not associated with any company and all opinions are my very own.

Update:  2-26-2015  8 months later and the space bar is sticking.  Very annoying? We don't eat or drink at the computer, so I know we didn't cause it.  I have tried turning the keyboard upside down and blowing it out with canned air, but that didn't fix it. The keyboard has a 3 year warranty, so I just emailed the company as that is one of the contact options for them.  They responded back within 3 hours asking for more information and then emailed a prepaid shipping label for me to send the keyboard back.  I will update this review with how this turns out.

reviewText: I am typing on it right now.  The letters are lit up.  The letters are large.  Yes, you can hear the keys while typing, which might be annoying if you have to share your room with another person and the typing sound gets on their nerves.  But I do not have another person in my room to annoy, so I am fine.  I find the keys are very smooth.  The price was excellent.  Also, you can change the colors of the led light.  I like the blue, but you can choose red or purple also.  If you hold the light button, the light will turn off.  I matched it with a blue glowing wired mouse and blue glowing speakers.  All of it gives a cozy glow in the evenings and you can see the keyboard without having to have the lights on.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Got this in November 2014 and the ' D ' key lettering began to crumble off exposing the clear plastic underneath (that the led shines through) turning it into a big ole square. To my amazement when I called AZIO's support toll free number 1) it was immediately answered 2) when I stated the reason for the call the gentleman said 'sure no problem' and asked was the D key the only issue after saying yes he asked if I was a gamer,  said yes and he said okay I'm going to send the W,S,A,D and also the Q & E just give me the address and is there anything else? Now folks you can't beat that. Gotta bad key? call 866-468-1198 bingo new keys no fuss no muss no questions.  Only have had the ALT stick and a very small kb brush got the lint out that was causing it. For the price and useability Highly Recommend this large key backlit kb.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Great Keyboard....
This keyboard is connected through the USB port of your computer. It has a number of different back colors, were intensity can be controlled with a wheel built in to the keyboard. The color gets changed by push button.
The back light is very helpful for people that have their room light dimmed for whatever reason this may be. The large marked keys are easy to find. So, for me, no more switching light on to find the proper key. I can watch movies and shows on my computer and find my keyboard easily.
Some people stated that the key feedback would be great, I disagree with that statement. They make noise, but don't have a tactile feedback.
The keys themselves, have a smeary appearance. They look as if they were dirty from inside, guess this is low quality standards.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The only two things I don't like are the keys look "dirty" if you're not directly above them and the keys are a bit large.  If you're not a slouch like me the dirty key thing shouldn't be an issue.  As for the large keys I guess that was in the description but wow they are large.  It's a little like learning to retype again.  I find myself hitting any combination of CAPS Lock, left CTRL, Windows Key, and left ALT frequently.  Everything else I've already relearned.  The color selection is great, can be turned on/off easily and brightness is easily adjustable.  The overall size and weight of the board is just fine.  I would sort of like to see the keyboard lights shutdown after a period of unuse though.  Some of the extra buttons don't seem useful/functional/programmable although I don't normally use those anyway on a laptop.  The calculator button works though and I use that all of the time.
summary: Pretty great backlit keyboard.  Take a little patience with its large keys.

reviewText: Great for folks with visual disabilities!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Gee thanks guys.  Thanks a lot.  Mr. W ordered this puppy to make it easier to type in a dimly lit home office.  Mrs. W saw the PURPLE color and said "ORDER ME ONE NOW!!!".  (Well, not her EXACT words....)  If you have read other Wingnut reviews, you know what her favorite color is.  Well, it's more than a favorite color --  it's more like an obsession to re-buy everything in the house in a purple color.  It's a nice, full sized keyboard.  Keys are initially a bit stiff and sticky, but hitting each key a couple times did the trick.  Yep, definitely worth twenty bucks.  Except now I have to order a second one for the Mrs.  It's fairly heavy, feels sturdy, and has small feet on the back for those that hate flat keyboard typing.  It's wired with a USB connector, so no dealing with batteries failing.  Plugnplay with Windows 8.1.
summary: Decent keyboard for us old geezers with lousy vision !!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Very impressed with the early arrival time in a well insulation filled box.  Exactly as advertised and very happy with my purchase.  Only minor problem is the non-raised dial for adding light or removing light.  It takes a little getting used to but once you get it right there is no problem.  I did cover the keys with water based polyurethane to protect the repetition of key strokes.  So far no problem while playing RPG video games and lots of chatting emails.  No problem with key stoke noise as some have complained about and no double or lost letters while typing.  I love this key board and will tell others to buy it.  So many to choose from, good luck on your choice.
summary: Best choice I have made concerning a key board.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I've only used it a few days, but it has made a positive change in my life. I have never been a touch typist. Many have told me I am a pecker, I need to see the keys (but I'm sure that's not what they meant, since they have never seen me type).  I no longer have to turn on the lights in order to while away on the computer at night, which pleases my not insignificant other. I'm never sure if she's happier that I don't have the lights on when performing ... my computering OR she's happy that I can use the computer instead of bothering her in bed. She also calls me a pecker but she's seen me type.

Hitting the keys is mildly noisy, but she wears ear plugs to drown the sounds of traffic, the incessantly yapping neighbors' dog, the exaltations from the newlyweds next door, and the random gunshots ...  outside. I actually like the sound of the keys, it makes my think I'm actually doing some work. The illuminated letters, numbers, and symbols are large and clear. The symbols on the hotkeys on the top row should be a bit larger. The only button not illuminated is the one for changing the color (blue, red, purple), which is of no consequence.

The only mild complaint is the size and weight of the keyboard. It is heavier and larger than the keyboard it replaces. I use of of those bed wedges sold by Amazon so I can sit up in bed and use the bedroom TV as a monitor, even though there are much more enjoyable uses of both a bed and bed wedges. The keyboard leaves little room for my mouse on the lapdesk. I spend considerable time groping around trying to locate my errant mouse (at least that's what I tell my not insignificant other, unless it's upside down, the mouse, that is.

All in all, except for my personal pecadildos, I would recommend this to others. Of course this is only after a few days of satisfied use. Durability may cause me to refine my assessment.
summary: I'm never sure if she's happier that I don't have the lights on when performing

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Wife loves it. Still works great. No troubles. Hooks up easily and works as it should. I would like it to be a little quieter when typing, but that is minor.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
