title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I basically wanted a keyboard that would work well enough for me to play games (keyboard+mouse) without having to turn on a light.
This keyboard does that as well as can be expected.
I haven't used it much, so can't really attest to the long-life quality of the illumination or the keys. (will update review when that time comes)

The keys are most definitely not mechanical - they are soft - like a low-end laptop.  I thought it was going to be problematic, but then again I don't use the computer for heavy-duty word processing.  Works perfectly ok for e-mails and whatnot.
I am mostly used to the Logitech solar or their other wireless keyboard sets.  Where they aren't mechanical, but have a bit stiffer response on the keys.  This keyboard types very similar to the Microsoft Desktop 800 set:  http://www.amazon.com/dp/B003SVSJ1K

So while it won't win any design awards - it works exactly as expected - and for a price less than $30 - the 4 star rating is accurate.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Very nice colors and is very ergonomic!

Excellent to type long papers on.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I've had this for a month now and overall it is a good keyboard, well constructed. I have one issues that several folks have mentioned. There is something about how the keys are placed that make it easy to mistype. I seem to miss-hit keys way more often with this keyboard layout than my old keyboard. With the keys having less travel, wider key tops and spaced closer together it slows down my typing. My fingers seem to always be slipping over the key top and depressing the next key. I would say I'm a average typist  but it seems harder to correctly strike the keys without looking, less forgiving than my previous keyboard. I like the lighted keys but I'm not sure it's worth the speed reduction in typing. So thumbs up for construction, ergonomics & lighted keyboard but lose one star for usability.

[11/12/15 update] I've used this keyboard for 6 months now and I've lowered it one star for one overriding fact, the keys. These low depression chick-let style keys have caused the number of miss typed words to skyrocket. I can't type a complete sentence without a extra <CR> or letter being inserted somewhere. Not much space between keys and if your finger is not exactly in the middle of the key a slight key depression off center gets the next key over letter. Love the LED keyboard but moving back to a standard keyboard.
summary: Well constructed keyboard, love the lighted keys but for actual typing, it kinda sucks...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: If you have bad eyesight and use your computer at night and day, this is the way to go.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great for me. I do not need any other lights on in the room saving money on electrical cost.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love this keyboard. The letters are a lot bigger than any I have ever had before which is a treat to my aging eyes and I'm usually on the computer at night with just the screen as light so the lighted letters and numbers are an very added plus to this purchase. Three different likable colors that I switch every now and then just for the fun of it, red being my favorite color of the three. Well worth the price "affordable" and I haven't had any problems with the keys sticking. The keys make the average noise when typing in which I'm used to anyhow.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Nice large letters that are easy on the eyes.  Three colors to chose from (red, blue, pinkish).  I change every now and then just for a "change".I have "heavy" fingers from using a mechanical typewriter for 30 years before computers and keyboards became ubiquitous and it handles my heavy fingers well.
summary: Nice large letters that are easy on the eyes

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's a decent keyboard, very compact which I wanted, and the backlighting is sufficiently bright, with the oversized key printing making it easy to read if you're not a touch typist (I can type, but the large keys do look nice).  I also like that you can turn off the illumination by holding down the color change button for at least 3 seconds, so if you have the keyboard in an area where you may want darkness, you won't have the keyboard lighting up your room when it's unused.  The keys are very low profile, more so than a typical desktop keyboard, but not quite as much as a laptop, so it may cause you to miskey sometimes.  Also, for some reason, I can't quite get used to the layout of the INS/HM/DEL.... keys.  It's very different than my Logitech K350 keyboard, which I've grown accustomed to and quite fond of, so I can never use those keys without having to look down at the keyboard.  Another gripe is that I am not able to find drivers for this keyboard model.  I went to the manufacturer's website, and there are driver for other models, but not this one. Because of that, all of the multimedia keys do not work, and there's no way to program/assign the few that do.  Volume and mute work, but none of the play/pause keys for music or video apps.  The browser home key does work, and it will work with your default browser, the button to open a new browser works also, but it creates a separate window instead of adding a tab to Chrome.  It would be nice if the multimedia keys all worked, which I really like to use to pause/skip tracks, but it wasn't a deal breaker.  So just be aware, the keys are very flat, and you probably won't be able to find drivers to help with keys that aren't working.  One more thing, the small rubber feet along the front edge fell off.  The 1st one fell off within a day or two, and I was constantly sticking it back on (it had some sticky residue on it) but the problem is that they are so woefully skinny, that there is just not enough contact area to make a secure stick to the bottom of the keyboard.  I should have used some hot glue, but I just kept putting it off, so now both of my feet are gone and the keyboard will slide easily on my wooding keyboard tray.  Other than those small gripes, it's a decent keyboard for a very low price.
summary: It gets the job done, with some caveats

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This multicolor back-lit keyboard arrived just as advertised.  The keys are large & friendly, and are easy to press.  They are not chiclet-style keys but are low-depth regular style, which is as advertised.  So, the keys are slightly noisier than chiclet keys but they are easy to press & are fluid nonetheless - and they might possibly be easier to clean than chiclets.  I actually think the colors look even prettier on the actual keyboard than they do in the pictures.  The yellow color doesn't seem as loud and has an interesting & eye-catching hue of green also.  The turquoise has a compelling aquamarine tropical tone.  Seems the green tone comes out on the yellow & turquoise colors when the lighting is dimmed via the wheel. The blue is a perfect standard color, but with just a slight hint of a midnight afterglow.  In fact all the colors come through  to splendid effect & are eye-catching, but not loud, & easy on the eyes.  Very beautiful colors indeed.  The brightness wheel is a nice touch too: I like this feature.  The three-color version doesn't have the brightness wheel though I don't suppose that would matter much for people who are looking for a well-lit keyboard.  The function keys are grouped, also a nice design touch, and there's also a calculator key which I do find useful also.  The layout of the keyboard is perfect in my opinion.  I also do like the spacing of the keys.  There's ample room between keys & I can maneuver my fingers adequately.  Back-lit keyboards have been known to have a key coat that wears off with usage so we'll see how well the key lettering holds up.  But beautiful color rendering and well-developed design make this keyboard interesting and fun to use.
summary: Color rendering really steals the show with this keyboard & the design is perfect for standard usage too!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I purchased mine through Fry's Electronics.  This review is twofold because this is my second keyboard.  The first one worked fine for about 3 hours, then the CPU got hot and the computer shut down.  After that, the keys didn't work no matter which USB port I used.  I took it to two other computers and it made both shut down.  One was running Linux and the other Windows 10. .  It  was only intermittently recognized when plugged in, so I couldn't always type on it.  Then it got stuck on the letter H when I was trying to type a password that had no Hs in it!  So, I gave up on it and rather than going for a refund, I asked for a replacement.  This one is the one that gets 4 stars because I like it, and it's working fine and not making my systems unstable.  What's good is that all 5 colors are vivid, with the brightness choosable using a turn wheel, and the lighting highlights the letters, which are large, perfect for presbyopics.  I can now type at night with the light off so I don't disturb my husband.
summary: When it works, it's quite good.

I didn't buy this to type a lot of keys, just the right ones.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I ordered this keyboard as an aid to not being able to see the keys on my old one in dim light. I can't touch type so I need to see. The lights were great, but the keyboard had sticking and non responding keys right out of the box. Thankfully there is an undo command for my email. I hit the delete key to remove one message and it promptly wiped out the entire inbox because the key stuck, but not in a visible way that I could see and pull it up. Then the R and the S didn't work at all. The other keys were random, some worked, some didn't, some stuck. I had to plug the old one back in to type a message to Amazon to return it.

I returned it immediately for a full refund (thank you for standing behind products Amazon!), but I am going to try once more to get one that works. I really liked the lights and large print. My dream keyboard is wireless, backlit and large print with dedicated multimedia hot keys (that don't require 2 hands to use, as in FN + another key like the Logitech ones) NO one makes one with all these features. I have searched and searched. If someone knows of one I would be pleased to hear it!

My new one should ship today so I will update this review or write another when it arrives. This company needs to find out the run numbers on these bad ones and get them off the market!

*********************UPDATE DEC 2016*********************************
I received the "newer" version of this keyboard that is all blue keys as pictured (my original review was for the multicolored one). Worked great at first, but now is not registering every key stroke and the light turns of randomly while I am typing. I have to pretty well stomp the keys to be sure they all register, and then be sure to proofread everything I write very carefully. I have already corrected 3 mistakes in the above sentence due to letters not registering! Roughly 4 months. That's pretty crappy life span for a person that types a few little ditties on Facebook and the occasional email. If someone who actually types a lot had this it would have failed much sooner I am sure.

I just checked and I am past the Amazon return window so I am now stuck with it or at the mercy of whatever warranty the company offers. Wasted my money. I will have to drag out the old Compaq keyboard that I have used since 1999 or so. The keys were starting to stick on that finally and I wanted backlit for my tired eyes. Guess I will keep on searching.
summary: 1st one defective out of box, 2nd failing in 4 months!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I have one of thoses pull out drawers under my desk for the computer keyboard. I never realized just how dark it was to type when using my computer. But one day it dawned on me to replace it with a lighted keyboard.
So... I of course researched Amazon and found "this three colored lighted keyboard". Although it generally rated well, there still were reviews all over the place which made me reluctant at first. Sticky keys seemed to be the big issue. Hmmm....
Well one person complained about this but said he removed the offending keys and lubricated them with small amount of petroleum jelly. This made his keyboard the greatest thing since sliced bread.
So it least there seemed to be a potential cure of this product dilemma, and I ordered one.
It came and I hooked it up and mine seems to be fine out of the box with no problems at all.
Surprisingly (at least to me) is that the purple color is the most usable out of the three colors. Blue and red are too intense and the purple (more lilac really) seems gentler on the eyes. The keyboard does default to blue when starting up, but no big deal.
Based on my experience and most current reviews, the sticky key issue seems to have been addressed.
If you need a lighted USB keyboard, I highly recommend this as it is inexpensive and is of high quality.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
If you're like me and your eyesight isn't as good as it used to be, you might be interested in hearing about a large print backlit keyboard that I recently received for review.

Its the Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard, and I really like it.

This wired USB keyboard has over-sized, backlit letters that are extremely easy to see, even when you're sitting in total darkness. That makes it great for night owls who enjoy using their computer while their significant other sleeps nearby in a darkened bedroom.

Since its currently selling for less than $25 on Amazon, I didn't know what to expect from this keyboard in terms of quality, but after plugging it in and trying it out, I can tell you that it seems to be well-built. And the three year warranty gives me a warm, fuzzy feeling.

This keyboard is heavier than the typical modern computer keyboard, and I like that because the extra weight helps keep it from sliding around while Im typing. Im guessing the added weight is due to the extra components that perform the backlighting.

Theres a button located on the upper right-hand corner of the keyboard that, when pressed, changes the backlight color from blue to red to purple each time you press it.

After trying all three colors, I decided to leave it set to purple because that color seems to provide the most contrast. Pressing and holding the color change button for three seconds turns off the backlighting altogether. Pressing the same button again turns the backlighting back on.

In addition to the oversized backit keys (which I love!), there is also a row of Hotkey buttons above the function keys that perform a variety of functions.

After using this keyboard for a while, I have found that the only Hotkey buttons I use on a regular basis are the ones that raise and lower the speaker volume, open the My Computer dialog, and take me to my browers home page. Im sure plenty of other folks will find the remaining buttons useful as well however.

One thing that I really should mention is this isn't a silent keyboard. The keys make a definite clicking sound when pressed.

This clicking sound is no louder than the clicks you hear with most regular keyboards, but if you plan to use it while someone else is trying to sleep, the slight noise could be a problem if that person happens to be a very light sleeper.

Bottom line: Overall, I really like this keyboard. I do enjoy working with the light in my office turned off on occasion, and the large, backlit keys make it extremely easy and comfortable to do so. In my opinion, this is a great keyboard for the money.
summary: This is a great keyboard for the money.

reviewText:
I have been using this keyboard for 2 monhts. I have to agree with some of the other reviews, when you first get this, the keys are strikingly big. HOWEVER, the reason I bought this keyboard is so at night, specifically I can see keys without having all the lights on in my office. IT DOES THAT PERFECTLY. If the keys were smaller the light would not be effective.

So for me, this keyboard has been great, no issues, great colors, the capability to dim and shut off the keyboard light if necessary.the extra function keys are cool as well. The only thing I can think of that might make for a feature is "custom" function keys.

My only con for the keyboard is the portion of the keyboard directly below the keys is a flat soft black, thats nice, but, it also has like a cross pattern that tends to capture dust etc.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I chose this keyboard because I have impaired vision. I'm not a gamer, so I don't need lots of fancy options. All I wanted was to be able to see the keyboard without straining my eyes - and the KB506 delivers.

Things I like about it:

* The selection of backlight colors.
* Ability to fine-tune the brightness level of the keys to match the room lighting.
* Comfortable wrist rest.

The keys do sound and feel a bit different (before this I was using the EasyEyes keyboard), but that's easy to get used to. Overall, I'm very pleased with it.
summary: The first keyboard that has everything I need!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Got the keyboard on date they said it would arrive, a Sunday. Was packaged in a regular box. Had some paper in it, but the paper wouldn't do anything to protect the keyboard. Getting the black box out of the outer box proved to be a little difficult. It is quite a tight fit. Opened up the black box and WOW those are some big letters! Even with the light off you can see how big the letters are. Plugged it into my KVM switch and on comes the light. Now you really can see the letters. Did I mention that they are some big letters?

 The keys make a little noise when typing on them, but I tend to be hard on a keyboard, so, you may not experience the noise. They feel great, easy to type with. The keys are fairly level with each other from row to row, sort of like a laptop keyboard. The keyboard does  have legs in the back that raise it, for me, a comfortable level. It does have rubber rectangles on the bottom and doesn't seem to move while typing.

 The one I bought has 5 colors, turquoise, green, blue, red and purple . Each color has a different light level to it, just because of the color. I personally like the turquoise and blue. My keyboard came with a disk on the upper right hand side, next to the light button, of the keyboard. This allows you to dim then level of light. So you can dim the light if you want to. I read in other comments and questions if you could dim the light, everyone said no, but I can. If you feel the need to turn off the light you just hold down the light button for about 3 seconds or so and the light turns off. To turn it back on, just push the light button and the light will come back on. Even in a well lit room, you still can see the colors of the keyboard.

 Special keys at the top. I rarely have any luck with these keys. I run Linux Ubuntu 14.04 64bit. Most keyboard software, if not all of it, is for Windows. However, I gave them a try. The E-mail button does open my E-mail program, and then was much rejoicing. The Home button doesn't work. The star button, no idea what it really is for, just makes my browser bar in Chrome go away and come back.  The next set of keys are for audio. The play button works, but does not call up my music player. The previous button works. The next button works. The stop button works. The next set of buttons are for volume control. The first one to turn down the volume works. The next one to turn up the volume works. The third button, the mute button works fine. The next pair of buttons look like music and computer. The music button does not bring up my music player. The second button, that looks like a monitor, bring up my files windows, which would be like your explorer window. The final button all the way to the right is a calculator button, it brings up my calculator just fine. Over all, with past experiences with these types of buttons, I am extremely please that most of them work. I am hoping to eventually get all of them to work.

 I was down to 6 keyboards that light up. Two of them had only five star ratings, but only five reviews. The others had a higher percentage of one star ratings than this one. Overall I am extremely satisfied with this keyboard. I also bought the extended 2 year warranty. I haven't found any problems with it yet. I would and will recommend this keyboard to anyone looking for a light up keyboard or an easy to see keyboard. Did I mention the really big letters?

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
After using this for nearly a year I started having a tiny bit of trouble with one of the keys hanging if I didn't hit it squarely in the center of the key. I do a bit of gaming and use the W key for movement all the time. Without solid action on that key you can die a lot. Reluctantly I started looking for a replacement. In reading the one-star reviews for several other keyboards I started feeling really lucky that I wasn't having any of "those" problems but I needed a W key that wouldn't have issues. I decided to spray a tiny bit of WD40 on that key and it works great again.

I love this keyboard and can't believe what a bargain price it is.

The keys are not quiet but that isn't a problem for me. It is wired which is not a problem for me (and I don't have to worry about the wireless problems with connectivity and going to sleep). So, a little WD40 fixed the only issue I had and I'm a happy camper again.
summary: WD40 will give it new life

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am coming off of a mechanical 1985 Gateway keyboard.....  Yes, it was finally time to get something new.... one key was sticking, and the letters were finally coming off due to game play.

I like typing on this keyboard.  Sounds are similar.... at least there is some noise.... I have used other KBs that were just plain quiet, and did not like it.  The keys are a little closer together, and my hands are large - it did not take long to get used to .... still OK.

The letters are LARGE.... yea.  I am at the point where I am needing reading glasses.... this puts that off for a while ... lol.  You can have NO back lighting of the keys, or, you can set them to Red, Blue, Purple with the push of a button.  Hold the button, and all colors shut off.  **  update  **  You will need to have the key light turned on.  There is no "white" key labels when the lights go out.  It will be too dark for you to see...especially if you are getting this keyboard because of your eyes.

I plugged it in and the drivers loaded... I am using Windows 7.

Special keys above the function keys are nice.... I clicked on the mail button and BAM, my email came up.  Click on home and BAM, ,my home page loaded.  A nice touch.

I played my FPS game..... and found that it played well.  It was similar to my old Gateway KB.

The keyboard has some weight to it.... so it has a 'value' feel to it.

This is still early, but I must say that I like the keyboard thus far.

My star ding is primarily for the hand rest.... it is not removable, and I find that for me it interferes with the space bar.....not a biggie, but for me I'd like to see it moved down away from the space bar.  ** update**  Now I see why I mentioned this... the keys are not much higher than the hand rest.  If you place a ruler from top to the bottom of the keyboard, the keys are only about 1/8 inch above the bottom of the ruler.

Also, the cord is short vs other keyboards that I have used..  It's OK, and for me it worked because my setup is close to the USB connection.  The cord length is one the short side of 5 feet long... .  The cord comes out of the right top portion of the keyboard.  Measure your current keyboard cord, and try this length to see if your setup will work with this keyboard.

Overall this is a nice keyboard.  And, for the price, I like it a lot.

**** Update 8/15/2015 ****  Three of the keys are losing the paint, so, I cannot see what the letter is.  Only been eight months..... soon will need another, and will look for an alternative.
summary: Replaced my Original 80s Gateway KB.....Good value.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Overall, an excellent keyboard for the money.  Of all the under $20 keyboards I've bought in the last 10 years (12) or new PCs I've bought this has to be the best keyboards so far.

I've lately chosen these illuminated-style keyboards because to me they are a sort of throwback to the days when the letter on each key was a cast-in actual letter rather than some cheap paint that wears off after a few months.  I spend 8 to 12 hours each day using keyboards on multiple computers as part of my job so tactile feedback and clear lettering are important.  Previous illuminated keyboards I've tried have had poor layouts where the backspace key or the return/enter key were not well placed or shaped for my expectations and the keys were wobbly or lacked good tactile feedback (in my 50th year of using keyboards nearly every day!).

Frankly, I wasn't expecting this keyboard to be an improvement but based on other reviewers comments, and the fact that Azio makes some products for Gamers, which means to me that they consider durability important, I decided to try two of these since I have two workstations I use every day, one through a 4 port KVM switch.  So far these keyboards have proved to excellent.

The key feel is excellent with the keys exhibiting no wobble and having a light but solid feel and just enough travel to ensure good tactile feedback.

This keyboard is superior to some of the name brand products I've tried from Microsoft and Logitech.  Admittedly, my trials of the Microsoft and Logitech keyboards were for some of their cheapest products and I still like those brands for many hardware products (Love my Harmony Remote from Logitech!) but this Azio keyboard is easily their equal or better in quality and features.

I thought the colored backlighting was theatrical rather than functional - I was really looking for key lettering that couldn't rub off - but I already like the illumination.  If you type like I do where you're moving back and forth between mousing for things and digging through paperwork and then going back to the keyboard then you'll appreciate the illumination as a bright visual clue to hand position.  I like that a lot already.  I had envisioned leaving the illumination off (Thanks to another reviewer for pointing out how to turn it off!) but now find I like it. The large letters make this an easy keyboard to return to from doing other tasks at my desks.

Time will tell how durable these keyboards are but they feel great and look great now!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Mute button didn't work at first. The mute button is great for killing those darn pop-up noisy adverts.

So I unplugged the old keyboard, leaving just a single keyboard, re-booted. No problem now.

I'm a heavy-duty typer, but I do glance at the keyboard from time to time. The N key had entirely worn off the old keyboard, and typing in a dark room was iffy. The new one seems ok for now. The keys are somewhat nicely dimpled, despite reports from some reviewers that they were "flat".  And they'll never have the nice feel of the old steel IBM PC keyboards, made in America by Americans, what a novel idea...

I must recommend this to my mother, who has macular degeneration.

It is great to have a USB cable connexion. That way you don't end up with dead batteries and wireless pairing problems.

That's all I have after two days. The rest of the reviews cover it completely. Five stars for the super price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love this keyboard! I have low vision and this keyboard is a blessing. I have problems with certain types of lighting so I usually work in a low light setting and this lighted keyboard makes it very easy to see my keyboard. I have good typing skills, but some days I just need to see what I am doing. This is a multi-media keyboard, so you can control your music volume, mute the sound, access the internet, and your favorites menu. The functions such as Page up have been abbreviated (Page Up is shown as "PU"). I love the light function (Blue, Red, very Light Purple). I was use to using the smaller keys, but it was very easy to make the adjustment to the larger keys and it was much more comfortable because my hands were in more of a natural position. I would definitely recommend this keyboard to anyone with vision problems.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Just out of the box - very impressed. Will update with use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I believe this keyboard does everything that the description claimed. I like it. The keys are large, which is great for my large hands. The colors are fun, and the keyboard even has a few keys that my factory supplied keyboard didn't have, like a calculator link key that pulls up the calculator in the computer and pops it onto the screen. I haven't found a way to put my computer to sleep from the keyboard as easily as my old keyboard... Also, I wish I could figure out how to have my outlook mail pop up when I hit the mail key. To do that, I somehow need to program the key to go to a web link... I like all the colors, although the yellow is a bit greenish. Also, my fingers have rather thick skin, so it is difficult to feel the little bumps on the F and the J keys. I'm going to put a little dab of epoxy on them myself...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Works fantastic. At first I thought the letters looked too light in the daytime, so how was I going to see them at night. The actual letters light up on this, not just light around them. Each of the five colors are great, very attractive. You can set the brightness and color you want, or even turn it off. I do not think the keys are loud like some other reviews say. You should hear a manual typewriter. I think this was a great investment. Just what I needed.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Love this keyboard. The large print suits me well. Even if I did have better eyesight, I just think the large print looks good. I know some people have commented on the print being ridiculously large, but go big or go home, I say. I like it. The colors are good, too. The red is like a cherry red. The blue is more like a cerulean, though. So don't get this thinking that it will be a dark blue or a royal blue. The purple is lighter than I imagined as well. More light-pinkish almost, with just enough hint of red and blue to call it purple.

Overall, I recommend this. And I would probably recommend their newest model, which has five colors I believe. That model wasn't out when I bought this one, but I'm perfectly fine with this one. Types smoothly. Keys are low, almost like laptop keys (which I prefer), and it has all the media keys that I use - music player keys (play/pause, back, forward, stop), volume up and down and a mute, a my document/computer key, and a calculator button. Great buy, and it didn't cost me as much as I thought it would to get a keyboard I really enjoy.
summary: Great keyboard for a good price

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: awesome keyboard for playing games at night

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
WOW, INCREDIBLE KEYBOARD. I am blown away with this beautiful smooth typing, sleek, illuminated keyboard. I will never purchase any other brand again. I type a lot and go through keyboards every 3 to 6 months because the keys stick or the letters wear out, ts not only smart looking but its also smart with features I have never seen in any keyboard.

Launch email client, internet browser home, add page to favorites, play/pause, back-track, next track, stop, decrease volume, increase volume, mute volume, launch video player, launch music player, go to my computer, launch calculator and change back light color. I CHOSE THE MODEL WITH A CHOICE OF THREE COLORS, RED, BLUE AND VIOLET, all easy on the eyes too. You can choose the one with 5 color options, three is plenty for me.

Its a computer all by its self, and because I usually type at night there are three back light colors that are bright lighting the entire keyboard. Unlike other boards I purchased claiming the keys light, but they never did, not like this one. I just love it.

Even with all the features, its low priced and packs a punch with quality.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I'm previewing Windows 10, and the really nice LED USB keyboard I had been using for some odd reason was totally unusable with it.  So I started looking for alternatives, since I don't like the fluorescent lights in my office, so I have them removed from the fixtures.  So it's nice to have an illuminated keyboard for cloudy days, or in the winter when the days are shorter and there's less ambient light.

I liked the fact that this had three colors, but oddly enough, there's no off option short of unplugging it.  I use a Thinkpad Yoga tablet computer, so I have this plugged into a USB 3 docking station, not directly into the computer.  Since that's always on, this is lit all the time.  I would've liked to have seen the color cycle selector also include an "off" option.

The LED clear parts for the lettering was really bad, lots of striations so there's a lot of lines in the letters, it's not just one smooth, consistent glow unless you're directly over it looking straight down.

The space bar is a bit below the level of the back edge of the front curved palm rest - which is a horrible design since every time I hit the space bar, the joint on my thumb hits that plastic.  After a while of fast touch typing, it begins to get a bit sore and annoying.

The LED's for num lock, caps lock, and scroll lock are very, very recessed in the case, so you can barely even see the indicator lights unless you're directly above looking down. Right now, with it on my desk in a "normal" position in front of me, even in a dark room with no sun out (pre-dawn) and no lights in my office I can barely tell the num lock is on from my typing position.

Key travel is a bit mushy, but not so much so that it would have impacted my rating had there been no other problems.

All told, this was returned very, very quickly.  I had used it long enough to write this review and then set up the return to Amazon right after that.  Oddly enough, the replacement unit I chose was also an Azio, which earned four stars.  So it's not necessarily a problem with the company and their products overall, just this one keyboard that I really couldn't stand.
summary: Bad rise in palmrest means banging the thumb joint on it every time you hit the space bar

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I LOVE this keyboard! My husband has a gaming keyboard that lights up and I wanted one too. This little baby is a gem at $24.99! (His was 3x the cost as it had a lot of gaming features). I bought one for myself as I wanted a keyboard that lit up to make the letters easier to see  when I am typing in the dark. I periodically change the colors between the purple, blue, and red,; a nice function. My husband's light up keyboard is only blue. I have had this keyboard for 2 years and have not had any problems with it.

I subsequently purchased a keyboard for my in-laws. They don't have the best eye sight and had trouble typing.  not only is it helpful that the keyboard lights up, but the large print is a great benefit to them. The letters are twice the size of a normal keyboard, making it way easier to see. Now they are fighting over who uses the desktop instead of the laptop.

I would highly recommend this keyboard for anyone that wants to see the letters a little easier, has poor eye sight, is elderly, likes colors, likes to type in low light/dark, or pretty much anybody!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
First the pros.
a. The font on the keys is large and easy to see, even sans glasses.
b. The colors are good and are not so bright that they are annoying.
c. If you turn the backlight off, it stays off even after a reboot.
d. The hot keys are handy.

The cons:
1. The action of the keys is, frankly, poor. It takes a deliberate effort to ensure that the press of the keys is sufficient.
2. The "dip" in the keys could be deeper to keep your fingers in place. (although this might be an issue for the lettering).

Perhaps the action will free up in time. If not... I'd not buy another.
summary: A good idea with less than adequate execution.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: If you really have vision problems, this is for you. I don't, so I decided to return it and got another Azio keyboard. I just liked that they lit up, but you could land a plane by these keyboard lights! So if you really have vision issues, or need to see in the dark, then this will definitely work for you. Be warned, this keyboard is enormous. So just make sure it's what you need. Azio has another one that still lights up, but is not so bright or big, which is what I got to replace this one. It's a great keyboard, just not what I wanted. The Azio prism is 2nd one I ordered, and it's much more what I was looking for.  Also note that this keyboard is NOT a scissor mechanism. It is membrane with shorter keys. I know that matters for some. It was a bit louder to type than what I'm used to.
summary: Good if you really have vision issues

reviewText:
Great product, I really like this keyboard. The only problem is the colors. I didn't like blue and red colors. White color in

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I ordered two of these keyboards. The first, had keys that "stuck" and were hard to press. I found myself missing a lot of keys when typing. Not good for a programmer. I returned it to Amazon and bought another from a third-party seller. That one seemed fine, until around 30 - 45 days and keys started sticking again. I called Azio customer support and the rep told me that there was a bad batch of keyboards manufactured that had keys that were molded .5 - 1mm off spec. He did an advanced replacement for me and the new keyboard seems much more fluid than either of the old. Impressively, in the box with the advanced replacement was a prepaid return label, a card thanking me for my business, and a roll of Smarties candy. This was better support than I've received from the majority of manufacturers out there. Now on to the keyboard.

The keyboard itself is decent. Not as solidly built as a MS Sidewinder or eluminX, but sturdier than a logitech K120. It has a similar form factor to the sidewinder, and if I didn't know any better, I may call it a Sidewinder "clone" at 1/3 the price. The surface of the keyboard (not the keys) is a rubberized material, as found on some mice these days. Not sure if it adds any traction, but does get shiny in spots from the oils in my fingertips.  Not a big deal. There are nipples on the F, ,J, and 5 (keypad) keys for those proper typists out there. I don't use the macro keys so can't comment on those, but the keyboard works fine in MacOS otherwise. I don't find myself having any difficulty with typing, but I'm used to the likes of laptop-ish eluminX and non-standard Sidewinder keyboards.

The illumination is awesome. The large print keys are awesome also, Who'd have ever guessed to make letters that fill the size of the key instead of tiny print in the upper left corner? Not everyone is a 20 year old Californian with perfect vision and a state mandated tribal armband tattoo. These keys are visible, and dimmable via the dial in the upper right. Cyan or Yellow works well during the day for extra visibility, and red or purple or any other color for night.

The only thing "weird" about the keys is that on keys with a caps function (E.g., 8 *, or 5 %), the caps character is at the bottom of the key instead of the top. When typing in a drunken or otherwise impaired stupor, I find myself second-guessing sometimes ... "Wait, do I hold shift for a curly brace or square bracket?? I can't remember!!"

I just tried out the media keys in MacOS and the following work for iTunes: play/pause, vol +/-, skip back, skip fwd, and mute. Shortcuts and macros don't seem to work out of the box. Not sure if there is software or configuration required.

All in all this keyboard is worth the price I think. I'll update in 30-45 days and see how the keys hold up and if they start to stick at all. But for right now they're smooth.

UPDATE: 10/28/2014
Still no issues. The replacement is still going strong. I've played a little Skyrim with it and it works fine, of course, I'm no Korean Starcraft player executing 180 moves per minute.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I was replacing the standard keyboard from my HP desktop.
Pros: Well lit keys, easy to read.
Cons:
1) The keys require a much stronger typing motion than the standard keyboard. Often i miss characters in words because i am not pushing down hard enough. It is very annoying. I am constantly correcting spelling on common words.
2) The key height is much shorter than a standard keyboard. If you look at the keyboard from the side, the keys are maybe only 1/16 inch higher than the keyboard case itself. For me this made it more difficult to find the keys, since the gap between the keys is less discernible.
3) the SHIFT characters (below and right of the numbers) are hard to get used to.
summary: YUCK! Very different key feel from standard keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The keys are about as thick as a plastic butter tub and feel like the same material, accuracy is terrible because the keys are low profile and inconsistent for actuation pressure. You may have to smash one to get it to move but the one right next to it has no troubles moving so both end up getting pressed. I would say the company needs to focus on inspections and quality control.

Follow up: I have no faith in Amazon 5 start reviews anymore. To me it seems like people who are ok with made in China junk are driving these reviews. This keyboard for instance is a complete waste of money and falls in line with all the other 1 star reviews about the keyboard: made of low density polyethelene that warps and mashes other keys in normal use. This is NOT even of sufficient quality to call it a "home office" keyboard, in fact it would be drive the cost of doing business up because you have to correct the errors the keyboard causes.

QUALITY IS PART OF VALUE! When the quality is so bad you throw it away at less than 10% of the life of a comparable keyboard for the same price, it is no value.
summary: The price is to make you think its a legit product, its a disposable though.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard is a great buy, especially for the money spent.  There are two items I need to mention about design and quality control.  First, the volume buttons are reversed, meaning the + button actually is placed on the left, and lowers the volume.  The - buttons, on the right, actually increases the volume.  I've tried to remove and swap them, but they won't budge, so they may be part of a continuous rubber membrane underneath the plastic template.  This should not have left the factory this way.  I may have to return the keyboard for a replacement.

Secondly, the flip-out tabs on the bottom rear do not raise the keyboard very high.  This leaves the board essentially still in a "flat" horizontal position, which is cumbersome while typing.  I had to add some material under the tabs to make the rear higher.  I should not have to make this adjustment either.  Otherwise, the switchable colors and lettering is easy to see, even in the dark.  The key presses and feel are good, so the keyboard is very useable.
summary: This keyboard is a great buy, especially for the money spent

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I got this keyboard because it was a good price for back lighting. In the past I've paid 3x what this keyboard cost just to have the letters fade away in less than a year. At this price, that's OK. At $60 it's not.

Pros:
I can read this without my glasses day or night.
The layout is standard.
Color change button is easy to use.
The replacement keyboard is still a little clunkier than I'm used to, but I've been on my laptop so much that a regular keyboard feels weird.

Cons
I had to order a replacement because the first keyboard was defective. Normally I'd not take a star off for that, but since the manufacturer knows of the defect and still sells the bad lot through Amazon Azio is losing a star. That's just crappy customer service, and I'm now forced to drop the bad one off at the UPS store to be returned to Amazon. It's not fair to Amazon or to me the consumer.

EDIT (a few weeks later)
Screw this keyboard. I am sending it back too. The 2nd one was better than the first, but it's just not useful. I'm a writer. I don't need to backspace every other word because the keys stick, which causes more typos than it does correct words. Glad I kept my 4 year old Microsoft keyboard to use until I get a different brand.
summary: Azio needs to stop selling the defective batch of these keyboards.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The letters are very large and easy to read day and night, 3 color choices is nice

My only problem with the keyboard which is a major problem, you have to press so hard for the keys to be recognized. you really need to put in an effort to push the key all the way down for it to show up on the screen, it gets annoying. It gets really annoying trying to game on it...

I also own a sidewinder x4, hands down the sidewinder keyboard blows this "azio" keyboard away

I give it 4stars due to the low price and easy visibility it offers, it would be a blowout deal if it didn't have a key pressure problem
summary: Very vivid, and easy to read; Too much pressure on fingure tips to type correctly.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: good buy, works great

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: they keys are very sticky and not in a good mechanical keyboard kinda way... i could never use this keyboard as a day to day board however it is for a family member with poor vision and little computer literacy. if you don't have to look down to type every letter then avoid this keyboard...
summary: they keys are very sticky and not in a good mechanical keyboard kinda way

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love the lighted keys, but large letters just as nice! colors fun, but I stick to & find the blue very easy one the eyes!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Lighted keyboard! Everything's in the right place, unlike the other one I got by accident, and the hardly-used extra keys are inobtrusive. A bit on the sensitive side, extra keystrokes are very easy to make. Find the lighting more useful for gaming (to re-orient my keys if my hand shifts), and finding the occasional special key when writing (<>*#$+=_)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Best keyboard for me. Big keys, big letters, and lit up.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Nice board, large letters and backlit  however I'm sending it back as some of the keys stick, particularly the "E" key.
Pain in the butt to have to check to see if the letter actually did work or not.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I got this keyboard for my mother because she asked for a backlit keyboard so she can see better while working.  She has a hard time reading and seeing so this keyboard with the light and bigger letters allows her to see what she is typing much better.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love the 3 color back light and how easy the board was to adjust to. Must hold down the on-off button in order to shut it off (a pain) but I think the unit is to be well liked by all who will buy it. Easy to use in a dark room and allows one to pick up the keys with more ease than not.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My first one bit the dust when my 3-yr-old spilled I don't know what on it. If you use reading glasses, and/or need to see your keyboard in low light, this thing is an absolute must. That I got a second one when that happened should tell you I was happy with it. It's quiet, too.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: As expected - but using with linux computer. Worth the price, three colors - red, blue, third color is a red/blue combo (purplish). No issues so far.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: When I seen the price on this, I thought I wouldn't get much, but the reviewers seem to like it, so I went for it. Well it turned out to better than I expected. It has a few very minor warts, but considering the great performance/cost ratio I consider it a good buy, but time will tell how well it stands-up in the future.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I would have given this item 5 stars as it relates to my own use. But for you speed typists out there I am afraid you might find the key action a little mushy. However, as far a I am concerned I love it. I can see the keys without my glasses even in a dimly lit room and it works just great for me. I would recommend it to anyone.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Computer keyboard lights up with choice of three colors. WHITE would have been best but it is still a good item.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I returned this keyboard because it was impossible to type on. the keys were flat and kept hitting each other. I should've read the reviews.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Needed an illuminated keyboard with large lettering (so I could read the keys without my reading glasses )and some bit of wrist rest since I would be using it on my lap.  This fit the bill perfectly.  Seems well made and sturdy enough to use as I am.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard is awesome. The keys haven't stuck on mine at all (I checked them one by one after seeing people complain about that). Not a bad one in the bunch. Plug and go. My only complaint is that they abbreviated a lot of the keys to accommodate the huge lighted letters. If you know your way around the keyboard, you should be fine though.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The letters are very large so the back lit effect looks very neat.  However, the entire unit flexes a bit when the weight of your hands are on it.  As such, the space bar sometimes doesn't work.  It can be frustrating to be typing a long document or even a long e-mail and all of the words are run together.  For light occasional use it is fine.  For heavy regular use, my advice is to keep looking.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Big bold backlit letters and I love being able to see the keyboard at night without any lights on. Very functional and maybe a tad stiff

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
For the price and features offered this keyboard is an excellent buy!

It took me a while to figure out how to shut off the illumination, as it stays on even after the PC is shut down, one has to HOLD the LED Illumination key down for 4  seconds to shut it off...

The only thing I wish was that the keys were a bit more raised up. Oh and also (IMPORTANT):
The 3 coloured keyboard is more than adequate, the blue lighting is an awesome shade of dark cyan, so you don't need to get the 5 shade version that costs $20 more.
Ordered this large print keyboard for my mother who can actually get some use out of the Asus Essentia series desktop PC I bought her for Christmas!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Bought this for my mother, she can see they keys much better and the back lit keys also help a lot. So it's a great keyboard. Keys feel good, the pegs on the back don't really make a difference in the angle but it's nothing major, for her at least. She loves it.
summary: Good Keyboard, large keys with those with eyesight problems in mind

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I got it  2 months before its working very well but its not for gamers...
Its only for people that they using it for typing or for serfing on youtube and staff like that...
i put it on the side and i bought a gaming...but its realy good product for these money but im heavy gamer so that keyboard its not cover my expectasions in this part...! Still very good for other thinks!
summary: Not for gaming but still good!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
the good - fantastic job with the lights, color change function is great, brightness control is great.

the bad- The keys are some of the worst I have ever used...constant sticking, does not recognize when pressed, some keys work well...most don't...constantly correcting spelling due to the keys not recognizing the press of the key...verrryyyy frustrating! I have returned this item. For someone who types with one finger it might be ok, but for a typist...this will drive you insane.
summary: lights work great, keys are horrible...not sensitive to touch at all, and they stick

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard replaced my thin logitech backlit keyboard that my toddler destroyed.  So far it's been holding up to my toddlers attacks.  Function wise, it is just as good with even better lighting.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keyboard lights up great, the colors are easily changed.  It's was a gift and it was a hit.  Thank you

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The construction of the keyboard is pretty nice, the colors and intensity of the keys quite good, the hand wrist rest is very cool but...

If you type moderately fast (at a normal speed) then it will become unusable pretty quickly since the keys will get stuck as you write. Two members of my family have used it and both changed back to their usual keyboards on the same day.

I have been using a different keyboard for some time now it is has been great.
summary: If you type moderately fast, this is not for you

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: keyboard! I have two computers so this keyboard is for my secondary computer. It works great and I love that you can change the color of the keys. Very cool!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like it for all the features it advertised.  I find with heavy use, the keys tend to get stuck from time to time.  I attribute this to the plastic keys inside plastic housing.  Over time, the friction causes the keys to bind up.  I bet a squirt of graphite into the board's sleeve of each key would fix it, but that is pretty labor intensive.  That is my only beef, as I do type quite a bit, and pretty fast, so a stuck key is very annoying and breaks my train of thought rather often.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: i have one of these myself, and i bought the  wife  one also... we  are both in our 60's and this keyboard is bright. and big letters. :)  we love love this keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The backlighting is great.  I happen to like the blue best, so being able to choose is great.  The characters on the keys are large and easy to read.  The keyboard is perfect for my poor typing skills and poor eyesight.  None of the keys stick.  In fact I would have to say they work as smooth as silk.  I now have exactly the keyboard I wanted.  Azio is a great company that stands by it's product and they have a great customer service team.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The quality is better than expected for a keyboard with these specs in this price range. You cannot type very fast on it due to the short keys and though they do not stick sometimes have to hit them harder than you would like. If you are a heavy typer  save your money and buy better. If you just need it for standard use and want a light up keyboard you will not be disappointed.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: bought for my son and he loves it. He often plays Arma 3 with a group of folks half a world away. This requires him to be up in the middle of the night for missions sometimes. This keyboard allows him to play without have the lights on and disrupting the sleep of others in the home.
summary: If you are a gamer who plays at night, this is for you

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I guess the old saying that you get what you pay for still exists. I have had the keyboard about six weeks, and the keys are starting to either miss while I am typing, or just stick. Guess I should have known better.
I returned the key board for a new one, and it lasted about 6 months before it started skipping letters and became impossible to use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm on my computer mostly at night, so I wanted a backlit keyboard to make the keys easier to see. Lighting changes easily between blue, red and purple. The fact that the keys are also large-print is a bonus.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I work from my home office more often than my work office.  I program for fun in my off hours- bottom line= I spend a thousands of hours at a keyboard.  I wanted a keyboard that was easy to read in the dim light, and this Azio 505U nails that requirement at 5 stars.  So why the two star rating?  It PAINED me to finally re-install my older Microsoft 3000 Keyboard simply because the keystrokes on the Azio caused me to generate so many typo's it became intolerable.  Gang- I WANTED to keep this keyboard.  I used it with fervor for 1 week, but i could not deny my productivity fell through the floor.

The bottom line= the Azio Key stroke is exceptionally "long", meaning you have to press each key down, and the stroke down is significantly longer (maybe 2x) that of a high end keyboard.  The number of times I had to stop typing and back up to re-strike a key (because I didn't force it down far enough) didn't get any better after one week.  I realized the only way I was going to make this work was to slow my type rate down considerably; and hey- this should be a tool to enhance productivity, not diminish.

Sorry Azio- fix that pesky keystroke length and I'd buy two just to have one for a back up.
summary: Great Backlighting, but ATROCIOUS Key Action

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The letters are big and easy to read. It requires no setup, you just plug and  go and its comfortable to use. I know others have complained that its hard to type on and the keys are sticky. I did not find this to be the case at all. I use this for work which requires lots of typing so I'm a fairly quick typer and this keyboard did not slow me down on bit. I never once experienced a stuck or sticky key.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have real bad eye sight and the lighted keyboard helps me, and if I get tired of one color I have 2 others to use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like this keyboard it does what its suppose to do. The keys stick some what but I've learned to work with it other wise I do like it I can see my keyboard in the dark now with out having to turn on the light every 5 minutes. I'd say I'd recommend this to anyone that doesn't want to spend $60.00 on keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've been typing on computer keyboards for nearly twenty years.  Yes it is lighted and the keys show up.  (could not locate an off switch)  It is the keys that kill this item.  Klickity  Klack,  like a freight train.  NOT subtle or soft.  Cheap Plastic.  This Anzio is  pretty until you type your first letter,  Klickety Klackity  keys The keys are NOT soft touch,  rather you have to push down a long way for each stroke.  If you plan on typing,  pass this one by.  I am now using the Logitech thin, USB,  although there is a wireless model, but that means playing with battery changes, charges.  Note, if you get the Logitech the USB goes into a powered outlet or the computer itself.  Technology Teacher,  USAF  Electronics,  Computer CAD Author - two books.
summary: Everything it says it is, but wait 1  !!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: JUST a keyboard that lights.  This is what I wanted and it works perfectly.  Most keyboards with this feature are aimed at gamers and come at a much higher cost with features that just aren't helpful for non-players.  So this is a great keyboard for those who want a high visibility ( poor eye sight / night time typing) or for eye candy / looks - with the three colors you can get it to match your internal color scheme of your over-clocked, liquid cooled tricked out system.
summary: So this is a great keyboard for those who want a high visibility ( ...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this Keyboard for my Father,his eye site is not what is use to be.

The large print and back lighting are perfect for him :)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The font on the keys is REALLY big.  Makes you feel like you are a child or really old, but it functions just fine, has three colors, red, blue and violet.  The lighting will not turn off unless your PC is off.  It is the same size as a regular keyboard.  Keys are somewhat cheap feeling and a little noisy, but I am used to the quiet keyboard technology.  Wish Amazon would require more info on all products sold with them.
summary: Great keyboard for those with limited vision.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My wife is going blind so we needed a easy to see keyboard. This one lights up the letters and not the perimeter of the keys. This such a nice keyboard, I think I will get myself one. Yes I highly recommend this keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This Azio keyboard plugged right into my computer and immediately started working. It's nothing fancy but basic, "I can see the Keyboard" technology at work here. Since it is illuminated I don't need to worry about the letters rubbing off my keyboard and that was the main reason for my purchase.
summary: A Great Item For The Price!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My grandma loves it. I have no idea how good of a keyboard it is, but she likes it. I'm happy. The End.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: no good
summary: no good and company won't respond for return

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Got one for my wife too, she loved the BIG glowing keys. It is a bit noisy, but the kind of sound that gets you in the zone and words practically type themselves with this KB. Coupled it with a fellowes keyboard palm rest, and it works great. Only wish it would retain the color selection after power down, but switching the color is braindead simple, so I will let others whine about that. Would buy again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I got a new computer and hated the keyboard that came with it. I wanted something with keys I could see. So I was browsing and saw that it lights up in purple.... I was thrilled. Got it in 2 days with my prime shipping. The keys do stick a bit and that is why I only gave 4 stars. If you are quick at typing, this is not the keyboard for you. You have to hit the keys right in the center otherwise it will 'skip' letters. Now that I know how to work around it I am ok.

5/3/14 Update:
Was shipped a new keyboard and the keys no longer stick. There was a problem and they fixed it. Customer service was wonderful. I would buy this again if I needed to. So if you are one of the people that have a keyboard that is sticky in the keys, please contact them. They helped me out and I am sure that they will help you as well.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Honestly, I bought this because it was the cheapest full size backlit keyboard I could find.  It is everything I expected.  Key strokes are quiet relative to my previous keyboard, Keyboard fits in a reasonable amount of space, cord is sufficient length.
Lights: the blue is a nice middle of the road blue, not really royal but not light.  The red is bold, and is probably my favorite color on this keyboard.  The purple is kind of lame to me but then again I don't really like purple anyways.
The backlight does shut of if you hold the color button for a few seconds, and in normal light the letters are still easy to see.  Would recommend to a friend looking for a backlit keyboard.

Cons: the light button is not lit, so you need to turn the light on before the room is dark, and it is not as easy to locate it in the dark to change the color.  Not a big deal to me personally.
The letters are large print, so keys are labeled with abbreviations ex. PD on the page down key.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Good price. Good selection of colors,very easy to use,"plug and play".Large letters are good for us visually challenged."extra" special keys tre handy for easy access.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
My 2 year old son pops the keys off too easily. I'm using a Windows key for Left Alt.
My same son spilled coffee on it and while cleaning it the wires for the lights broke.

I am searching for a replacement since my wife doesnt like it, but I loved it for gaming in my cave.
If you don't have a 2 year old its fantastic. Easy to see, layout is great, big backspace key (not cramped buttons).  Ill miss it.
summary: FANTASTIC if you don't have kids.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Product quality is a very good value here.  I recommend this for anyone who has this need.  Be confident in its function.
summary: My 11 year old loves glow in the dark feature

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I like the large font and the back lighting  key stroke response is very good. I have nothing negative to say about this key board.

Revision: Keys are starting to stick and are requiring more pressure to press them

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Simply put; this is the best keyboard I have ever owned. Nice large characters, very well lit and very evenly lit.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Mother has lost vision in here left eye and struggled to type on a standard KB. The KB is the ticket and she loves it. Wish the back lighting was a bit brighter but much better than before. Works great out of the box and no problems.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love it. the only color I use is blue, the other two are just too bright.  It feels a little different than the keyboard I was used to, but I have adjusted to it.  I was so glad to get rid of the wireless one I had because it was asking for new batteries every day, and I just couldn't afford that, since you were not supposed to use rechargable batteries.  So I am very happy with this one, and I do like the blue light in it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
It is big and the lighted keyboard is bold!  I really like using it.  It is lightweight and feels like it could break easily, but so far, so good.  I like the way I can change the colors on the keyboard too.  The lighted keys lets me know when the screen is dark that my computer is still on and I need to shut it off!
It has been a few months and it is still working fine.
summary: Very fun and easy to use

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard is a great device--especially for those of us over 65. The bright keys are soft-touch and the feel of the keys is spot on. It is very well-designed to do the task it says it will. I have many keyboards--including others with backlighting. They mostly have small characters on keys and faint light. This one--is the exception--and it has a brightness control as well. The plastic keyboard is FLAT black--and does not have any annoying glare. It is a quality keyboard all the way around. I read all the reviews before ordering--and found that none of the mentioned complaints to be valid for me. And the keys certainly do not stick--they are excellent. I highly recommend--for anyone. There is really no conceivable reason for letters to be tiny on a keyboard--nor has there ever been. I suppose touch-typists from the old school might be a reason--but they do not look at them anyway.

UPDATE
June 24, 2014--just received another of these fine devices--this one--so I can use it when in my bedroom on the TV in there for whatever I may need--the lighted keyboard works great on the TV there to do whatever internet activities one feels like doing. You don't have to turn on a bright room light to function.

I think it is the best keyboard I have ever had--and I have had keyboards on computers (mainframes) since the late 1960's. Of course, I am old--as you might imagine. And lighted keys--large ones--is simply an improvement that you won't be able to live without. Especially those who are not professional touch-typists. I do hope they come out with an ergo-shaped one in the future.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love this keyboard. I bought it because my lap top keyboard is very hard to see in dim light. I am glad I got the 3 color one because I was going to buy either the red or blue, this one has red, blue purple. I found the purple is a lot easier on my eyes. Plus the letters are bigger. I love it, it is great not straining my eyes anymore. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is on the computer a lot as I am. And the price was great.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: For those having a hard time with the small letters on regular keyboards: This is the solution! Beautiful keyboard with lights! It makes typing so easy and fun, you'll love it

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is the second one I bought because the first works so good.  very easy to read in light or total dark. each key is backlit
so the brightness is the same all over the keyboard. there is no control for intensity but you can turn off the LED,s by holding down
 the color changing button for 3 seconds.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've had the Logitech K740 in the past and needed another backlit keyboad and went with this. While the keys displays are large and bright, using it to type does not feel as smooth as my old K740. Granted this is cheaper, I will still use it but would recommend the K740 over this if price is not a concern. Usable but there are times where I wish my K749 didn't get smashed...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Great new addition to the home with any PC (USB). For all especially the older generation with vision assistance -glasses or
contacts. The choices of 3 backlite colors also comes in very handy !

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The key size, letter size, and back lighting are great as well as the hot keys, but the more I used it the more the keys would stick in the down position or hang up when you depressed them, they feel like they are dry, in fact some squeak.
Anyone with typing skills would have a big problem with this key board, maybe I just got a bad one.
Thanks for Amazon's return policy.
