title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: no much to say the product works as it stated lights up large keys and works well no issues. thanks
summary: all works so far so good.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: There is a vast number of these cheap Chinese keyboards.  They are similar in quality with the usual variation in minor features of dubious value.  Buy the cheap one and hope for the best.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought this for my 7 year old son because he wanted a keyboard like mine so I seen this keyboard that lights up blue as mine does but this one is  much cheaper and the keys have bigger print letters and numbers and when I took it out of the package I was surprised at the quality of this keyboard...I recommended this product to my mother and she herself likes this keyboard vary much...I recommend this product to anyone

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I took a gamble on the newer Azio keyboard. Along with the 5 colors for the keys, there is a brightness wheel above the numeric keys section to adjust the brightness level from off to bright. Very nice option. I can adjust the brightness to just what I want. I find I like the blue light best so I could have gone with the 3-color keyboard but the brightness wheel, along with the other changes makes the 5-color keyboard better for me. There are various quick function keys like mail, calculator, vol up, vol dwn, mute, play, pause, etc. The labeling on the keys is also better, not cryptic - prnt scrn, scrl lock, page up, page down, home, etc. As others commented with the 3-color keyboard, I also had some keys that would stick down from time to time but they all seemed to work themselves out with use - except the delete key. If I used the key it would stick bottomed out and I had to lift it back up with a hooked piece of wire. I took a chance and ran the hocked wire around the underside of the delete key and found a small plastic bur that easily came off. The key hasn't stuck since then. Now the only difficulty I have remaining is getting my hands use to the subtle key size changes from my old logitech keyboard. I like that the keyboard is usb hard wired. I don't have to worry about the keyboard batteries going dead due to the lighted keys. I never really moved my old logitech wireless keyboard more than a few inches from my monitor. Now a wireless mouse I understand. So even with the stuck key problem I had initially, I gave this keyboard 5 stars. I actually love it. I think the newer keyboard may have less problems than the tri-colored version. Just my two cents worth.
summary: This review is for the Azio 5-color keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Only been using this for s few hours now, but so far it's been pretty good. The keys are a bit wide, and with the layout it takes a bit of adjustment, but nothing major. The purple color as far as I'm concerned it useless, Green would have been a much better choice by far. It's fairly quite in operation, the keys just a bit "slick" to touch, but for the money it's a great value. So impressed with it my mother is having me order one for her just as soon as I post this review. All in all an excellent price for this board. One thing to note - turn the backlight OFF when not in use. LEDs fatigue, especially if they are not heat sinked properly, and I doubt they've done anything to draw heat away from them to prolong life. So if you want it to stay bright, turn off the lights when not in use. You do so by hold the color switch button down a few seconds, a second touch restores the lights.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Sorry to say this item was a BUST!!!
The key feel was uneven, and even out of the box, some keys stuck.  Light was nice, but no OFF, just dimmer and different colors.

Perhaps ok for someone who DOESNT TOUCH TYPE, but at anything over 60 WPM, it was a disaster. Returned it... THANKFULLY.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keys are stiff and, if you don't hit it correctly they get stuck. The worst keyboard I've ever tried.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I liked it at first, now a few months in the keys stick so much that I hate using it anymore.
Time for a replacement.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Back-lighting effect is excellent. Large print helps (since I need a new prescription for my glasses). I haven't had any problem with key-bounce (complaint in other reviews) causing double entries. Although this complaint might have more to do with the feel of the keyboard than anything else. And to that point in my opinion, this keyboard is more sensitive to touch. Up until this keyboard, I've been using a Belkin F8E206 and the impression I have is the Azio requires less pressure. And this is the one characteristic I feel is noteworthy. If you're moving from a keyboard like a Belkin (which has taller keys caps), you'll have an adjustment to make re the "feel" of the keyboard. These key caps are a lower profile; not chiclet style, but something in between. It does require a little adjustment. But if I can make the adjustment (using it for several weeks now), I think most people should do fine.

The only nit-picky comment I have is I don't need all the extra function keys across the top. I'd rather have a keyboard that takes up a little less space.

Otherwise, it's all good so far.

BTW, using it with a Linux Mageia 4 install.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: You get what you pay for.  The LED lighting and larger letters is great.  I find though that the contact of each button is not consistent and occasionally you do not get the letter or number you press. I have had more typos with this keyboard than any other.  If you type slowly the excellent viewability likely outways this.  If you are buying this to type fast in the dark,  spend a bit more money for a better keyboard.
summary: Great viewing but not the best for fast typing

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: worst keyboard ever, i gave it some time before writing tis rviiew ind well... the keys not only stick but certain ones actually jam down and get stuck to the point of having to be pried up, sorry i ever purchased it,its worthy and going into the trash can!!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I love the size of the letters and the LED lighting behind them is great.  The size of the keyboard is slightly larger than the past keyboards I have had, which makes it a little difficult to type the same way.  I bought this keyboard because my old one was getting glitchy with the MMORPG I play, but the spacing of some of the keys (like distance between TAB to ESC) makes it hard to play normal.  If your hands are small, you will need to stretch and move your hands off keys to type.

The WORST part about for me with this keyboard is that MANY of the keys are not easily pressed.  It's like it gets hung up along the sides or something.  I spend almost as much time backspacing to insert letters or spaces that did not get typed as I do actually typing.  It's very annoying and I am thinking of popping some keys off to see if I can file off any extra plastic that might be grabbing/grinding against them.

Whether or not this is how all of them are made, or I just have a bad one, I don't know.
summary: OK for the price and being able to type in the dark

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I'm writing this using the Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard just received from the good folks at Amazon, hoping I cover all my bases. In fact, I just removed a Logitech Illuminated keyboard from my PC--the keyboard I've been using for years--and I'll never use it again, not when there are alternatives like this available for a fraction of the price.

As I said, I have used the Logitech Illuminated keyboard for years, and have paid anywhere from $50 to $80 dollars for them (unfortunate, because it is a delicate plank that has never lasted long under my hands). They are wonderful for general typing, exceptionally comfortable and silent. In fact, the Logitech Illuminated is the most silent keyboard I have ever used. But they are horrid for gaming. Logitech engineered into the keyboard what is known as phantom key blocking to prevent gamers from using the SHIFT + W+ SPACE key combination, which is essential for any sort of competitive gaming experience. The idea was that gamers would then buy the more expensive Logitech gaming keyboards without key blocking. Keep in mind that keyboards do not generally have key blocking; it has to be engineered into them.

The problem with most gaming keyboards is that they are especially loud, and gaming keyboards with mechanical switches can be exceptionally loud. I stuck with the Logitech Illuminated keyboards only because I could find no better, silent alternative.

This  Azio keyboard does not have key blocking, making it more suitable for gaming than the Logitech Illuminated. If you play games, rest assured SHIFT + W + SPACE will work just fine, as it does on most any normal keyboard.

The backlighting is quite even top to bottom, left to right. The red seems striking and vivid. The blue has a touch of green and is slightly dimmer. The purple is closer to pink, and probably has to be; otherwise, it would prove too dark. Regardless, the purple is the most subdued of the three options. I also bought Azio's five-colored model as a backup and in case I fell in love with this one. The backlighting does not power down with the computer; it has to be switched off manually by depressing the LED ILLUMINATION button for three full seconds.

The key tops themselves have a fairly smooth, subtle texture I am immediately comfortable with. They have slightly more grip than the key tops on the Logitech Illuminated.

The key switches are soft and squishy. Key switches on the Logitech Illuminated are slightly less squishy. Squishy keys cause me problems when I get lazy and forget proper technique. It's rather like typing on a pillow or marshmallow, and the experience can lull the unwary into a laziness of sorts. I would compare the Azio unfavorably to the Perixx PERIBOARD with chicklet-style keys, another keyboard I received with my order. The PERIBOARD has the superior feel and responsiveness, better than the Logitech and far better than the Azio.

How loud the keyboard will be depends upon your technique. My technique is all over the map; with this Azio keyboard I can get dead-silent response one moment and CLICK! CLACK! BANG! the next. That is, it's fairly quiet if I hit the keys just right. Across the keyboard, keys have a varying responsiveness and a range of resistance I'm less than comfortable with. Bear in mind that, because I am writing a review, I am actively searching for something to fault. Someone with a heavy hand and no mind for silent operation would likely never notice. Personally, I'd prefer the keyboard had a lighter touch and more silent operation. This Azio keyboard is much louder than the Logitech Illuminated, which goes hand in hand with the uneven switch resistance.

I like the colors. I can change the colors of my keys by pressing a button? Seriously? For twenty dollars? I say, "Wow!" Oh, and the fact that the letters are supersized is probably a plus. I've entered the reading glasses stage of life, and the big letters are a good fit, as much as I hate to admit it.

The Q key tends not to register when gaming, a combination of my pinky strength and excess play in key travel. I can tell it's an inexpensive design. It has a bit of flex. It has squishy, wobbly keys. But I have to say that I cannot find anything better locally for twice the price. Not for three times the price. The black color accents the backlighting and makes the keyboard look fine with the lights on or off.

I recommend this keyboard as an emergency backup. If you want more color options and don't mind a slightly larger profile, look at the five-color version, which includes white backlighting. If you need a keyboard as quiet as the one on your laptop, look for something else. If you are not a discerning touch typist or finicky gamer, this keyboard is good enough.
summary: Amazing price, looks nice, and it won't wake the dead!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love this keyboard with it's 3 color choice, on/off button and large letters.  I change the colors based on my mood.  It's great.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I wanted a lit keyboard.  I have tried a couple. One national company (Tiger Direct) not only ripped me off but refused to put a rating on a defective product cause they were still selling it.  This keyboard though is great.  I like it in blue, my grandson likes it in red.

A good product at a very good price.  A lit keyboard may not be everyone's cup of tea, but I like it.  Liked the price too.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I needed a keyboard I could see in the dark, this is it.  The keys are just the tiny bit larger and that takes some getting used to - but it works and doesn't fail, I'd say get one you'll be glad you did.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
1st day worked fine and I was happy with it. 2nd day after booting up. did not accept keystrokes.
Re-booted. Did not help. I'm a running Linux distro. Maybe that. I tried connecting it to my
laptop (also Linux) and did not work. Gave up and returned it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: i love this keyboard but it did already fall apart in just couple months the tabs broke first the one to hold up the keyboard a little high and next a few keys poped off now no space bar at all
summary: i love but kinda high priced and cheaply made

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm very happy with this keyboard.  I work home and since I'm at my computer 8+ hrs a day, I really like that I can change the color according to my mood so I won't get bored. Plus I can leave my roo light off now and I can see the keys. I'm happy I bougHt it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Large letters and lit keys make this key board easy to see under all conditions. Only gave four stars because no dimmer switch and only 3 colors. I also bought the more expensive 5 color azio key board and like it better. To turn off lights just hold in color button.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
As an update to my review, I applaud the Azio company for wanting to make their customers happy by replacing this keyboard with another much better-quality keyboard. (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00I0S6SK0/ref=s9_al_bw_g147_i2)

They stepped up to the plate and I LOVE my new Azio keyboard. The keys are soft, easy to press, QUIET, and I still get the cool backlit feature that is great when I'm working late.

I will definitely purchase Azio products in the future because, being a business owner, great customer service goes a long way with me.

Initial Review: Gorgeous back-lighting for the keys (in blue, red, and violet) but the keys are harder to push than my older MS keyboard. It'll do for now, the price was right, but I'll be buying a new keyboard a month or so, one that is easier on my fingers.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It shines perfectly and is great to look at. Easy to change colors. and easy to see at night. This would make a great gift.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keys started sticking/wouldn't work after about 8 months.  Liked it until then although wasn't wireless which wasn't real clear by description when I ordered it since I searched on wireless and it was in small print. Regardless POS only lasted 8 months.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
In brief, it looks terrific with customizable color.
Unfortunately, ours has two bad keys.
The "A" sometimes won't depress, even when pressing quite hard, until it gives way under sometimes prolonged increasing pressure.
The "8" key on the numeric keypad won't return, which causes repeated strikes until it is pried up.
Because of these two problems, it is simply incapable of fulfilling the fundamental functionality of a keyboard: efficient typing.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's just okay, it actually works like they say it does. And the budget price make it seem like a good value.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is a "gaming" keyboard. Apparently, gamers do not use keys like 'o' and 'm' and 'e' very often. I've never had a keyboard with more problems with sticky keys. I considered sending it in for replacement, but took a close look at the construction first. The way the keys are set looks to make "collision" against neighbouring keys inevitable. Also, the stroke depth is inconsistent which makes touch-typing a challenge and the abbreviated 'specialty' key labels required for the large-print feature (Page Up =PU, Print Screen=PS, etc.) means I had to keep glancing at an old keyboard to recall which keys lived where.

On the other hand, it gets a full star for the backlighting. It is PERFECT: bright without being obtrusive and all three colour options are attractive and usable. Also, the visibility of the letters really is impressive; they're quite large and very, very bold. If the keys were spaced another millimetre apart and the build quality was a bit tighter, this would be a serious winner.
summary: Fantastic if you only need some of the keys...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This was a replacement to a lighted keyboard we purchased about 7 years ago at the Discovery store.  This is FAR superior to that one.  The color choices turned out to be a bigger deal that I expected.  And I LOVE the large letters on the keyboard.
summary: WOW!  Now I don't feel so blind!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like this keyboard a lot.  The back lighting effect is cool, and useful.  The large print is easy to see, although the keyboard itself is a little bit larger too.  I'm not sure why----the keys themselves are the same size as any other keyboard.  It's not a problem though.  Key action is good.  Multi media buttons are very convenient.  Good seller, no problems.  Good product.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Received this keyboard today and have been giving it a little workout.  I really do like the illuminated keyboard.  It will certainly make my computer work at night lots more comfortable.  Nice large, soft-touch keys as well as a variety of shortcuts for mail, calculator, etc. on top of keyboard make this a really good choice, especially since I bought it a really good sale price here at Amazon.  I highly recommend this keyboard especially for those who have vision problems.
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: back lighting is great; nice large keys; perfect for older users 3 color choices for back lighting;  would highly recommend

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is a decent keyboard and I give it 4 stars despite a few issues I have with it. First off, on first use I was shocked at how horribly it stayed in place. It just slid around my desk while I was typing. Then I read a review that said it had 2 rubber feet in the front that held it in place really well, and when I looked under my keyboard I saw that my left foot was missing. Bummer for me. My second issue is that you have to manually turn it off when you turn off your computer. Hold down the LED ILLUMINATION button for a few seconds to do so. My third issue isn't a big one, but it's an issue. The keys are sticky. They aren't hard to push down, but they don't *click* when you push on them. I frequently miss keys because I didn't push it down all the way. Once I realized that I started pushing a little harder to make sure I was getting every keypress, but now my fingers are getting tired. I'll get used to it, but is just an annoying experience.

What I like about this keyboard are the huge letters and symbols. Heck, that's half the reason I bought it. I have one bad eye that gives me headaches when straining to read, so even if I forget my glasses I can still reference my keyboard without trying too hard. The backlight is perfect. It's not so bright that it's distracting but keys are illuminated day or night.  There's also loads of buttons at the top like calculator and a web browser, but it appears that drivers are needed to get them to work as they do nothing out of the box.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The large type on the keys and the illumination are great.  I bought this for my site challenged parents and it would have been perfect, if it actually functioned as a keyboard.  The reviews don't exaggerate.  The keys stick horribly on this keyboard, randomly.  I have no desire to re-engineer it by removing all the keys and lubing it up, so it's going back.  Some keys stick, some keys don't type anything, or there's a huge delay then it types the letter 50 times.  Just bad.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: We really like this keyboard cause it's easy to see. The kids like the way you can change the colors. It's easy to see at night.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
As a self trained, moderate touch typist, I like this keyboard.
Somebody mentioned it is a bit noisy, especially for a fast typist; maybe so, but I find it just right.
As for the lower keys' height, I find it convenient for sliding around reall fast.

This is the most I every paid for a keyboard, but I have decided , I am worth It!
AND I might even treat myself to another :)
summary: Easy to read, good stable KB

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Most of the time we awake before the sun comes up. Withthis keyboard I don't have to worry about turning on a light to type, thus not waking my spouse or the dogs. Also the letters are big and bright..wish I had found this years ago. I would reccomend it 100%

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I just got this today and am so happy with it. Where my computer is, no matter how many lights I turn on, I can't see the keys clearly on my previous keyboard. This board is the standard size and the lighted letters are huge and easy to read.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've had this keyboard for a year now and it still works fine. No problems with sticking keys or anything. The keyboard has the right "touch" for me (a fast touch-typist). I love the light (I use blue, red is too bright for me), and the labels on the keys are very easy to read. I have noticed that some of the black is starting to wear off on five keys (ASEDL, but most noticeably on A and E).

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Our desktop is set up in a rather dark corner, and even though we have a desk lamp with the computer, the keyboard sits in one of those slide-out trays underneath the desk. The keyboard never received enough light unless the window blinds were wide open. However, now with this keyboard light is no longer a problem, and there are 3 choices - red, blue, or purple. If you have a similar problem then I think you will find this keyboard will solve your problem. Additionally, it truly was a plug and play item as the only thing necessary for hook up was to plug it into a USB port on the desktop.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This was much more than i was expecting, pretty quiet for a keyboard, very nice illumination. Doesnt feel like a cheap keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: If you have trouble seeing your keyboard due to color, shadows, or lighting in the room, such as a study or bedroom, then check this keyboard out.  The keys are backlit and easy to see.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I can see now!  mine does not shut down even even when PC is
powered off but the keys are big and bright,comes with 3 color selections,I wish it had a dimmer
switch,its a little too bright at night but oh well beats not seeing anything..I use mine for gaming
works well

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have used only 1 of the 2 keyboards purchased but overall, it's a nice keyboard. I type 10-12 hours per day so I put in a fair amount of time on it (had it about 1 month now).  One key sticks a little but seems to be getting better with use.  Read the reviews before purchase and was concerned about key action but am pleasantly surprised.  I found the key-action/sound that so many people complained about, to be not an issue for me.  It's not a silent, top of the line keyboard -- but then again, it's only $20!  I LOVE the fact that the keys light up.  When it's early in the morning or evening, I am able to work without turning on the big overhead lighting.  Pleasantly surprised and I would buy again.
summary: Nice, bright and a good value

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: works as advertised, love the fact you can change the light back round, and love the large letters on the keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought this for a dark inspection room at work for a group of guys who all wear reading glasses. This was perfect easy to read bright but not too bright.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I really like the backlit keys.  I also really like the size of the letters on the keys.  I use my computer at times in low light and this helps a lot.  The keys have a good feel to them.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Not only do I not need my glasses (because I am NOT a touch typist) but I don't have to turn the lights on and annoy my room mate when she's lurking in the dark and watching TV. It's got great tactile action and the layout of the extra keys is great. Good unit to buy!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I've never developed an attachment to a particular brand or type of keyboard, but I could get used to this one. Since I am not a touch typist (more like search and destroy) being able to see the keys' letters is often necessary, especially in low light or with the near perpetual glare that plagues many workplaces. Now, it's easy because they are larger than life and illuminated from below.

Some criticism has been made regrading the amount of pressure required to depress the keys. I can see where someone with a light touch might be bothered but my style (see above) is aggressive and lacks any finesse. My heavy hand usually wears appliqu letters to invisibility long before I wish, especially "A" and "S" which is directly related to name-calling in letters to the editor.

The red light creates an aura of mystery in a darkened room that allows me to pretend that I am avoiding NSA's efforts to track me. Blue is less bright and purple more. All three colors enhance the visual part of one's typing experience. I like the keyboard and would recommend it highly to anyone with visual limitations (I'm 20/15 and 20/25) or where tired eyes make nighttime typing a drag. Actually, I like the keyboard just as a keyboard. Oh . . . and the spiffy "Quick Access" keys all work.

Update, two months later . . . After a month of regular use several letters/keys began emitting a "click" and did not depress as easily. Since I have faced this problem with other keyboards I used the same method to resolve the minor problem. With the PC shutdown and using my fingernails only (one nail under the upper side of the key and the other on the lower side) I carefully removed each key and applied a very light (VERY LIGHT) coating of mineral oil using cotton swabs; problem solved. Should I have to do this? Probably not, but it's rewarding to be able to make something work.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I can finally read all the keys on my keyboard, especially late at night when I work at home with dimmed lighting.  The blue color works best for me, but I like the option of having other color choices and even turning the lighting off when I want.  Maybe it's just me, but It would be perfect if it weren't for the occasional sticking keys, which I've learned to compensate for during the past few weeks.
summary: Works Great, Good Illumination, but the Keys Occasionally Stick

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This was purchased for an aging uncle with poor vision.  The large, lighted keys make a big difference in him being able to see what he is doing.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It feels cheap and even looks cheap but works really great for a standard typing keyboard.  It is even better if you have to do a lot of all nighters typing whatever and what not.  The keyboard is not recommended for gaming though.  I had a problem with certain keys being stuck.  Only noticed and was a problem during gaming but other than that it works great as a standard keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
It's big and not response fast enough for gaming.
The light never turn off even when your computer is off.
I buy it for myself, but I can't use it as a gaming keyboard, so I give it to my mom.
She likes it alot cause she just use it for typing, Internet....lightly daily use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Been using this for about 3weeks now. I was a bit surprised at how big this keyboard is, bigger & heavier than the old full size Dell keyboard I was using. The plastic look sturdy and the Azio keyboard actually looks pretty good. Not a bad deal for $20. The keys are a bit soft to press, it has an awkward feel to it compare to the Dell & Kensington keyboard I was previously using.

Pros: - Clear & bright illumination with an On & Off button
  -  Sturdy & tough plastic casing
  -  Great price ($20)
  -  Full size backspace button

Cons: - Keys are soft, not enough tension when pressing the keys while typing.
  -  Multimedia keys does not function at all (my Dell & Kensington both have working multimedia keys, no drivers required)
  -  No Sleep button!!! (all my other keyboard has a sleep button)

All in all, I like the LED back light, it is very nice looking. For typing it's so, so...and so far no sticking keys like what other reviews states. It would be very nice if the multimedia keys actually works, instead they just sit there as decorations!

Feb 2014 update!!! ---  I have this keyboard for just about a year now, the back-light color is starting to fade, specially the purple. It's not expose to any sunlight, so the fading is not due to that.
summary: Not too bad - Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I loved the lighting. Looks great. But functionally, it's the most frustrating keyboard I've ever owned, I'll be typing along, here a solid clack every time I hit the space bar, look up after a few sentences and see several places I have to go back and insert spaces between words. I watched it happen in real time, too, by keeping my eyes on the monitor. I have never run into this problem before or since, so it's not my technique causing it. Problems with other keys, too. Cleaning made no difference. I hated to throw it away but I put up with it WAY longer than I should have just because I liked the look of the blue lit keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love the keyboard.especially the different color lights that the keys can change to. It is very easy to use and I would recommend it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Nice large key letters.  Back lit makes this the best keyboard for all ages.  I have recommended to many friends.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard is nice. The backlighting is great. The keyboard feels good for typing. I first received a keyboard with sticky keys, which was frustrating to type on. Azio sent a replacement, and the key action on the replacement is fine.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
great for dark keyboard drawer very big font and good quality usb connection.
Can see all keys clearly.
@ first the keys were high resistance and Azio offered a free replacement but I opted out. This thing is now 4 months old and works great. Keys are very smooth now when pressed and I got really used to it. I really cant EVER use a non lit keyboard again.

i play bf4 with mine @ nite and its great! looks solid lights are nice and low no glow just enough to see keys clearly 100
% opacity
summary: Great Keyboard Large Print Well Lit.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: So far this KB is working just fine i have one just like it and the price was about $20 more so after finding this one on Amazon at this price i grab it and I'm glad I did. Hey the both of them looks good in my office at night . Thank you Azio

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Keys are easy to see in dim light, but after use for 6 months, the keys stick, and it is hard to type. Azio saw my review and replaced the keyboard.  A+ for taking the initiative to monitor feedback and the offer to replace.  We'll see how it works.

This is the best keyboard that I have found for visibility.  The letters are as large as they can be and the backlighting makes the letters really stand out.

Would willingly pay more for higher quality, we'll see if that is necessary.
summary: Great Looking Keyboard - Sticky Key Issues

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
It's a little plasticky. And the keys are pretty shallow. If you are a fast touch typer this may be a factor. I hunt and peck still and the large letters help with my speed. So no biggie for me. The USB cord could be longer as my computer is on the floor and I can't route the cord all the way to the back of the desk.

The Large Characters and the LED lighting is what made me buy this and it delivers on that. Except the media buttons at the top. Why are they so small? Their size kind of defeats the purpose if this is supposed to be geared towards the visually impaired. Again not that big of a deal as I don't usually use those buttons on any keyboard. They are lit so that's a plus.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Terrific keyboard for those of us with not so perfect vision. Big, clear, well lite keyboard easy to see and use. I love the use of a large size backspace key so it is not missed. The ability to change colors is an extra bonus that will appeal to many tastes. Definitely would recommend this to a friend or anyone.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Update 08/23/2016

Decided to try again with a "new" version of this keyboard.  Sure enough, the space bar problem still exists!  Unless you hit it almost exactly in the center and hit it hard, you get no spaces!  I think I'll return this one (again!) and maybe cross Azio off my list from now on.  BTW, the space bar failed four times while I was trying to type this review!!!

UPDATE 04/2014

The replacement worked OK for a short time then the capital "A" failed (Totally dead). After trying three or four of these keyboards I give up!  My review on this item goes from  4 to 1 star.  This keyboard now goes to E-Waste and I won't buy from AZIO again.  I don't have time to deal with these problems.  I just wasted my money on this one!  Yes, I'm a little teed off but so others might not have this problem, here's the latest (and last) review!
summary: I just wasted my money on this one

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am using my laptop and work keyboards for comparison. While the illumination and large letter size are helpful, the "feel" is pretty crappy. Key strokes are light, but keys can stick if they are not pressed down perfectly evenly, they are noisy, and the key shape is closer to the nearly flat level of laptop keys...just feels low quality. My speed and accuracy is unquestionably better on a laptop keyboard, and mine is near standard size with a num pad. The value of the permanent wrist rest is up to the individual, but if you don't like it, you're stuck with it.

I would rather have purchased a higher quality standard keyboard, and put larger labels on the keys, or paid more for something with the same features but higher quality. Oh well.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: the keys stick a lot in their up and down travel. the way they slide into their holes is sloppy and if you a a home keys typer, you will hate it, if you hunt and poke you'll be fine. I end up correcting my typing constantly and im sure  if I were a higher volume typist I would end up injuring myself on this thing. the only reason i didn't return it is because of how cheap it was, it wasn't worth my time.
summary: yay for large print and lighting, boo for hard to press keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard was HORRIBLE. The look was fantastic! We really WANTED to like it! I got it as a gift for my brother, he loved it on sight. However, he found it impossible to use! The keys were really hard to press down, hurt his fingers after a short while. So he gave it to my mom, she couldn't stand it either, so they gave it to me. And there was no way I was going to be able to use it! They keys were ridiculously hard to press!! It was light weight lifting for fingers! Maybe if all you do is check email this kb would be fine, but if you actually type stuff, no way! We returned it. So, looks pretty, but is actually pretty useless!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a nice large keyboard.  The print on the keys is large, which is helpful to me.  The 3 color choices are also nice for variety.  I share an open office edge with a seminar area.  When they have video and pull down the lights, the lighted keyboard is a life saver so I can get my work done.  The keys are a bit louder than I would have thought, so my deskmates know when I'm typing, but they said they got used to it and don't hear it any more.  Bought a second one for home, so that I wouldn't have to adjust my keyboarding to go from one size keyboard to another.  Good stuff.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like the larger lit up print, but the keys stick at times. I don't know if that's because it's new, or something else. But my other keyboard quit working altogether and it was time for a new one.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Great investment if you are a night owl.. pretty cool that you can change the color of the keys too!!!

nice keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: would buy another if needed works great and is worth the cost is very useful and happy to have it
summary: work great just had one sticky key

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
For aesthetics and ease of visibility, this keyboard gets five stars, no question.  Glowing key labels are a touch I've never seen before, and the ability to change them different colors is a great novelty.

There were no technical problems getting this to work--I plugged it in, turned the computer on, and there I was.

My only complaint is that the keys take a lot of "mash" to press.  This is definitely not a soft-touch, quiet keyboard.  It's fairly loud, and has taken some adjustment as I have to exert more force per keystroke than with most other keyboards I've used.
summary: Nifty Keyboard, Large Keys, Lots of Mash Required

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought this keyboard for the backlight feature and the very large letters.  The basic functions work 'OK' as a keyboard but after just a few weeks of use the keys squeak.  The feel is very mushy as well.  The backlight changes color at random, sometimes while I'm typing.  At other times I've just been sitting here next to it and it will change color.  I've also seen instances where the backlight goes out completely for a second.
summary: Feels cheap, squeaks, changes color randomly

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The action on this keyboard is very uneven and gets worse the more I use it. I end up slamming some keys down just to get them to work reliably, which slows down my typing speed and prompts other people to complain at what a loud keyboard I have bought. I love the illumination - it makes it easy to see in low light and outside the frames of my glasses. But at this point I regret not having done some more research and spent some more money on something similar but better quality.

On the plus side, the keyboard has taken me hammering on it relentlessly for the better part of a month and none of the keys has broken yet. So I guess that means that it's more durable than it looks. (But if you use this amount of force on a laptop keyboard, you'll kill your laptop. Just FYI.)

Update Feb 24: After e-mailing the support team (as the company suggested) and receiving no response, I have downgraded my review from two stars to one.
summary: After a while, you'll regret it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is one of the worst buys I have ever buy The key board have stopped to work for no apparent reason. The keys is also extremely stiff.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It looks great but if you type for speed this may not be the right keyboard for you. Anyhow it was great until my kid poured grape juice into it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a super nice keyboard for someone who has poor vision as I do.  It is very slow; that is the keys are hard to press.  Not sending it back but not for me.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is for an Azio large print lighted keyboard sold in 2014. This is not a heavily contoured keyboard, but it does have some shape to the keys.  The F&J nubs are very slight.  The large print is not obnoxiously big, by my standard.  It is a size that looks appropriate. Personally, I find standard keyboard lettering ridiculously tiny.

The layout is like a PC  106 keyboard, a time tested PC standard. The led brightness level does not seem adjustable on the 3-light model, but is not required. It is just the perfect level and you can easily see the keys in the dark.

However, the media keys are a bit undersized.  They work automatically with Windows 7 do not  actually require installation of any special software. Buttons include things like calculator, volume, internet, mail, play, pause, fast forward, music.  There are two each of: window keys, cntrl, and functions keys.

This is NOT a flat laptop keyboard, also it is not not mechanical or clickty type.  The key-throw is for a relaxed style of pressure, with a short-to-medium length and a solid landing.  Keys do not deviate twist or rock, they have a solid feel.

The base is solid, but could slide somewhat for some heavy handed users. They may want to add more rubber at the base..

The size and layout works nicely for  big or small hands. At recent prices, this keyboard is an excellent value.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I really like the easy read letters and the back-lighting of this keyboard. However, due to the design, more and more keys of the keyboard were sticking if the keys were not pressed exactly in the center of each key. This faulty design continued to get worse with more use. After three months, I was ready to trash it and look for a new keyboard.

In a last-ditch effort, I pulled all the primary keys off and used a Q-tip and petroleum jelly to lubricate the slots where all the keys are installed. Once I snapped all the keys back in place....WOW....THIS WAS THE PERFECT KEYBOARD. It now works very smoothly and I still enjoy the benefit of the back-lighting and easy read letters. I wish I had done this easy fix when I first received it.

I put the 1-star on this review so people can learn how to easily fix this keyboard themselves in only a few minutes. After the fix, I would give it 5-stars.
summary: Design flaw can be fixed in a few minutes....making this a great keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love this simple keyboard. Easy to type on. Nice backlighting with no light bleed between keys. The blue is great for when the lights are on and the red is my go to during movies and games while the lights are out. Every key is backlight including the media keys. I also have a Logitech backlight keyboard however this has more solid keys and multiple light colors. I wish I had seen this first.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Every single key sticks, which makes your correcting take longer than typing.whatever

The illumination is good but the sticky keys are a nightmare!!!

Buy something different!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I am typing on this right now and I like this keyboard very much. At night I usually keep it dark in my room and now I can actually see the keys if needed. Good buy.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keyboard is easy to use the Keys was Bright without being glaring or distracting. The color of the light can be changed with ease.
summary: Works well and keys are very easy to see.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard has nice large easy to read letters and easy to read three color back lighting. The keys have a nice positive feel. I think this one of the best for the money! Its a great deal.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: LED backlight user selected red ,blue or purple color. Color change may not be big thin to most people but my wife is blind in one eye and problems with other and prefers the red especially in a darken room. I prefer blue easier on my eyes.  Extra large print for us old and blind people. bought 2 of these one for the wife at work. she had one of those easy eyes keyboards but letters wear off quickly when used a lot. These won't wear off. I only wish it was wireless. Wireless way too much.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: So far so good. Very cool three light push button change. You can turn off the lighted keys by pressing and holding the single control button if you like in daylight use. Keys quite large and impossible to miss. Blue is softest color. Only drawback is the lack of intensity or brightness adjustment. But for the price its great. Sort of fun actually.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great keyboard, nice backlighting, large letters on keyboards. Nice feel for typing and inexpensive to boot. Totally a good buy

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is my first backlit keyboard.  In a dark room this thing has the power of the sun.  I only use the red backlight because the blue and purple are way too bright for me. I wish there was a way to adjust the level of brightness. Also the keys have a very short stroke which I don't care for. But I can't take too many stars away because it does the job, assuming that you want a really bright backlit keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The visual quality of the keyboard in my opinion is unsurpassed even by some of the more expensive brands.
However the typing quality is pretty terrible. My keyboard came with two major flaws. One the space bar is slightly warped and pressing down the right end of it doesn't always register a space. The other big issue that I actually managed to solve is the sticking keys or "tough to press" keys. Only my "A" button was really being a nuisance and everyone knows WASD is pretty important for gamers. What I did to fix the key was just easily pop it out of the keyboard and place it back in. Do it for every other key with the same issue.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: bad very bad! the worst keyboard I have ever owned and had to throw out! would never even give it a star but had no choice!
summary: Horrible sticking keyboard!! YUK!!! Don't waste Money$$

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Mehh... That's the first thing that popped into mind when I opened the box. The keys lack that tactile touch of good quality keyboards like Dell and Logitech. They are... loose and make this clanky sound... fairly loud. When you put your fingers on them and move your hand just a bit around you can feel how low quality they are - like a bad watch strap.

The function buttons on top are useful, when they work - no software came with the keyboard, like Logitech, through which I can configure them.

A good note is how bright the keys are, and the three (3) LED color options are nice - Red's my favorite. If you hold down the LED key for a bit longer, it'll turn off the light all together.

Still, you can get a better quality keyboard for the money. But without LED. And that's the draw, ain't it?

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I got my keyboard today and I'm currently using it.  I like to work without the lights on at night so seeing the keyboard is important.  It's bright and you have 3 colors to pick from Red, Blue and both (Purple).  The keyboard is well made and appears to feel and look much like any keyboard you would have received with your computer.  The bigger letters will make it easy on the eyes but it's biggest selling point was being back light with color options.  Because of the large letter format, print screen, scroll lock, etc. appear as PS, SL, etc.  It has function keys to open common programs like mail, media player and calculator.  It works great and I was able to use it immediately without having to reboot my computer.  I unplugged the old keyboard and plugged this in, several moments later it was ready to use.  I would highly recommend this keyboard to anyone.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Build quality is very good, particularly for this price. The large font and backlighting is excellent. I really want to like this keyboard, but I had to get rid of it.

The issue is with how the keys depress. If you a pressing straight down from on top of the key, it seems fine. But as you type, you reach with fingers and often press keys at a bit of an angle. The keys on this keyboard don't respond well to this which means a key will not depress. So then you start typing with slightly more force than you're used to to make sure key presses all register. And the problem with that is this keyboard IS VERY LOUD if you type with a bit more force. So much so it wakes up my wife in the next room. It's like you start to press the key, it seems stuck, and then it suddenly "gives" and presses down with greater force - which contributes to the racket it makes..

Backlit keys are great for hunt and peck typers like me and the large font just makes it that much better. If only the keys didn't "stick" the way they do. As nice as it looks, it's held back by its own primary function in my opinion. For gaming - I suppose it's fine because you aren't typing a lot. The wasd keys work just fine for that!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Works perfect as far as a keyboard goes.  Numbers and letter are bold and bright when lit.  If you are in a well lit room, you can see them with the lights off.  Three choices of colors, blue, red, and a purple.  Holding the power button/color change button for about three seconds, will turn the unit off.  Just depress it again and it's back on.  Everyone that has seen it has loved it.  I wish the keys were a little taller.  Has taken some getting used to.  It's like typing on a large keyed laptop.  I do recommend.
summary: Wish the keys were a little taller.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love this keyboard, it is made well and much easier to use than my old acer keyboard. I can now use my desktop in the morning without having to turn on lights.letters are big too.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The lighted keyboard is nice, but if you are a touch typist (as I am), the keyboard will give you fits. The keys are not long throw, and while they have a good "feel", they also tend to stick easily when using a light touch. As such, I found the keyboard to be essentially unsuitable for my purposes and plan on relegating it to the recycle bin when the weather gets better.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: LOVE this keyboard!!!  Tried the 'large print yellow keys' purchased locally, and it just did not work out.  This keyboard cost a little more, but is worth every penny.  Larger keyboard, keys, and the options of THREE backlit colors is just great.  Will purchase again if necessary.
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Because he could use some help with a viewable keyboard - I got him this and he loves it.  After seeing how well it worked for him, I'm getting one too just because it's easier than a regular keyboard and not too expensive.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: He loves to game with it at night the backlight works great for him. Not a gaming keyboard in any sense, but still works fine for him. He is more of a casual gamer.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love it but the standard color should be white not blue lights . You can select other colors but not white .

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: When I got it it had several sticky keys which rendered it a real pain.  I fixed it with a little silicone spray.  It took a while for the keyboard to dry out but after it did it's worked smoothly with no more problems for months.  I like the the lit keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love my big backlit keyboard! The keyboard has a nice touch and the big keys are great. The down side is I am waiting for a new one to arrive. It just stopped working after 6 months. Customer service was very good so far, I mailed it back to them about 8 days ago and am waiting for a replacement. Like to play WOW at night and the backlit is really nice for that without needing an offending desk light. I like it so much I am having some withdrawal having to use this old Dell keyboard waiting for my backlit to come home to momma.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The bottom plastic (like where the heal of your hands rest) totally gets in the way, going to cut off the bottom so it feels like a normal keyboard. Keys and lights work great, love the large print. Just really hard to type on with that obtrusive plastic bezel below the space bar.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I really really wanted to love this keyboard.  I like to type in lower lighting for usability concerns and the back-lighting is just great!

I previously had a Microsoft Sidewinder KB that is backlit and perfect but would not work work with the KVM I bought, so I went with this model.  At first I loved it, but over time the key firmness led to too many typos and honestly my fingers just HURT from using it for more than an hour. I literally smashed the thing with my hand out of frustration so I guess it won't be going back for a refund, but I have exacted my vengeance upon it.
summary: Keys are too HARD TO PRESS!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought this keyboard due to the fact I cant touch type, and recently started having severe vision problems and needed a keyboard that was easier to see. The large print and the backlighting make this keyboard very easy to see and use. However the build quality is pretty lacking. Keys stick, or have to be hit at a certain spot in order to activate. For example the enter key, if you hit the center it sticks, you have to hit the left side.  It is built VERY cheaply and it shows. Yes it is a $25 keyboard, but I have had $25 keyboards in the past that were very well built. It got me through the week or so I needed to use it, but if I had it to do aver again I would probably look elsewhere.
summary: will do in a pinch, but wouldnt want to use it full time

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Worked well at first. Illumination is good. Within a couple of months, the keys have grown progressively more sticky. They randomly bind against adjacent keys making typing tiring since you must constantly actively feel whether the key is depressing normally, or whether you need to press harder to overcome the fact that it is binding to the adjacent keys. It seems no one can make a decent keyboard that just works any longer.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm using this keyboard to type this.  It does light up nicely, and you have the choice of red, blue, or violet.  I prefer blue.  Had to knock of one star because the keys are a bit hard and stiff.  Sometimes they feel like they are getting stuck if you are not applying direct downward pressure.  Knocked off another star because I think there's a bad contact somewhere and I hear my laptop disconnect and reconnect to it from time to time.  I have to wiggle the base cord if it stops working to get it working again.  Bottom line is that it's 26 dollars, so for the price I don't think you can find a lighted keyboard like this.  However, I may be looking for something better down the road.  I think keyboards are one of those things that are best tried out and bought at the store, as the feel differs so much from one to the next.  It's such an afterthought, but it shouldn't be.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
For the price, it's exceptionally difficult to beat this keyboard. The keys are well lit and the characters take up nearly the entire key real-estate. The ability to change colors is also tight. Here are the whoopsies:

Can't turn off the backlight, bummer.

The key action is terrible. Using the keyboard is loud and the keypress action isn't, for lack of a better word, "satisfying". It's very easy to half-press a key and it not register. The action is mushy and very very loud. It's not a quiet keyboard, it kinda sounds like a the old IBM mechanical keyboards without the same tactile feedback. The space-bar is somehow level with the beveled/bezel base and you have to really change your wrist position to get a consistent hit.

I'm going to put it on my gaming machine, there is no way I could use this on a keyboard I actually want to type things out on. I used it to type out this review and I was constantly backspacing to correct spaces and missed characters.

So if you are looking for a simple backlit keyboard for mundane tasks, this will probably serve you. However for anything resembling medium usage, I think you'll find the keyboard very unsatisfying.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I love to play games with the Light off (so no GLARE on my Screen)

But seeing keyes on a STANDARD keyboard is a BITCH.

So, I bought this, and don't know how I EVER lived without it.

BLUE, RED, and PURPLE leds. Just keep pushing the LED button to change the color. Hold it Down for 3 secs to turn Lleds Off.

Big Printed letters are ALSO easier to see.

BUY THIS! You WONT REGRET IT (unless you get a Defective one)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Couldn't work without it.  Well, could...but, wouldn't want to.  Have recommended this unit to friends with vision problems.
Keyboard lights blue, red and white.  I could do without the red...but, that's me.  illumination is good.  Would buy it again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like this keyboard pretty well. The colors are bright and clear. Does occasionally have random keys stick if you don't hit them dead center.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: No complaints.  I plugged it up to a Linux Mint 15 machine and all the basics worked immediately.  I have not tried any of the extras or even found out what they do, but i will.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: COOL looking and REALLY nifty! LOVE this keyboard, the lights are SOOOOO COOL! Nice and EXTRA large letters; AT LAST I can see at night when the lights are out! Recommend it whole heartedly, a MUST for half blind (kidding) people that CAN'T see in the dark (not kidding, LOL), LIKE ME!
summary: COOL, what more can I say!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I LOVE HOW THE NUMBERS LITE UP.(3 COLORS TO CHOOSE FROM)  KEY BOARD LETTERS AND NUMBER ARE VERY LARGE SO  MY AGEING EYES CAN READ THEM FINE WITHOUT GLASSES.

I WOULD RECCOMEND TO A FRIEND!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm not sure how I ever got along without this thing!! It's great for working in low light (when I don't want to wake the hubby) and for when your eyesight isn't too great. I recommend this keyboard for anyone who works in lower light situations or have trouble with sight. I love mine!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this keyboard more for the fact that it's back-lit.  The large print was not an issue.  My main issue is comfort.  So far it is just OKAY.  The lighting is good, I like the fact I have a choice of colors.

I will edit this when I have more time on that keyboard...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I actually didn't notice all of it's features until I installed it.  It's way more than I expected, and I really like it.

 it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Plugged it in and it works like a champ. Letters are large and lit. perfect for a guy losing his sight like me. Some of the reviews say it looks or sounds cheap, I disagree and anyway consider the low price you are paying for this item before you dish out a bad review.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Got this as a gift and I love everything about it the led illumination feature is great and the large print does wonders especially at night.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
THIS IS MY 2ND ONE,MY DAUGHTER LIKE MINE SO I HAD TO BUY ANOTHER FOR MYSELF.
I DON'T NEED LIGHTS ANYMORE TO SEE WHAT I'M TYPING AT MY PC. SAVES MY WEAK EYES.
I'M NOT A FAST TYPER BUT WITH THIS I'M GETTING BETTER.
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The users went crazy over this thing. The keyboard is on a stand kind of far below eye level when standing so the lighted keys really helped them out. Also added one into the server room because when you get those occasional power outages and no lights in there, it sure helps to light up the keyboard.
summary: Users adore it, good for dark server room

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Its ok I guess but really loud to type on and has a cheap look and feel to it. The only real pro is that can change colors.
This is not a keyboard I would recommend.
summary: Don't waste your time - looks better in the picture

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Before this one I owned a Saitek Eclipse which stopped working about a month after the warranty expired.  Customer service from Saitek was no help and I certainly was not going to invest more money with them.

Not needed it to be wireless I went with this keyboard and it has performed flawlessly.  I even spilled a large cup of water on it.  I took it outside and used compressed air to blow out the water and then allowed it to dry overnight.  Next day no problems.  Still going strong.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is a great keyboard for desktop use at night, especially if your eyesight isn't great.
I would love to have a smaller version of this keyboard to be used with desktops that have less desk space available.

PROS:
- Multiple LED colors to suit your preference. I prefer the red for nighttime use and the blue for daytime use.
- Large type to help clearly identify the keys. Great for young children that are not yet familiar with a keyboard's layout.
- Large keys to help select the key you want. This is great for my large hands.

CONS:
- No LED on/off switch. While plugged in, the keyboard will always be illuminated even when not being used.
- Very large footprint. This keyboard has a border between the keys and the edge that is over half an inch on all sides. There is barely enough room to fit this keyboard and a mouse pad next to it.
summary: Great for bad eyes at night

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The idea of the keayboard is great, but the keys don't feel solid.  They seem to have become loose and flimsy.
summary: Nice lights but keys feel a bit flimsy

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keys stick horribly.  I do NOT recommend buying it. The other aspects of the keyboard are OK, but it's mostly usless.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am not that picky about keyboards but all of the keys are sticky enough as you press them that it makes this keyboard one of the worst I have ever used.

Update -- I threw it away -- the sticky keys were that bad.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I like having the lights low while I'm at the computer and the soft blue keys are ideal
for this type of ambiance.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Soon after arriving --  after the great novelty of the multi-colored backlights wore off -- one of the keys stopped working. And then another; and then two more.  Amazon was great about getting me a free replacement.  Hope the new one stays working well.  p.s. the usb cable is just a bit short.
Addendum:  The new one: Space barstickshalfthetime.  Can't get spacing between words. Now what?  Senditback again??
summary: Broke so soon?! And then again!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keyboard is sturdy and the backlight is far beyond any other keyboard such as this that I am ever purchased.  For the record I had purchased five similar units as gifts or for my personal use.  The letters on the keyboard appear to be at least 20% larger than normal.  Which makes typing considerably easier in low light situations.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I wanted to use this keyboard for not only typing documents but also for a little gaming here and there. But this keyboard is... basically a crappy keyboard with lights. The feel of the buttons are very strange; sort of like a laptop keyboard without the clicking sound. When you are typing, it feels as if the keys are getting stuck even though they're not and the responsiveness of the keys are pretty low so I end up typing really loudly because I'm trying to press hard to get the keys to work 100% (but that doesn't always work). While gaming, because this keyboard doesn't have the normal clicking of a regular keyboard, it feels very strange when you're walking around in the game. And in the pictures for the product, the keys look very big, bigger than a standard keyboard. IT'S A LIE. These keys are literally the exact same size as a normal keyboard, it's just that it creates the illusion that they're bigger. The colors for the lighting of the keyboard isn't as vibrant as I wanted them to be. It'd be like if you wanted to draw with highlighter on your keys, that would be around the same dull illumination you're getting. But, if you had the lights off in your room and the keyboard lights were on, then they look pretty sick. But in conclusion, get something else. The only decent thing about this keyboard are the lights.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I've been using this keyboard for a few months now ... the backlit keys are really nice for when I want to use the computer at night and don't want to turn on every lamp in the room, but the key action is very poor. None of the keys have a smooth action ... I haven't pried up any yet to see the mechanics but I can tell just by feel they all have a loose-fitting post. With letter keys it's not a big deal, but for all the large keys (tab, shift, enter, etc. etc.) they have to be struck *exactly* perfectly dead center, with a perfectly vertical motion or the keys *will* stick / jam or otherwise fail to work as expected on the first strike. If you're not a touch-typist, or are a hunt-and-peck typer, this will not likely inconvenience you. If you expect to be able to type a lot and fast (say, 40 or 50 or more wpm) then this is not the keyboard for you.

Pros:  every key is backlit, choice of 3 colors, keys are nicely sized
Cons: keys all feel flimsy, key action is not smooth, keyboard is nowhere close to ergonomic

Update December 2014: After nearly a year of use, the flimsy action and constant jamming have defeated me. I like the large back-lit letters but it is extremely difficult to type quickly and correctly on this keyboard, and I'll be replacing it with a higher-quality (and probably more expensive) board soon. I would revise my overall grade of this item down to 2.5 stars (from my original 3.5), but I'll leave the extra half star up there primarily since it was a very inexpensive board.
summary: Lighting is great, keyboard feel & response not so much

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Pros: I love the look and design of this keyboard. The three colors look great and having the ability to turn off the lights is awesome. When the keys don't stick they're very responsive.
