Cons: Sticking keys make this unusable. Absolutely horrible experience with this thing. Sadly I'll have to go back to my previous keyboard, because this is the worst typing experience I've ever had. The keys are also incredibly loud and squeak when I type.
summary: Looks Great, Stick Keys Make it Unusable

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Piece of crap. If you want a keyboard that will not work right from the beginning and is clunky like a 75 ford pinto than this is the keyboard for you. I wanted to return it and Azio practically asked for my first born son, my right leg and both my thumbs in order to accommodate a return. I packed this back in the origninal box and sent back as cheaply as I could, here it is almost a month later and I contacted them for to only tell  me I probably didn't send everything they wanted and I am just S.O.L. do yourself a favor and avoid any business with Assio.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Bought this for HTPC/gameroom use, and it's perfect.  Only thing I'd like better is for it to be wireless.

I haven't had any issues playing games, for example, where multiple keypresses don't register -- at least not yet.
The backlight options are great and just bright enough.
The lettering is big and very legible in a dark room.

My only small gripe is that the key action itself isn't as good as a standard keyboard -- if you don't hit these keys closer to the center, they might end up sticking against the "side" of their own action.  That's a minor grievance, and something you get used to quickly enough.
summary: Awesome for HTPC use, darker rooms

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: How would I really know that?  It was just supposed to be a play on the word "type" 'cause that is what you do with a keyboard, write?  I like it though and it functions great so far after a couple of weeks of service.  Computer recognized it right off.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Been using this for some time now as the external keyboard to a couple different laptops. Works great. I will be looking for a Bluetooth version of this, if one is available. UPDATED: I have now been using this keyboard for 3 1/2 years and love it. It goes through a bit, as I use it as a lap-keyboard while sitting in my recliner. Its been 'dropped' (off my lap), and baged around a bit, but keeps on working. I now get USB connect and disconnect signals from Windows sometimes. I believe I am finally wearing out the cable. I would like to buy the wireless version, but the reviews show possible drop-out issues with the bluetooth. I shall probably buy a new one of these soon.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Pros:
Backlit.
Large characters

Cons:
if your fingers are not centered on the letters, they will get stuck. e.g. if you press a key on any one of the 4 corners. Chances are they will stick and be hard to press. I have noticed mistyping words by leaving out characters. There has to be a more conscious effort to type with greater force or have your fingers perfectly centered over the keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I HAVE GONE THROUGH AT LEAST A DOZEN KEYBOARDS IN THE LAST FEW YEARS, IT SEEMS I AM ALWAYS LOOKING FOR THE "RIGHT ONE" THAT COMBINES GOOD TYPING FEEL, AND THE ABILITY TO SEE THE KEYBOARD IN THE DARK MAN CAVE THAT I INHABIT IN THE WEE HOURS OF THE DAWN.

THIS THING WORKS, ALTHOUGH IT SEEMS TO LIKE THE COLOR BLUE BY DEFAULT, I THINK THE PURPLE COLOR SHOWS UP BEST IN THE DARK.  MY ONLY COMPLAINT SO FAR IS THAT THE F AND J KEYS COULD USE A LARGER "BUMP" SO THAT YOU CAN FIND THEM QUICKLY BY FEEL.  OTHER THAN THAT, IT SEEMS OK ON FIRST BLUSH.

THIS THING ONLY COST LIKE $25.00 AND I HAVE PAID $200.00 FOR OTHER BOARDS THAT WERE NOT AS USEFUL.
summary: I JUST HOOKED THIS UP LAST NIGHT AND IT IS GREAT TO TYPE ON AND I CAN SEE IT IN THE DARK DUE TO THE LARGE CHARACTERS THAT LIGHT.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Nice large letters that are illuminated but STIFF LOUD keys to the likeness of old typewriters you have to "hammer" on are a negative. Loud, loud, loud.  NO reason for this in this technological world.  I will be looking for another board.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The keyboard is what i wanted..a keyboard that lite up but...

Cons:
-The keys are extremely sticky, so much so that it impedes my typing
- The colors are fine but for some reason does not make the keys view-able, possibly off colors or dim light
- Cheap product but like i said...i got what i paid for

Pros:
3 color options
Quick keys come in handy
summary: Got what I paid for and less

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Lighting is great, but keys are hard to type with. You have to push more and keys stick. Do not buy!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a great fun tech toy. The only thing is that the key feel is just not a solid as I would like. I am super happy with it and have bought more for friends!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Finally a keyboard for us Big men! I have fat long fingers and finally someone has made a keyboard for us Men. I bought this for my mother because she has eye problems but her fingers are small so I am going to get her the smaller keyboard that I bought from somewhere else. I love this keyboard so much!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I love this keyboard. It is great that you can chose which color lights you use (purple, blue, or red). It makes typing in a low light room very easy. No eye strain.  The keys are easy to get used to and type on.

One thing I wish--that the keyboard lights would automatically go off when you turn the computer off, and since it doesn't, I wish the keyboard could be turned off faster. My keyboard gets left on all the time because I forget to turn it off.  To turn off the keyboard lights you press down on the button that changes the color for about 3 seconds. Turning the lights back on is simple and quick, you just press the buttons once and they come back on.

In spite of the keyboard not turning off automatically, I still love it and would buy it again. It has been very nice on my eyes.
summary: I can see! It's a miracle

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this keyboard because its high review score, but I must say its construction is rubbish, functions key keeps pressed so you need a blade or a clip to unstuck it.
Regular fast speed writing is uncomfortable because you can feel the key struggling with the keyboard.
Unless you're intending to buy this keyboard for a slow speed writing (one finger per hand) I will not recommend it for anyone else, if you are a gamer don't even think about it.
Its a Shame because the letter size is excellent, the illumination is superb, it is an excellent design with poor building.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I wanted a keyboard where the keys would be back lit and easily viewable and this fits the bill.
The letters and characters are quite large on this. That maybe off putting to some. I like the choice of 3 different back lit colors.
I use it for my bedroom computer and It's usually pretty dark in there.
would've been nice if it were wireless too but for just over 20 bucks it does the job just fine.
I'm happy with it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Overall, I am happy with this purchase of the backlit keyboard. It definitely makes using the PC in low light MUCH better than a non-lit keyboard. That said, its very light in weight and I needed to secure it in my desk mount drawer so it wouldnt keep "floating" around. Also, the key heights are very shallow, about 2/3 the height of a normal keyboard. This doesn't affect typing as much as gaming where you kind of "feel" your way to certain keys (directional arrows, etc.).

Overall a great product for the cost and I use it daily!
summary: More bling with color for any PC!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: but does light up well and i can see what I'm typing which is why i bought it for my home

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My wife and kids really love the way this keyboard is easy to read.  I find it a little stiff, but I type with 10 fingers.  Since I didn't buy it for me, I am giving it 5 stars because my family loves it.  It certainly does not match the Decor because it is plugged into an iMac.  The best part, everyone can pick their favorite color.
summary: EASY to see, a little stiff for the touch typist

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: things i like about this keyboard is that the letters are large , well lit and attractive . unfortunately the keys are a bit clunky , have a long throw and a bit noisy typing on. not anywhere like a quality laptop touch. however it does suit the purpose very well . typing in poor light or even in the dark  .

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I have owned it for about a week and here is what I have to say.

1) I this is your first illuminated keyboard, your eyes may strain for the first day or two if you keep it beneath your computer's screen. Your eyes will adjust in due time.

2) The control buttons work with Windows 8.1 with no extra installations.

3) The keys press down slightly soft, unlike my old keyboard whose keys were rather resistant to my pushing. Once again I got use to that quickly.

4) The keyboard is definitely wider than that of my 15.6" laptop, and my old "full sized" keyboard. This led to accidental key-presses, as noted by other uses. But I adjusted quickly.

5) If directly wired to your computer, the back-light will turn off with the computer, although it resets to blue once the PC powers on again despite your previous selection. I gave up and left them as blue because of this. If the lights do not turn off, simply hold down the designated button for 3 seconds or so.

6) All and all it is a great keyboard. The larger print seems a bit odd at first, but I actually appreciated it in the long run.

Give it about a week of adjustment, as if it were new shoes, and you will not want to go back!

The only things I would complain about are that the "home", "print screen", and other abbreviations are just confusing and unnecessary. The other complaint is that it always resets back to blue, a switch instead of a button would have resolved this.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard is addicting and wonderful. It would take a LOT to make me switch from it. It helps so much for gaming at night.
However, some of the keys give you a hard time if you don't hit them at the right angle.
Caps Lock, Tab, Shift. My pinky isn't that long so, those keys give me trouble because I can't hit them at the keyboards 'preferred' angle >.>

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keys are a little stiff and not as responsive as I would like. Otherwise, not all that bad at the price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Only problem I have had is that some keys seem to stick. It may work out with time and typing.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I was concerned with various reviews about sticky keys. I type frequently and have had no issues with the keys. I like the lighted keys. Nice look, and helpful when the room light is dim. Glad I decided to purchase this keyboard.
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Wired Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this keyboard because typing in the dark is very frustrating!!!!

The media functions are great, and install without having to download any drivers. Plug and Play is always nice.
The lights are bright, and the option for different colors is very nice and necessary at times.
Also being able to turn the lights completely off is a nice feature.
There is a nice amount of space to rest your wrists also, wasn't expecting the keyboard to be this comfy!
Sometimes keyboards are setup a lil different then i'm used to and i mistype but this keyboard feels perfect to my fingers.
The large print is a nice touch and i think all illuminated keyboards should be like this too.

I would like to mention that the first keyboard I ordered failed to illuminate, but I did a return through amazon and the keyboard that arrived worked perfect. Smooth and easy return transaction, no questions asked.

Only flaw so far is that some of the larger keys rub against surrounding keys and make a lil noise, I will probably take the problem keys off and file them down. This will not deter me from buying another one of these for my office.

I do recommend this keyboard, even if you are not using the lights. You will find the keyboard comfy and the media buttons useful.

Best $26 I've spent
summary: Great Keyboard, lights up nicely and is comfy

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Some of the keys stick...but after using it for about a week they seem to be easing up with use.  For $25, can't complain.

After ordering two...returned one, stopped working.  Ordered another, worked well for about 3 months...died completely.  Now the other one has died.  Save your money.  I don't know how these have gotten such terrific reviews.  Third strike, you're out!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Yeah, the keyboard is cool and lights up. The only thing that I would tell you is the keys are kind of funny. They are super responsive, almost overly responsive.... Very sensitive and fluid so if that is what you want -- this is a great case for you. Personally, I like a keyboard that almost makes me work for it, lol.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Just what I wanted/needed. As my eyes get older, and sometimes having a need to work in dim light, this back-lit keyboard hits the right notes.

Letters are well lit and large - keys are responsive and have good tactile feedback.

This will definitely be in the Xmas stockings of my friends and family.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: So far, so good. Decent look and feel. Three BG color options, Blue, Red and Purple. No sticky keys... a whole lot nicer then, Black LED Lighted Keyboard W 9868BK

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great for my elderly father who really likes websurfing, but has a hard time seeing normal keyboard keys.  Solid build, nice tactile feedback.
summary: Backlit, large keys are great for my elderly father

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
My wife somehow wears off the letters on keyboards very quickly.  I have to replace her keyboard about once every three months.  I think it has something to do with her typing style, long finger nails, or funny hand lotions she uses.  So I thought a lighted keyboard would theoretically solve the issue of the letters rubbing off the keys since they are translucent on this keyboard instead painted on as they are on a conventional keyboard.

So far, my wife likes this keyboard, although she complains the keys are a bit stiffer and are taking some getting used to.  I offered to return it but she said she'll be fine with it.  She does like the backlighting.  So far, no problems with the keyboard.  The price is certainly good for a wired, backlit keyboard with large keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The price is good, but what good is any keyboard when the buttons stick?  I bought this as a gift for my parents and I wish I hadn't.  I feel like they feel obligated to use it now, and the keys are super annoying because they stick when you use them.  It's a lot cheaper than other light-up keyboards for a reason.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I do not think that this keyboard is  yer old, nd the "FIRST" key hs filed. Yesm there us  jey tht dies not work nd I guess you cn figure out which one it is. Hint: vowel.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It really helps to work with this in low light areas and sometimes in a completely dark room. It is a full keyboard and you even have a choice of the color of the lighted keys. yet, the best thing here is that it does not need a separate switch to turn it on/off. once you plug the USB and it is recognized by the computer it automatically shut off when you turn the computer off and comes on when you turn the computer on again. I could not ask for anything more in a keyboard. I have used it for several months now and it is working like a charm.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Tried this keyboard instead of the pricier Logitech.  Two keys stuck out-of-the-box; couldn't type one without the other.  Pried the two of them apart, but other keys take some strong fingers to depress.
summary: You get what you pay for!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I do a lot of typing on a daily basis and have used this keyboard for almost a year. This has held up far longer than the last one (another brand) that I used- the old one lost the key markings making it hard to read. Illumination remains on when the computer is in hibernation, so I presume it is on when the computer is off. This is not a factor for my use. The keys offer decent feedback and are large and easy to use.
summary: Good full size keyboard, seems durable

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: we thought they were wireless but for the price, Backlit keyboard was worth it, but would have been more useful if it was wireless!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great for the older residents at the retirement center. The different colors are great as some like the blue and some like the red or white. The best thing is the letters don't wear off!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
keys stick and it has become unusalable.
definatley would not recomend this.
the lights are good but you cant type on it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Had to return this because the comma key and some other random keys kept sticking. Also some of the lettering was weird and not common. The keyboard also doesn't sit like a normal keyboard so it is makes it awkward to type.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard has met all my expectations. Now I can type in the dark, early morning hours and see the keyboard clearly.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Large well lit keys. Very nice feel when typing. A bit loud when typing fast. Media keys are nice touch. I give it a 10 out of 10.
summary: Good Quality Keyboard for a reasonable price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am a fast touch typist, and for my normal work this keyboard is unusable. The little fingers are the worst! Example: If you press the A key down perfectly straight from above it works fine, but from the touch typing angle it always binds, so to compensate you press harder. The text is then often left without many letters, and you must go back to correct them. This keyboard will get me through for a short time period, until a better one arrives. A good backup one to have around I suppose. Also the noise it makes is very different and I believe much louder then a normal keyboard, a little more pressure is needed to depress the keys and when they bottom out you get a nasty slapping click, particularly typing faster. It would definitely wake up my wife if I were trying to work next to her in the bedroom. Just typing this paragraph, my left little finger is getting fatigued!
The lights are great, and I like the red/orange color the best, for one finger work and very slow typing, this keyboard is adequate. Index fingers held right over the key then pressed straight down, you do ok. I am sorry I bought this one. In a store, I do not believe it would sell at all if anyone could try before you buy. I do not like to give a negative report, but in this case I have to.
summary: Good visual impresion, no good for touch typists.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I started off with the purchase of a glow in the dark keyboard because I often work in a nearly pitch black room. Unfortunately the glow in the dark one actually only glows in the light.

This was about $2 more from Amazon and rather than messing around all day hoping to get a glow it lights up. I like that I can select one of three pleasing colors.
summary: IF YOU work in low light this is for you.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Liked the illumination and large lettering on the keys, good price and quick shipping of course.  Lots of good feedback on the ask a question area, good folks here. BUT-- Too hard for me to press the keys down, lots of keystrokes not registering, I'm a bad enough typist as it is. Reluctantly RMA'd. Bought another refurb Logitech K800 from a certain juvenile ovum. Worth the extra $

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: 2nd one I've ordered, both were gifts. Well received, the people liked them a lot. If they worked with Mac I would get one for myself. The colors that light up look great.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: it is working great and we have no issues, all the colors work just fine, pleasently supprised for the price

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Over two years, I bought five of these.  I don't know why anybody uses a different one than this.
summary: Over two years, I bought five of these.  I don't know why anybody uses a different one than this.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I was skeptical because of some bad reviews however... this keyboard works better than most. Two months an no issue!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought this for my mom and she is 67 years old.  She can see the letters very clearly beacause they are huge.  The lights are an added bonus for night keying.  If you keep staring at the keyboard, you feel alittle quizzy.  My mom didn't complain of that symptom but who stares at their keyboard, right?
summary: Great keyboard - huge letters and bright lights

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great for lights out typing. The choice of the three colors, red, purple, and blue, is a nice touch. I find the keys a bit too stiff for my tastes, almost like the are sticking, and the fact there is no way to turn off the lights annoying. That is why I can't give it five stars

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The lighting is well done and the keyboard is very easy to see. As other reviewers have said, "key feel is is not like a quality full stroke keyboard but more like a laptop, and, the keys do stick especially if hit off center".  I did a little investigation and found that the keys that stick had a burr from injection molding on the edge. Carefully removing the key-top with a small tool and running the key edges down a fine file cured the problem. I ran the key-top down the file with light pressure and at a slight angle to taper the key bottom in the direction of the stroke. 100% cure on the keys I filed. Doesn't improve the stroke but cured the sticking. Would of rated 4 stars if it wasn't such a pain to do.
summary: Keys stick but there's a cure otherwise it's a 4 star backlit keyboard for the price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Keys are glitchy, they hang up if you do not hit dead center of the key. I find it holding me up quite a bit when working. Another review had claimed the keys were really easy like a laptop and I find it the complete opposite. I actually want an easy to the touch keyboard that works like the keys on my laptop. This is not it.
The keys seem to be getting worse wit use and I have only had it a few months.
I have to look elsewhere.
summary: Not that Great - But Looks Cool

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love it. Got if for my 5 year old son for Christmas and only just tested it out. Had to switch it out for another one because the first one was defective but their was no hassle about doing it. Big letters that glow different colors and big buttons for his little fingers. ill update after he use it for a while.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Vibrant colors, Large size letters, it's exactly what these old eyes needed. As a mid 50's gamer, my eyes are shot and my reflexes slow. My old keyboard was dying and it was time to replace. I looked at alot of the gaming keyboards, and just could not justify $100+ for a keyboard that was that highly specialized. I knew I needed light, and the large size of the key sysmbols appealed to me. So for under $30.00 this was worth a shot.

Very happy with the results, and at this price I can afford other goodies.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Affordable AND attractive. Light cycles between bright blue, orange-red, and lavender-purple with the touch of a button. Keys are nice and big, so visibility is no problem, especially at night. After a year of use it has held up well, no broken keys or major problems.

The paint is starting to wear off the most used keys though, to be expected. That could be fixed with some durable black paint and a small paintbrush. Also, the light-up nature of the keys makes them a bit hard to see in daylight. You can remedy that by keeping the lights on, I've had mine on for at least 12 hours a day and as you can see, it still works fine.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Good price, nice look, illuminated keys are wonderful .... but the engineer that designed it apparently has never actually used it.  The keys stick constantly, making it useless.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great for people who have a difficult time seeing the letters on a keyboard. The keys a backlit and can be changed to one of 3 different colors.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Got this bad boy for my wife who had some keyboard envy of my Logitech G15. Mostly she was jealous of the keys that lit up and glowed in the dark. This keyboard fit the bill for her. The keys are big and bright, and it's not as geeky as my keyboard. Other than the keys themselves, it is a no-frills keyboard that is still holding strong. If you like to sit in the dark in front of your computer, you won't be sorry.
summary: Keys are bright and big--good deal

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I felt old ordering this but the feeling went away as soon as I got it and hooked it up.
It gave new life to my computer usage. I've never been a touch typist and got tired to looking for the keys, especially in low light.
Now I don't need to have a big blinding light on when I'm at my keyboard and the hunt for the keys has diminsihed.
Not only are the lights helpful but the large keys make input so much easier.
The Hot Keys all work prefectly, even with Windows 8.1 Getting to your email, internet, music & documents is simply a click away.
My computer came with a wireless keyboard but it lacked a Cap Lock indicator light. I was contstantly having to re-enter user names * passwords because the caps were locked and I didn't realize it.
I am extremely pleased with this product and highly recommend it.
summary: This isn't just for the AARP generation

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Much better than the picture..Nice construction, durable material, all keys work great. Hot keys easy to use and responsive. One button key color change. For $28 it's a steal. I'm really happy with this purchase.
summary: You must get one of these

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard is too hard to type on. The bottom of the keyboard is big so you have to move your hands farther to get to the keys. I tried using this for a day and gave up. I wouldn't waste my money on this if I were you.
summary: Not very easy to type on this keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is what it is - a cheap keyboard. It has a couple of notable features, primarily that the keys are backlit, the backlighting color is selectable, and the lettering on the keys is large-type.

However, in production use the keyboard was simply too flimsy, noisy, and unreliable, so I returned it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The backlit keys don't seem to work, and the key travel isn't smooth. Some keys stick if you don't press the key straight down, and you think it worked but you see missing characters where you typed. I have been using a Logitech keyboard for years and thought the backlit keyboard would be an improvement. I am going back to my Logitech keyboard or perhaps seeing if they make one that has backlit keys.
summary: Cheap feel, backlit keys didn't work

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I mainly needed this because I have one computer that has to be used in a very dark room - no lights. We were having trouble seeing the keys and the keyboards we use on a regular basis are a little different so key positions are hard to memorize. I love how bright the colors are on all of the keys. I didn't need big print but not a bad feature, I guess. But I'm glad I don't have to type on it very much because the keyboard presses feel cheap. If you've ever tried to use a cheap keyboard that required you to press the keys down hard, you'll know what I mean. The keys are not pleasant to press on this. It's one of the worst keyboards I've tried. But if you just need it for very occasional typing in a dark room, it's not a bad choice. I wouldn't buy it for extended typing, though.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I use this keyboard on a daily basis and everyone who see;s it, wants one. I should buy extra's just to sell they are so nice.
summary: Lights up, quiet, everything you could ever want in a keyboard for this price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I just received this keyboard. I love everything except the keys I need to play my game are extremely hard to get them to depress. I believe an appropriate tool would be a balpeen hammer. I find it amazing they would make such a nice keyboard with keys that are terrible to press down. I am going to give it  week or so, if the keys don't improve I will send it back or replace it. (UPDATE) It did not improve and like a fool tried another one to see if it would be any better as I really liked the backlit and style, but alas the second was as bad as the first. Sent both back. End of story.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like it and the letters are jumbo big the only problem is that I ordered it wireless but was sent the other type but I like it. It lights up pretty good during the day and definitely at night.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Nice keyboard that has back lighted keys.  Three separate colors of light to choose from, plus you can turn the color off.
The keyboard is very light.  I would imagine that if you are the type of user who "bangs" on the keyboard it's not going to last long.
Since I type with a "light" touch I shouldn't have any problems.
I'm also a "feel" typist.  The bumps on the two home keys (F and J) are a little small, would have liked them larger.
The keys are very flush.  I would prefer keys that are more raised, but that's just personal preference.
For the price I think it's a good buy.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Large letters and a nice feel on the keys. All colors show well, with blue showing up the best in dim lighting.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Full keyboad.
Special function & multimedia keys on top are nice.
I like the whitish led display better then the red and then blue.
Keys caps are lower so it is little more difficult felling the key layout.
summary: Special function & multimedia keys with whitish LEDs

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm using it right now, as I have been every day since receiving it months ago.  I really needed a back-lit keyboard for my dark studio environment, and this one is very affordable.
summary: Exactly what I needed and expected at a great price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Sticky keys, not recommended for someone who touch types 100 wpm as I do. (author of 5 books, 17,000+ articles, and science editor of perihelionsf.com

I need a good keyboard where each key responds to the same touch. This keyboard looks great and I appreciate the backlight at night when I often write articles, but can't abid4e the way some keys bind just enough to make me stop and deliberately press the key. If I go at my full speed there are always missed characters.
summary: Cute, but not for anyone who keyboards for a living. I put it on the kitchen computer.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keytop labels are nice and large, and the backlighting is bright enough to see in the dark without glare in the light. My only complaint is that the keys don't depress as far as I'm used to. I seem to make more typos on this keyboard than on others--including laptop keyboards. When the key hits bottom, it's hard and abrupt. There's no cushion. I went from a mechanical buckling spring keyboard to this one, so it was quite an adjustment. If you can live with the short keypress travel, it's fine.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: So far so good.  Different color keyboard is good to fit your mood.  Keyboard is a little small and if you have big fingers, well you may have trouble hitting the wrong key accidently.
summary: Great smaller keyboard with three color lighted keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Every time someone sees my keyboard they ask me how to get one like it! Large lettering and lit keys make it so much easier!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keyboard works very well, but the enlarged letters on the keys do not really stand out no matter which of the three colors are used to light them.
summary: Lighted keys are not very bright

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Typing in the Dark has never been easier.  Worked great right out of the box, and I love the color options.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The illumination feature is just excellent and just what I was looking for. However, the keys frequently hang up and impede smooth typing functionality.  Considering this fact, I paid too much.  I will be changing out this keyboard soon.
summary: Typing keys are clunky.  Regret the purchase

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Takes a little getting used to. The keys are so flat and depress down so little that it isn't really made for lots of fast typing. It doesn't have the tactile feel and use. But I have become used to it and type with it everyday (at least a few pages) and it works fine. What is great about this keyboard is the light up led keys. They aren't cheap. I've had other led keyboards that the keys were painted/coated, which rubs off with regular use in a few months (so you have no idea what key is what). But these are actually plastic with the letters formed in the key so the light can shine through. That means the letters aren't going to wear off no matter how much you use them.

The led is awesome, nice big letters that are easy to see in low light (or no light for that matter). Quality construction that isn't going to wear out. If you like to work in low light (no glare on the screen) and want a quality light up led keyboard (with 3 awesome colors) that will last a long time, then this is worth every penny. Just be aware that the keys are not very tactile: they are very flat and don't press down far, so it will take some getting used to at first switching from a standard keyboard.
summary: Quality, but not the best for lots of typing.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I love the keyboard except for the keys stick. If i type too fast the keys get stuck and I have to tap on them several time to get them to type.
Other than that I love the big illuminated  letters so I don't have to have a big bright light while working at night time.
I wish there was a solution for the keys sticking.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Good concept but bad execution. This is a clunky keyboard. The size of the lettering, and the back-lighting works just fine. But, at some point you will be doing typing on this keyboard, and it is at that time that it will become apparent that this is a cheap, clunky keyboard, and that most if not all the keys stick. The action is terrible. Now I am not a fast typist so even at my slowish typing speed the keys felt clunky and sticky. I guess the only time this keyboard would work is if you are a one-finger typist . . . .

I returned it for the Logitech Ultra thin Illuminated keyboard - what a difference. Now that is quality! Keys feel great, quiet, and the back lighting works well. Got a refurbished one from Amazon at a reasonable price, and I am happy to pay the difference

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Wow this is a great keyboard. I bought it about 3 weeks ago and I was really bummed because after only having it for about 2 weeks I spilled water on my number pad. I evaporated the water and it still works great! Amazing. I probably should have got a "waterproof" keyboard but this seems to be doing the trick. It is well lit. Every color is vibrant and just beautiful to look at but they are all easy on your eyes especially if you are in a dark room, you will be able to clearly see your keys without it blinding you. Definitely worth the price.
summary: Great Keyboard. Easy to see and read and is sturdy

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: if you like the larger (I do) keyboards and want it to glow in dark so you can use it with lights off, Buy This one.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The larger keys take some getting used to, but I am adapting.  Now I can work (or play) at night without having to turn on a light.
Product is as advertised and really looks great.  I have been showing off my new computer build and the keyboard always gets kudos.
summary: Exactly as advertised.  Looks and works perfectly.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: i luv it! perfect 4 me.better than i thot quality.nice lighted letters to c at nite,easy on the eyes.im very happy with it so far, just had for a few days,but i think it will last.would i buy another? YES!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: While the large text and lighting are excellent, this keyboard fails miserably at its main function - typing.  I am not some purist or heavy typist, I just need it for average usage and it is terrible.  The main problem is that the keys stick/bind.  When you press them down sometimes they go/move, sometimes they dont.  But in every case each letter/key requires quite a bit of force to overcome the binding.  And that force is inconsistent.  In other words it feels like there is a plastic on plastic binding.  If  you press perfectly vertical it is present but less noticeable, but press down at the slightest off angle - say 1 degree, the key binds and requires lots of force to push down. In normal typing this happens in every single word.  I have to constantly correct missing letters.  And even when I concentrate on forcefully pushing every key, they still bind and my overall typing speed is reduced significantly.  I really have to return this.  It is so bad it is in the realm of unusable.
summary: All keys bind horribly. Can not really type on this keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Nice, it defaults onto Blue, which is certainly a nice color, one can also make it go red or purple via a button on the keyboard.

  Keys are nice and big.
summary: Yes, we like the Two we bought.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love the large keys, I have fat fingers and I'm a hunt and peck type of guy. The lighting on the key pads are pleasing to the eyes. You have red, blue and pink/purple colors, at least on my keyboard. It's perfect for night use for gaming or just typing in the dark. I didn't give it a 5 star because the shift key on the right side of the board seams harder to push down at times, not all the time but once in a while. All in all, it's a great board. I've had it for about four months now and no problems with lights .
summary: I"ll buy another if this dies

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this keyboard specifically for my kids computer. They love it. The large letters make it easy for them to hunt and peck.

If this were for me, I'd give it 2 stars. I don't like the key spacing. But since this is for my kids, I will give it 4 stars.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I like the colors. Great fun selecting colors as I feel like- easy press of the "LED ILLUMINATION" button and you get to pick your color- and also great for using in the dark.

I just wish it had a dimmer selection for the keys- I get migraines sometimes and it's kind of bright in those situations. The size of the letters is HUGE compared to a normal keyboard. Pretty good for someone with bad eyes... but for a normal person it will take some getting used to.

Overall the minus one star was just the fact I wish it had an "off" or "dim" setting on the illumination. Not that big of a deal but would be a nice addition to an already nice keyboard.
summary: Great but I wish the light selections had an off.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Good keyboard for those visually challenged. For the cost you can't beat it. If I spent more money on it I would want to have quieter keys but it's a trade off I am willing to accept.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My wife is a medical transcriptionist and I work in IT, so we both have used our fair share of keyboards.  We have mostly used Microsoft ergonomic style keyboards.  My kids like to play Minecraft, and one of the first comments from them was that the keys stick.  I didn't believe them at first until I used it.  After I used the keyboard for a few minutes I understood what they were talking about.  You have to push they keys perfectly vertically and in the center or else they are hard to push down.  I would not recommend this keyboard for anyone who types or work at the computer a lot.  The keyboard feel, function and quality are well below any Microsoft keyboard I have used.  I am not a Microsoft fan boy, these are just the keyboards I have used and like.  Actually I would not recommend this keyboard at all.  On the plus side, the back-light is very nice. The color is uniform on the whole keyboard, and the colors work.  Red for night and blue for day.  I don't use purple very often.  So for an occasional user where back-light is required and budget is small, this keyboard might work.
summary: There are better keyboards out there, but the back-light and large letters are good.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: and... the best part is that it works, just as it ought to! This is the 4th keyboard I have purchased in the past several months. The one which came with my new computer had lettering in gray in a very fine font, almost impossible to see in dim lighting. I replaced it with a Logitech wireless Logitech Wireless Touch Keyboard K400 with Built-In Multi-Touch Touchpad, which I thought would be great as 1: the lettering was higher contrast (white and bolder) and 2. I could hold it where the light was better if need be. It unfortunately had the bad habit of dropping letters, or failing to connect to the dongle/ receiver a few inches away. Since it had been purchased through the warehouse, I thought it was, perhaps, defective and so returned it and replaced it with a new one same model) and same problems, or worse :( For months I have been living with a keyboard which inserts letters, phrases, half sentences in random places, occasionally sending me to a new page.. As others have had positive experiences with that board i tried quite a few things to trouble shoot. Nothing worked so I came back and bought another keyboard, this time opting for a simple wired keyboard with a simple bold font and back lighting (and the option of 3 colors!) The Azio keyboard is usb, plug and play (at least on Windows 7, and likely others). It is full size (actually a bit larger) molded plastic. It is not lightweight, but not solid either (the back is molded) but it feels substantial enough. The action is somewhat light (so those looking for a type writer feel may be disappointed) but it is better than lap top keyboards. I find the shape and small wrist rest work/ feel better than the padded wrist rest I had been using. It has a handful of preprogrammed hot keys (for media, email). There is a key (marked with a light bulb) to change colors and turn the backlighting on and off (does anyone read manuals? in this case a 4x6" quick start guide). It is a simple usb plug and play keyboard with a large back-lit font that is easy to read, and unlike any other keyboard I have seen, it glows purple (unless you prefer red or blue). Unless this fails very quickly, i would turn around and buy another. I am very happy with my purchase and would highly recommend it. Simple Functional Reasonably priced Purple!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great lighted keyboard for late night net surfing and whatnot.  Non standard keyboard as the keys are low profile, but great for hunt and peck typer.  Good value for the money.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I just missed the return window by 2 days.  Some keys, if pressed off center just a little, jamb and won't press.  It happens on the "A" and the "S" keys most.  Will be giving to someone who types with two fingers, they shouldn't have a problem.  I had the more expensive Logitech lighted key board, it's worth the extra money.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Honestly, I went back and forth with this item in my cart for quite some time. I read all the reviews, and I decided to go for it once I saw the price drop to only $19.99. Well, now I have to deal with returning it. First of all, the box arrived to my house slightly damaged...basically it looked like somebody had definitely opened the box and took the product out at one point. But I figured okay, who cares, let's check it out. Before even plugging it on, I took it out of the box ---and as I did, 3 of the keys simply fell off onto my lap. Now, even at this point, I still had an open mind. The keys easily clicked back in, so I decided to play around a bit and type on it (mind you, before I even plugged it into my computer). As others have said, it feels pretty much exactly like a laptop keyboard. I knew this before I purchased it, but I didn't think it would bother me. Turns out, it did bother me, and the keys just didn't respond the way I like them to. After ALL this, I still decided what the heck, I bought it STRICTLY for the backlight, as I'm sure is the reason a lot of you are even giving it the time of day. So I plug it in, Windows 7 has no problem installing the drivers and getting it working right away. I go to press the backlight key....NOTHING. Turns out, the backlight function at least on the product I received was defective. So now, I simply HAVE to return it (Which I don't make a habit of doing because It's pretty much a hassle). So yes, I'm aware I could have received a defective unit. I personally suspect that this item had already been returned to Amazon, and surprisingly (because I'm a pretty big Amazon fan), they sent me the same one that was returned. But regardless of my broken backlight, this thing just didn't really feel that great to type on. If I were you, I would just skip it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this because I often end up typing at night in a dlmly lit office.  This is perfect for my needs.  The illumination is great, and all the keys are equally well lit.  The feel of the keys is a bit "clicky," as others have said, but for just thirty bucks I didn't expect perfection.  For my needs, it's right on the money.

By the way, I write, and the keys keep up for me with no problems.  Essentially, it's those little tasks, like passwords, where finding the right key is important, that this keyboard excells.  I can keep the lights off and still see what I am doing.

I'd highly recommend this for a good general keyboard that has the added benefit of lights.  And it gives my computer desk a very cool look, since my computer lights and keyboard are both now blue!

David Lowe

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Cons:  Totally inadequate key travel.
Very poor tactile feedback makes it nearly impossible to type quickly.
Pros:  It DOES light up.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Pros:  Large print is nice. It is LED backlit.  And you have a choice of colors.

Cons:  Keys are very hard to press, not a fluid motion at all.  Noisy (clack, clack, clack!)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Blue is fine for day, purple for night, and red for angry young teens that need to show their defiance by clicking HARD on the button. Membrane keys are positive. I wasn't tickled by the slipperiness of the feet, you need to put it on a mat or type DIRECTLY down. It is not a heavy keyboard.
summary: not too bright, not to dim

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
PROS:
-Lights are great, easy to see in the dark or dim room.
-Works right out of the box. No install disk necessary, just plug and play (I have a Win 7 computer).
-On/Off button for the 'lights' works fine.
-The 'special keys' like Print Screen, Scroll Lock, Num Lock, and even the ones for Mail, Home, Favorites, Sound volume, calculator, etc. worked fine out of the box (again no install disks necessary).
- The large keys... well I don't really need that feature and IMO I would prefer not to have the large keys, but that's ok by me.

CONS:
- I've only had it for less than a month and already the keys are starting to 'stick'... they just feel rough and I have to bang them pretty hard sometimes. But I guess for the price that's ok to live with,too, for me anyways.

UPDATE:
It's now been only two months since I've had this keyboard and the keys stick so bad now it's almost impossible to type. I am sorry I bought it. It's a shame because it's a nice looking keyboard and everything else about it worked fine...but the main function...typing...is what I need so it is useless if the keys are so hard to press. Steer clear of this one and pay a little more to get a good quality one.  You have been warned.
summary: Lights are great, but already keys are sticking.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I just got this keyboard. I love the large print, and brightly lit keys.

They conventional layout is pretty much close to the normal layout. About the only slight difference is the placement of the back-slash key, but that's not a major issue.

I don't get nearly as many errors with this keyboard's layout as I did with the compact keyboard I tried before. It's pretty much like using my other full size keyboard. I won't use anything but a full keyboard, unless it just can't be helped, like building an arcade machine, or a flight simulator where full boards won't fit.

I like the media buttons, one of which calls up the calculator, and is so marked. Oddly, these buttons are a bit tiny, and I do have to use a hand held magnifier to see them, but easy enough to memorize their locations and functions.

The feel of the keys is good. I like the sound they make too. Not too clicky, but you know you've made proper contact when you hear them tapping away as any good keyboard should. Not much for the soft, silent keys. I always got errors with those.

I like this keyboard's tri-color led, red, purple, and blue. Would've been nice to have more colors, like yellow, green, ect.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My Large yellow easy to read USB keyboard started to fail, the USB connection would just fail and come back. I decided on trying a backlit keyboard and picked this one. Over sized, some what heavy and three colors of LED backlite. Cyan Blue, Orange Red and Whitish purple LED colors to choose from. I use the white/purple most times but the red is good at night too. Feels solid, keys work well but I'm not a touch typist. NOTE: The keyboard lights up ALL the time, even when computer is powered down. I assume this is without the LEDs lit, you couldn't see keyboard and it would require some kind of wake up program. Long usb cord works well for me too.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I used to have HP keyboard which came with the HP desktop computer I bought years back. Well, at night I can't type unless I turn on the light in the bedroom. With this keyboard, I can type and see more clearly even in the dark. However, friends will make fun of me because of the large print alphabet on the keyboard. They would say I were grandpa....Other than that, it works.

Love it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I will start by saying I give this keyboard a 5 star rating for the backlit keys in 3 different colors.  I am very disappointed with the keyboard though and the reaction time when hitting keys.  I'm a seasoned typist and type at a decent speed.  This keyboard is difficult to use.  The keys have to be struck harder and, I find, a lot of times, when I read over what I typed, there are oftentimes letters missing because I didn't strike the key hard enough.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Keyboard (KB505U)

I've only used this keyboard for a few hours, and so far I love it!  I especially like the large keys, but I noticed that some people stated that the keys were REALLY large, when in fact if they're larger than normal, not by much.  What IS large is the letters and numbers themselves.  They have covered the entire button with the letters instead of just part of it.  I prefer to used my computer in very dim light, and since I'm not the best typist, I have to see the keys at all times.  This keyboard is perfect for people like me.

UPDATE: 10-4-13

As one other person stated "All keys bind horribly".  This is what I'm experiencing after a few weeks use.  At this point, the keyboard is almost impossible to type with.  What started out as a great idea has turned into a waste of money.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I had high hopes for this keyboard given the largely positive reviews, but I am greatly disappointed.  The key action is hard and keys tend to stick unless pressure is applied at 0 degrees.  This isn't an issue if you type by hunt-and-peck, but if you use all of your fingers, many keystrokes are at an angle to the key face.  Shift key, ctrl, tab, enter, these keys often jam halfway to the fully depressed position, less so for more central keys.  I then must slow and correct the typo or press the key multiple times.

Large format and lighting are great, but the mechanical action of the keys is very, very poor.  Since I live abroad, an RMA is not an option.  Perhaps I'll open up the casing and try to lubricate somthing inside....

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: All keys seem to stick after a few weeks, my enter key is sticking down pretty badly.  No recommended if you type or game a lot.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Well, at first when i saw it, i was pretty impressed with a lot of what the keyboard has to offer, and the only draw back was it was very noisy,

After the first a couple uses I sarted noticing strange things, like if I put clothes, they will not appear until I hit enter or space bar (if you just keep on typing letters and then press again clothes and "space back" you will get both parts of the clothes together at the end of the word/sentance  like=>  that"" instead of "that" ) which annoyed me, but i was like .. well, for 30bucks you can't expect too much...

Now, today 21 days after the delivery date my "backspace" button just got stuck (I have NOT spilled anything over it and I even keep it covered when I am not using it.)Yes, I was able  to get unstuck, but that's like 21 days after delivery, YES, I know its only 30 bucks , but hey 30 bucks for a WIRED keyboard its not cheap especially if their life span is less then 30 days and they start falling apart after... I mean i was unhappy when my Microsoft wireless keyboard brock down after 2 years..btw it was something like 28 dollars shipped too, so it should be a valid comparison.

So, would I buy it again ... not a Chance.....
summary: it started as a GREAT, then went down to a bit below average and it keeps going ... :S

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Large print, LED lit keyboard, with choice of 3 color (red, blue, purple) lighting. A 'click' type keyboard, the keys are somewhat condensed and not as high as a traditional keyboard. The big plus is ligibility, easy read even in the dark. I'd prefer a softer touch to the keys, but this is the best option I found.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have bought 3 of these so far, two as gifts.  For the times you do not want bright lights on near the computer, this is perfect.  There are three different colors of the lighted keyboard.  I use just the Blue, my preference.  I have yet to have any problem with keys sticking or not working.  I am going on 3 years of use with it.  I have tried the Large print keyboards with the bright letters.  This LED Backlit is much better on the eyes and more attractive.  I highly recommend it for people whose eye sight is not the best and for people who likes to use the computer in the evenings without turning on extra lights around the computer.  You will not have to strain to see the keys.  Some of use still have to watch the keyboard as to what we are typing:)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought three of these and the keys on all three are sticking.  It is very frustrating.  I would love the keyboard if the keys wouldn't stick. This is a design flaw for sure.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm happy with this product.  My only complaint is the sticking keys from time to time.  I am a fair typist, but not real fast so it isn't too bothersome but for a fast typist this might be an irritation.  I really like the backlit keyboard.  Makes finding the right keys in low light very easy.  Overall, I'm enjoying this product.
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Nice.  Large characters.  Only gripe is cannot turn off back light, just cycle between 3 different colors.  Otherwise very satisfied so far.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I previously used the wired Logitech Illuminated keyboard, but when that broke I went with this one. I actually prefer this one because you have dedicated media keys, such as volumes and play/pause, which convenient, instead of using the FN key which I loathe. It is a full-sized keyboard which I like.

It is about an inch thick so it's not exactly slim. The keys feel a little slippy compared to more expensive keyboards, I get used to it quickly but it will not give you the optimal typing speed so it isn't recommended for writing professionals, get something more expensive if you need speed and comfort. The keys doesn't have sound damping like a quality laptop keyboards so it's not quiet, maybe largely due to the hollowness of the keyboard body. Maybe the lettering on the keys are too big, but it's just my preference.

For the price it is pretty good and very useful to use in low light situation, good for web browsing, casual typing and gaming. It has 3 different colors and you can hold the 'LED' button to turn it off, I wish there were green LED in colors though.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard looks nice but on arrival a couple keys made me very nervous as they would press down but stick. After enough use though that problem went away. If you try to press a key down and at an angle it will jam into a key next to it making it very hard to push down.
The backlit keys are very nice and the option to turn it off too.
summary: Keys are sometimes difficult to press.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Not that this is a bad keyboard it's just not what I expected.  I was hoping one of the colors that lit up the keys was white.  On a cosmetic level I believe it would look nicer.  The blue is okay, the red is too bold and for some reason the violet isn't appealing.

On a functional level, the keys have a tendency to stick.  You need to hit the keys directly in the center, If typing slowly there's no problem.  If you are in a hurry you may not hit the keys in the center and they don't always depress.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great large-print keys make it much easier to use in a darkened room than a standard keyboard.  Unfortunately, the typing experience grew worse as I became accustomed to the keyboard, and I found that the keys will stick or jam if you try to get some thoughts out in a hurry.  Under casual use I think it would be fine.  I can't give it less than four stars because of the fantastic increase in visibility.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This Azio illuminated keyboard replaces a more expensive Saitek illuminated keyboard. The Saitek board, although very good overall, used  back lighting through the gaps in the keys rather than illuminating  every key symbol on the board individually. Consequently, the board was much less bright overall. If I have one criticism it is that the Azio keys seem very pressure sensitive and, being over sized, take some getting used to.  But the main point is that that I can work comfortably in very dim light or even a dark room.
summary: Excellent illumination of all keyboard symols

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: love it i can be computer with out light all time plus like larger keys better easy to type also

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The numbers are large and the backlight gives you 3 color options.  It feels a little cheap when typing on it but I guess that's to be expected.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I was so excited to see this product. I'm getting old and my eyes are failing so I jumped at this keyboard regardless of the remarks made by other users. It is advertised as a plug-N-play item and is Windows XP Professional compatible, but other than all the lighted keys. . .it did not function. I called their support number and the fellow was very helpful and tried to walk me through a manual installation, but with no luck. He advised returning it for a replacement [which I did] and to my amazement got the replacement the following day, but like it's returned brother. . .nothing worked. Now, I'm getting notices from Amazon saying the first one I sent back has never arrived. Can't win for losing it seems. Off to the phone to call Pango Pango for Amazon Customer Service.
If you know of a good keyboard with illuminated keys. . .please share it's name and model number.
summary: KEYBOARD LIT UP LIKE A CHRISTMAS TREE WITH THREE COLOR CHOICES TOO BAD IT DIDN'T FUNCTION. . .NOT ONE KEY

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Love This Keyboard with the Large Print Numbers and Letters. It's Cool to be able to use this in the dark with no room light on at night. Plus, you can change the Backlit keyboard colors from purple or orange or red or blue. Very well made and Excellent for the price at around $30.00. Highly Recommend. So If your looking for a keyboard that has a bigger look at the buttons on a keyboard and give the keyboard a backlit color you'd like to see on it, Then this is the keyboard for you! Thank You Azio! (5 Star Rating).
summary: Azio Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Keyboard (KB505U)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The illumination is great! But the keys are real sticky. And it gaming, well... you just can't have sticky keys. Figure out the sticky part on your keyboard and you'll have a really nice nice thing going on here. But for now.... no comment beyond what I've said. Sorry.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Bought From Better Choice Online

UPDATE:  STAY AWAY FROM THE  "BETTER CHOICE ONLINE"  RETAILER
READ THE ADDITIONAL UPDATE ADDED AT END OF REVIEW.....

I bought this keyboard through Amazon from Better Choice Online.

I am one unhappy consumer !

Do not purchase from this company !!!

Just recieved this today...

First there is no invoice or paperwork included in the shipping box.

On opening the product box and removing the keyboard I immediately noticed
scratches on the front of the keyboard and around the keys.
It appears someone also tried to buff this so there are buff scratch marks.

This keyboard has obviously been used.

It was well packed and the product box was in great condition and the keyboard
was in plastic.

But this is easily discernable as a used item !

I did plug it in and it does work very well - but now I have to decide if I will go through
all the trouble of returning it and then getting another one shipped....

One thing - I will never purchase anything from Better Choice Online !!!

UPDATE

I CALLED BETTER CHOICE ONLINE AND WAS BASICALLY CALLED A LIAR
THAT WHAT I AM TELLING THEM ABOUT WHAT I RECEIVED IS IMPOSSIBLE.

IT WAS AN UNCOMFORTABLE CONVERSATION.

I ENDED UP HANGING UP ON THEM.

-------

UPDATE # 2

Unbeknowst to me the Company shipped me another keyboard, then contacted me - I received it and it is new and works fine.
There's still a little burn from my initial contact with them - but they did make good on the problem.
summary: Bought From Better Choice Online  Through Amazon

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Has big lettering, and is backlit to help my sight impaired father see the keys. My complaint is, he sees the purple color the best, but the keyboard defaults to blue every time the computer is shut down, and the color key is not lighted so he can't find it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I really wanted to believe this was going to be a nice keyboard.

1- Is too light weight to be steady and the rubber feet barely make contact with the surface when the rear feet are set to have an inclination.
2- The keys make so much noise when typing is ridiculous.
3- The number 4 came stuck, it won't spring back to his normal position.
4- It is made of a cheap plastic material.
5- The illumination on the keys are not uniform.
6- to be a gaming keyboard it should it have the letters a w s d x with some sort of elevation so that you don't have to look at the keyboard when playing.

Wow, what a disappointment!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Print is nice and big, lights well and 3 color choices is nice, for which it gets 2 stars instead of one, but.... performance is horrible, you have to push through hangups on keys, not built well, most unpleasant typing experience ever, horrible for gaming, I would have givent it 2 and 1/2  stars if possible because price was good, do not buy.

Editing post: Adding one star to total 3 stars because after a LOT of use the keys break in.  If you are patient enough to muscle threw the worst typing ever for a while it will work fine.  Months of crappy typing is more than what most are willing to bear though, shame because if just depressing keys over and over and over fix issue it should be something they are able to rectify.
summary: Keys are worst I've ever felt, hanging up when you try to depress them, needs work.  Edit: improved typing with LOTS of use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like the large keys and the back-lighting colors.  Good keyboard for an older person. The typing feel is not the greatest, but I only use one finger on each hand so feel was not my major criteria.  Overall, I'm glad I bought this keyboard.
summary: got what I ask for; large backlit keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I use this keyboard so I can use the hotkeys within a digital audio workstation at night.  For this purpose it works wonderfully.  The keys are EXTREMELY easy to read (especially at night) and the option to change the color is nice.  My studio has a lot of blue LEDs, so I typically set it to blue and it looks great.  Everyone that has come over to my studio since then has commented on it, ha!  The keyboard is sturdy and well built.  The keys feel good and there are a lot of hotkeys for multimedia functions.  My only complaint is that you can not freely assign the hotkeys to any program you desire.  I would have loved a dedicated button to launch Sonar X2, or standalone synthesizers; but alas, it was not meant to be.  For the price it is a small complaint.  Overall it is a great keyboard for the price and I highly recommend it.
summary: Great, but wish the hotkeys were assignable.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The lighted part is great.

The keyboard part is the problem.  Clearly it is of low quality and most of the keys stick, meaning that when you press them they do not register a press.
