If you are not always ensuring that what you press was accepted you will see missing characters.  They also feel like they are sticking most of the time.  Not all keys are affected it seems to be about a third of the keys in various locations.

This is particularly bad for a lighted keyboard as if you think about it the people who need a lighted keyboard are those like myself that do not touch type and tend to look at the keys when they are typing and not at the screen.

It is still useable for me on a secondary computer that I seldom use and may be fine for others who do not type much and mostly interact through the mouse.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is just the ticket for a rather dark location for my PC. I was always feeling for the keys and having trouble seeing the right ones. This took all of the guesswork out. Choice of colors and it is very pleasant on the eyes and the larger letters are a plus also for the older eyes now a days. Many thanks for providing this item for our use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This key board looks good esp with back lighting but it lacks functionality. One has to strike real hard on some keys to get it to work. Letters, such as "a", "Q", "L", "E" and "X" seem needed lubrication to loosen up in order to work. Can not finish typing one sentence without going back to type in the missing letter! It is such a shame that a good looking key board functions so poorly. The 3 stars are for looks only!

  Sir Lam
summary: Good looking key board with fair functions

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I purchased this item in March, 2013; roughly 6 months ago.  Today, the space bar stopped working.  I took the keyboard apart as much as I could and saw nothing stuck or otherwise wrong so the problem seems to be with the key mechanism itself rather than a spill or other material that fell into the keyboard.  My wife has used this with an average amount of use (she is not a heavy or fast typist) so whatever is wrong is not due to misuse.  You pay for what you get so I do warn you to be prepared for this to start to fail after 6 months if you are lucky.  I will not buy this brand again and recommend you look elsewhere for an illuminated keyboard as well.  Most of the other brands I can see available cost a good bit more.  If you don't mind buying a throw-away keyboard, then this is the one for you!
summary: Azio Large Print Backlit Keyboard poor quality

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I purchased this keyboard because i liked the led lights and the price. It seemed like a good deal.

In short:

Pros:
Excellent led illumination
-Ability to turn off led lights by holding down led button
-3 led color choices
-Sturdy construction

Cons:
-Keys are difficult to press. If you like keys that are soft to press this is not the keyboard for you. The keys are very stiff and those who type fast will find this to be a significant deal breaker as you will often end up not pressing hard enough to register the keystroke.

-the keyboard keys are extremely loud. When i typed on it the first time those around me immediately complained. The sound has been described as a herd of children stampeding on a bubble wrap floor.

Overall:
If you can live with the cons or don't notice these things it is a well built keyboard otherwise with all the light features of more expensive keyboards and more at a 1/3 the price. If you are annoyed by louder keyboards or stiffer keys then continue your search.
summary: azio large print keyboard with led lights

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard was simply plug and play, the lights function great and the large print makes it easy to read in low light.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I think just about everything I have to say is in the title, for the most part.  Being large print, the keys are extremely easy to read.  The lighting is definitely bright enough, though I would love to have a dimmer knob like on my old Saitek keyboard.  For those use to the "taller" desktop keyboard keys, it may take a bit to familiarize themselves with the more laptop-like keys.  I dig the media controls at the top, though I only ever use the vol up/down/mute ones and kind of wish those were moved over to the right side, above the numpad.

Overall the keyboard does seem sturdy and well made, although I did have to return one of them because it came out of the box with a broken Win key.  But with Amazon's great return and replace policy I was able to continue using it while they sent out the replacement.
summary: Bright, easy to read, laptop-style keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: ... and she seems to love the size of the keys and the color choices (okay - my 2 year old daughter loves the color thing more than my wife.)  I tried it and the large print keys are nice - even if you only look at them occasionally.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Makes typing at night a breeze.  Loved it so much I bought two of them.  My wife likes hers too.  Recommended to anyone who has eye problems.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like this keyboard, almost 5-star love...but not quite. The one thing I don't like (and it's probably minor for a lot of shoppers) is the poor visibility of the media buttons across the top, and specifically (for me) the up-down-mute buttons, because I use them a lot.  The icons for these buttons are very small and difficult to see.  I actually put a smear of White-Out below each of the volume buttons to make them easier to find.  Adding to the frustration is that the volume-up and down buttons are not very sensitive; you kind of have to mash them to make them have an effect.  Sadly, this is a problem with many of the keyboards I've tried.  Regarding everything else about this keyboard though, I'm thrilled.  The large lettering on the keys is great, and shows clearly regardless of the chosen color, and they have a very nice 'clicky' touch which I like (this is very subjective...some like a low-travel key and some like more of an old-fashioned keyboard feel like this one).  It's not noisy but it does make a satisfying (to me) sound as I type. I haven't had any issue with the space bar being positioned too low in relation to other keys as some others have mentioned.  I type 65+ wpm and can type on this keyboard pretty quick. One other thing about the color selection...this keyboard, like a lot of other keyboards with color choices, reverts to blue each time your computer shuts down, so if you care, you have to re-select the red or purple if that is your choice.  Being a complacent kind of guy, I just leave it on blue.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Nice Keyboard. I like the lighting and ability to change colors. The only CON is the short cable. Most desktop configurations appararently need more than 5 feet because I've had a lot of keyboards and never had a problem with a short cable. You might wish to consider getting a USB extension cable, otherwise everything's great with this board!

After using the keyboard for a while, I'm ready TO SEND IT BACK because if you type a lot and don't hit the keys exactly in the center, they tend to either hit each other or not completely make the connection which causes missed letters. You have to type fairly hard to avoid this problem. Not a good feel at all!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
First off, do not expect a wireless iMac style Apple keyboard for this price range. You won't get it.
What you will get is a standard keyboard (one that you typically get free when you buy a Dell or HP) that does not have "silent" typing. The keyboard makes noise. Live with the click-clack tip-tap or move on. Nothing can be done about it and that is the only reason I rate this a 4 instead of 5.

The keys are standard sized (all correctly spaced and functioning as they should for a windows style keyboard), but the font for each letter/number is large and centered (great for those with eyesight not so perfect) on the keys. The keyboard has 3 colors AND an off setting, which is easily switched via a button on the top right hand side. I work in a dark room with my computer and I am not a 20 year old with 20/20 vision, so this keyboard is perfect for my needs.

If you want a backlit keyboard that functions (isn't beautiful and uses mechanical click keys), at a low, low price, then buy this one. If you want an iMac or MacBook Pro style keyboard look elsewhere.
summary: Nice keyboard for those needing a backlit keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Keyboard feels OK. Some of the keys stick at times. The space bar is a little awkward.

You cannot shut off  the illumination. If you just put your computer to sleep, or hibernate, the keyboard's lights stay on.

The 3 different colors are all good. The variety will help you match the rest of your set up.

For what it cost, I really think there has to be better products out there.

I wouldn't give this keyboard my stamp of approval.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this as a birthday gift for my 87 year old Dad who has slight vision problem and bad arthritic fingers. He was always mis-typing on the keyboard that came with his HP desktop. He tols me it was fantastic. He says it has a high quality feel. He uses the purple color backlight as that color isnlt as bright as the others. He likes it so much he is bringing it with him when he comes to visit for a few months and use my desktop PC.

Product imporvement suggestions:
Add white light selection
Add variable intenisty settings ( I have 4 brightness settings on my Dell laptop)
summary: Bought this for my 87 yeat old Dad

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I used to have a light up under my desk so that I could use my computer without turning the lights on at night. My light stopped working, and after pricing a replacement, I decided to buy this instead. I don't regret my decision What a beautiful keyboard with the illumination on. It's a little different at first, but easily gotten used too. You can also adjust the color to make it easier on the eyes. I personally find the purple most subtle, less strain on the eyes..

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Why the hell are all keyboards not backlit? This is wonderful. I  have had it maybe a week and wonder why I waited so long to try this. Anyone looking for a new keyboard should seriously consider this one.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My father is getting up in age and I know he complains about being able to see things. I thought, what a good idea to replace his keyboard with large letter keys AND backlit keys. This keyboard is the perfect combo of those and he can adjust tot he color that suits his eyes best. When my keyboard wears out, I will be getting one of these for myself. I would love to really be able to see my keys as I like to be in the dark on my PC.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's got a real easy/light touch type making it a pleasure to type on for a long time without fatigue. The different colors are nice as well without being too harsh. Well worth the price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I really like the light and once you get use to the larger print it's also a nice feature. It's not a great keyboard but nice.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My wife gave me a nice notebook computer, but the keys have something like a stainless steel finish which reflect a lot of light.  I touch type, of course, but there are keys for which I have to hunt and peck.  Also, I sometimes use my computer in a dimly lit room while as when others are watching TV.  I decided that a large-key, back lit keyboard would solve my problems and at an economical price.  For the money, this keyboard would be hard to beat.  If you want a silent keyboard, this is not the one, but I take comfort in hearing the keys click.  The item came in on time and without problems.  If you think you need stronger glasses, save your money and just buy this keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: VERY large, well-lit letters on keyboard. Anyone should be able to see and use this keyboard effortlessly in any light - night or day. Keys have a positive feel - no missed strokes and no double letters. A little noisier than I'd like, but I don't type all day so no problem. I did not notice any key sticking as others have reported. Simple plug and play operation. The red  color is insanely intense, the blue is intense and the purple (lavender actually) is very pleasing. I wish it would turn off the LEDs when I power down the computer, but I'm sure I'll get in the habit of doing so. At less than 1/3 the price of the Logitech it's a steal. If it lasts 2 years like the Logitech (I'm messy about eating near it, etc.), I will be completely satisfied.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
After reading the reviews about this being a driverless keyboard, I figured it would work on my Mac Pro as a "generic" USB keyboard, so took a chance.

I can confirm that this works out of the box. I remapped the Windows & Alt keys for a more Mac friendly placement in the OS X Keyboard System prefs.

I got this to better see at night, and the lighting is even throughout the keyboard, with no noticeable light leaking under the keys. All three colors are nice, but think I prefer the blue.

The keyboard feels like any other mid level keyboard, and I don't find myself being distracted by the feel (similar feel to the original iMac keyboard).

If you are a Mac user looking for an inexpensive illuminated keyboard, i think you'll be pleased with this one.
summary: Works out of the box with Mac Pro running 10.6.8!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard is wonderful! I bought it as a gift for someone that stays up late and
TheIr eyes are failing.
It is easy to read and see the keys and is absolutely a great invention!
It arrived quickly and as described. Good value!
Thank you!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Had this keyboard for a few weeks, space bar is already sticking and not function properly.
Key are well lit and easy to read.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Got this board for my son's gaming system I designed. He loved it. I plan to purchase one for myself.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Look, I never learned the art of typing. I still have to look down at the keyboard. I'm not ashamed by it. Not one bit.

Anyway, this is great for surfing the internet at night, and it's pretty decent when it comes to playing games, too. There are three different colors for the backlight, but I prefer red, because it makes me feel pretty cool.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
EDIT UPDATE 9/27/13:  I bought this a little over 30 days ago.  Now it doesn't work and I'm stuck with it.  I know it is defective because I ordered a second one for my office through another supplier and I am typing on it now with no problems.

The keys on the first one stick big time now and unless you really punch many of the keys they simply do not work.

Shame on you Amazon for not replacing this defective item!
summary: Fantastic So Far!  BUT WAIT ... See Edit 9/27/13

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Pretty nice. Doesn't have the soft quiet touch of a nice HP keyboard but then I don't type a lot anyway. So click-ety-clack we go.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this because i needed a backup for my Logitech illuminated keyboard.
I like the larger letters and the illumination is very good as well.
The price is more than fair considering the cost of other illuminated keyboards out there.
The only downside is the loud sound when striking the keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: this keyboard was great. quite when typing and the lights allowed me to see the keys in the dark. Great when others are sleeping and a light would be distracting. Its a shame my 3yr spilled juice on it and took out the esc, win key...etc had to do a quick replace with a regular one but i would get one of these again. worth the extra cost over a standard keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Been using this for a couple of weeks. The LED lighting is great. You can cycle between blue, red, and purple, or hold down the LED button for 5 seconds to turn them off. As far as typing goes...it's alright. The keys are smaller than a regular keyboard but taller than a laptop keyboard. Still seem to require a nice amount of pressure. The spacebar can be a bit sticky sometimes if it's not pressed in the center, which, you know, is annoying. But it's infrequent enough to be useable (happened there though after the word "infrequent", bleh). Annoying, also, is that the keys are inset to be not much higher than the outside frame, which means it's harder to feel your way to certain outside keys - hard to explain, but I prefer my keys to be sticking up so that I can, say, bat at the top-left corner and hit Escape easily. Overall, the lighting is nice and the typing is decent, and if you need the large-print keys, definitely go for it - I'm glad to have 'em as they improve peripheral accuracy on those rare occasions when I need to hit a rarely-used key. Numpad and arrows and navigation keys are nice, too. The media keys at the top work without any set up, and there's music/volume/app controls - even a calculator button! For $30, you definitely get a great value.
summary: Nice lightning and keys, dodgy key-feel, great value overall

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It is working fine. I like the big letter and the three LED color. Not bad key board at all.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The zero kept getting stuck from day one it is very cheaply made and
Very bad quality don't buy it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love the backlit and the big keys, however, the keys stick terribly. Especially the ones on the left side. The layout is perfect - exactly what I wanted. It is also very nosiy. I thought it would get better with usage, but it seems to have gotten worse. I'm a touch typist and was spending way too much time making corrections. Was going to send it back, but my husband said he'd take it. He's a hunt and peck typist. Might be ok for him.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I got this for my home computer and while it looks GREAT, its not the best keyboard for use if you do ALOT of typing. I am giving this keyboard to my kiddo.
summary: Looks Kewl, but NOT for business professionals

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I love the lit keyboard and the large lettering.  But if you type fairly rapidly, the keys seem to conflict with each other and the letters aren't always typed.  Also rather loud click to key press.  Too often I had to backspace to put in the letter that wasn't typed even though I pressed the keys hard in hopes that all the letters would work.

If you are not a rapid typer, this is a nice keyboard for the price.  But if you type with any kind of speed, you will probably give up and revert back to a standard keyboard.
summary: Works well if you are a slow typer.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have only used it for a few days, but I like it a lot. I'm using it right now, and making far less errors, now that I can see the keys. It uses up the battery on my lap top a little bit, but that is to be expected when running like 113 lights.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love the bigger letters an d you can change between the three different colors blue, red, and purple. My wife saw how great it was and wanted me to buy  one for her computer.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I wouldn't say this is a really a gaming keyboard, even though thats what I use it for.  But I'm a fan, I actually bought another one as a backup, keys are huge and the backlighting makes them easy to see... even for us aging gamers.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's great I love it.  Wooooooooo hoooooooo I love it lights up it works great  thank you so much thanks

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The best ("in your face") interface in the dark, Large everything and lighted.
I would recommend to the almost blind, to the band's mixer boardman that needs a lit keyboard.
summary: The best in your face in the dark

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The product is of good quality,
Very useful for seniors who finds it difficult to see the letters

Very good product llegos just in time.
I recommend

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: As advertised. Good product for the price. High quality, I expect it to last for a long time. Would buy again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: So, I am accident prone. This keyboard has enjoyed alcohol, monster, and various other fun drinks. So, of course I've had to pull the thing apart and clean it a few times. How many times have you heard of someone pulling a keyboard apart, putting it in a dishwasher, letting it dry then having the keyboard back together the next day working like new.....Yeah, I might be a little creative but it worked, the keyboard is bright, easy to read and well worth the 25/26 bucks I paid for it. I would buy another for sure, in fact I bought my Dad one for fathers day this year.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Letters were large like I like and the overall quality is great. It has a nice appearance and works well. I use it in my "man-cave" which is really my garage so it's dark in there when door is down so the lighted keys are just what I needed. Only one minor problem is that the buttons up top like the volume control, etc., don't work. Maybe there's a setting or something that I overlooked but I really don't need them. Great product overall.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've only had it since yesterday, but this keyboard is wonderful.  The different colors are adaptive to different times of the day (and depending on the mood), and the large key characters are easy to see.  The keys themselves are responsive and have both a nice feel and "click" to them. Well built and it's plain to see that a lot of thought went into it. The box says Win 7 compatible but I'm using Win 8 with no problems. Well worth the money.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: A couple of the keys are a little sticky, but overall a nice keyboard. The biggest grip I have is that the light doesn't turn off when the computer is on standby.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Large brightly lite keys in red,  blue or purple at a click of a button.  A great keyboard for anyone!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: nice solid key board, USB plug in, good key layout and 3 color options. still smaller then most normal keyboards but doesnt effect the the key layout which is key. highly recommend.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This item was picked for the reviews. The 3 colors are red, blue, and red/blue=purple. The keys are evenly lit and easy to read. The feel and keystroke are just right for me. This keyboard is a real value. Yoi rsrely hit a wrong key. I would recommend this to anyone.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: For the money you can't beat this keyboard. My only complaint is that many buttons like number lock have a simple abbreviation of NL. Page down is PD. This is just a little of a hassle for those of us who are not computer literate. I do love that I can change the keys from blue to red to purple. I do feel the keys are slightly crammed together which is probably because of the larger easier to see keys. My wife loves that the keys are larger. I would reccommend this to a friend for the money. Well worth its cost.
summary: Great light up keyboard for the money.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The illumination is awesome! It's not the randomly placed, leaking backlighting you see on other keyboards that shines in between and up through the keys. It's exactly and ONLY on the lettering on each key. I only ever use the red color, the others are too strong for my taste. I do wish it had a memory setting to keep it on that color, because I have to cycle back to red for every power on. I also like how when I lean back, or back up my chair to watch a movie, the angle of the lighting fades out somewhat. This means that when I'm up close for gaming or working, the letters are brightly lit, but when I want to relax and watch a video, it fades out and I don't notice it.
Also, I cannot understate the awesomeness of the hotbar keys! Without any programming whatsoever, they have integrated with all of my software exactly how I want them to. They control my e-mail client, my videos, volume, calculator, etc.
I wish the keyboard had a bigger, softer wrist rest, but I use a separate one now.
Also, the keys are not ideal for typing, as they sometimes catch on themselves or require too much force to push. But honestly, I just got this for the amazing illumination. Even though the switches and tactile feeling is not perfect, it still works just fine for League of Legends. I mean, unless you're writing a book, or going to be writing daily, I don't think it's an issue. If you are going to do that, get another keyboard.

UPDATE 12 JUL 2013: You can't change this to Dvorak layout without modifying the F, J, H, and U keys. They don't fit in the slots they need to because they are different. See my photos and notes in the photo section.
summary: Best backlighting out there, not for typists

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This has to be the best price/features balance for a keyboard you can buy. I just wanted a decent keyboard that looked good for my new computer, so I got this

Pros:
giant, light-up keys are impossible not to see
cheap
pretty lights
good quality plastic (not flimsy)
wire was long enough

Cons:
keys feel a bit loose/light
doesn't have a lot of extra keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The keyboard is nice - large letters - good backlight.

Wish there were the keys for sleep/ hibernate on the Keyboard. That would have made this 5 stars ...

Update:
Stopped working after 18 months ... 4-5 keys are not responding. Not sure what happened - but very disappointed.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
When I hooked this thing up for the first time, it was like looking at the holy grail of keyboards, actually one that I can see with out squinting or straining. I love it. All three different color lights "Red, Blue & Purple" are nice & bright. I love using this keyboard especially now while watch my projector in the dark because now I can use a keyboard in the dark. Shoot not I can see the key's without straining to see the keys even with light on.

Pros: Back light on Keys are very bright & the key's are all big enough to hold that giant letter. The keys are big bright & in your sight. (Smile :-).
All three colors are nice, but I prefer the blue the most. Every time that I tried to use the red, I felt like a vampire or evil character from a movie should be probably using this color, so I would always switch back to the blue & the purple is alright (Just joking about the red) it looks actually good.  My Mac's & my Windows PC's & Linux boxes all saw it without installing a driver or anything. So the setup was just plug in the USB & then use, that's it. Both shift keys & back space key are regular sized which are a plus nowadays because with these new keyboards they usually shorten the keys & size of keyboard & with this keyboard they did not do that. It feels pretty light in the hands & the build quality seems really good as far as I am concerned, but I am not a picky person.

Cons: It was shipped with the air square packing stuff only on the top inside of the package on top of the keyboard which left the back under side & left & right of the keyboard insecure & with a good drop it would have broke because of the packing, but whom ever delivered it was the hero because it came in excellent condition. Now the person who actually packed it up should not ever be packing any again. The only problem that I had was the enter key when I first got it stuck slightly until I used it enough & now the enter key works as smoothly as the rest of the keys.

I will be purchasing more of these large key keyboards for my self & telling others that I know that have eye problems like me about this wonderful keyboard. Oh & I almost forgot to tell you that the key on the top right is the key that changes the colors of the keyboard, but that very same key is also the on & off switch for this keyboard & to turn it off all you do is hold the key down for around 3 seconds &  then it will cut the light out. If you do not do that, my experience is after you turn off the computer, then the keyboard stays ;lit because all usb is after all is a interface, but with power, so make sure that you turn off the light on this keyboard every time that you turn off the computer or this light will stay on & probably burn out the led's eventually, but not a problem because this very smart company who made this keyboard engineered it with a on & off switch which is rare these days. So yay for the power button :-). Now go get yours.
summary: Excellent Keyboard for people like me with eye problems.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm not a real tech savvy guy, but I must say this keyboard is the best one I have ever owned. There is now a very high priced keyboard that i purchased a few years ago packed up and sitting in the closet because this is so much better. The large print is great and the lighted keyboard has solved the issue of various levels of light I work in. I've only used it for 6 hours at this time, but I can see I am going to be very happy (and I already am). My son, the 24 year old tech savvy sound & lighting engineer purchased this model about a year ago and loves it. It was his recommendation that prompted me to give it a try.
summary: I just got it and already LOVE it!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Packaging was terrible came in a big box with a small amount of brown paper, the box that held the keyboard itself was bent inwards. Contents was the actual keyboard itself and a small user guide (keyboard is plug n play as far as windows 8 goes).

The keyboard is great and feels a bit durable the only drawback is when I don't use the LED illumination a few keys are faded (the right arrow and [9(] key). When plugging in this keyboard all the keys lit up including the hotkeys in a nice blue. I believe that I will stick with the blue instead of the red or purple for personal preference, the three colors have the same brightness level and purple is a light purple instead of dark like the other two settings. The lock notifications are a green LEDs that is not surfaced for maximum indication unless you are right about the keyboard itself. When you are not right above the keyboard the glossy cutouts for the LED are reflecting the green light as a green circle and still can be seen in either low or normal lighting.

Some reviews say that the keys stick at times or that the keys lay flat, both of which in my experience are not true. The keys have a slight curve inwards to the lettering like my old PS/2 Keyboard but not as pronounced. This is a membrane switch type keyboard and keys are bound to stick at times but I haven't encountered that yet. This review has been typed by the Azio keyboard on first day use and will be updated if anything has been changed. Overall this is a great keyboard and I am a proud user of it!

Day 2: Lighting and Hotkeys.

The blue and purple lighting have a radiant feel to them when there is no light except from the monitor while the red does not. Due to this I have switched from blue to red for night use and for low light I use blue. During the the day the red looks a bit orange in color while the blue and purple remain the same. I have the LEDs off during the day as the keys can be seen perfectly. For the hotkeys in Windows 8, E-mail and Home just open Google Chrome to my homepage and the Favorites does nothing(Favorites does open a bookmarks drop down in Firefox though). I use the Volume and Calculator hotkeys the most for a quick volume adjust or calculation. Music opens xbox music in Windows 8 and works wonderfully with the Media hotkeys. My least used hotkey is the Computer folder hotkey as I don't usually need to do anything there.

Update: Accident.

A friend spilled some of his drink onto the keyboard and I have to say that cleaning this keyboard is easy. To pop the keys off I used a small metal nail filer which on some keys made a small cosmetic damage that won't interfere with typing. He didn't spill much to drown the keyboard and the LED Illumination still worked whilst still cleaning. I decided to keep the keyboard plugged in to find the droplets a bit faster. Overall doing this was easy and fast and helped me clean some of the dust that had built up inside.

Tip: For anyone planning on removing the keys.

Remember that a few keys have a piece of metal go under the plastic latches on the keyboard. This insures that wherever you press on the key, it will be registered as a keystroke.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I just got the keyboard today, it my birthday and this is my gift to me. it has a good feel and I love the illumination.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Red for gameplaying in the dark. Blue for just surfing the Internet, Purple for my daughter. It's nice. I love the large print.
summary: A little noisy but I love the 3 color changes.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I use this keyboard in the dark or dim light a lot and find it very easy to see the back lighted keys. No more flash light. It is just what I wanted and I was not disappointed.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: this keyboard is not designed for typing; the keys are flat, the profile is not like IBM keyboard, the bottom edge is wide.. my thumb knuckle hit the bottom edge without hitting the space bar.  it is great for general use in a dark room, but not for someone looking to do typing, you will get disappointed.
summary: good for using in a dark environment but..

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I got this keyboard to use in a darkened room. The lit keys are great. However, the keys are flat, not concave like "normal" keyboards, so your fingers tend to slide off the keys. Great looking, lit keys are cool, but typing is problematic.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is the bees knees! I could not be happier. The backlighting is so vibrant because of the large letters.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Works when it wants to, maybe depending on its mood. You'll be going along just fine and it will all of a sudden quit working as in I'm typing something and aint nothing showing up. Yanked it out of my computer and broke it over a small desk...end of story!! Oh one thing it does perfectly well and that is it explodes into a million pieces upon impact...cool.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: bought for my parents...the keys were wearing off...they love the extra large keys and the colors...and hopefully the keys will last

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I received this keyboard thinking I would love it, and I did, for about 5 minutes. I started to realize that you need to strike the keys absolutely straight on. If you try to hit a key at a slight angle, it will stick and won't go down easily, leaving you the need to PUSH a little harder. I didn't like it at all and sent it back.
summary: Not too bad but sent it back.....

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Great keyboard, I do a lot at night in dim light and this keyboard is just the thing. I would like it a little better if the lock lights where a little bigger,they are hard to see sometimes.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keys feel loose and do not fit together well, resulting in a very cheap feel. Lights do work as advertised and this product was plug and play with Windows 7 64. Due to the sloppy feel and overall cheap build quality I do not recommend this product.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It's cheap, it's reliable, and it has big glowing buttons for when you stay up until the crack of dawn playing starcraft with your lights off. Good keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
A laptop in the sub $50 price range cant get better than this! Its a plug and play lightshow.
Pros:
On and Off feature by just holding down the light button 3 sec.
Red Blue Purple LED lighting
Large visible keys
Multimedia Keys
Email/Home Button/Calculator and Favorite Keys

Cons:
Keys might be a bit light to press from other keyboards out there (Might not be a con to some)

Summary:
There is way more pros to this keyboard than cons and if your looking for a nice sleek LED backlit keyboard to use then I recommend this one over any other. Nice job Azio
summary: Best laptop for the price, Awesome Features!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I not usually one to complain about something feeling cheap, but I have a time typing on this keyboard because the buttons do not press down evenly, they kind of wobble making it hard to program.  I have another keybaord, a Logitech, and I have been amazed at its quality.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It is just ok not great.  Colors are ok but lighting not very well distributed.  should have more bulbs I think.  Large print is great.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: so the letters on the keys are a little larger than a normal keyboard, I like it. As long as it glows blue and doesn't break in less than 2 years I will be a very happy camper. Bought 2 of these to go with 2 brand new computers I build so my kids would stop fighting over who gets a computer. Mouse, keyboard, and case fans all glow blue.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Really east to read and makes seeing the key board easy!
Not a perfect feel like a Microsoft keyboard, But Nice.
summary: Easy to read and the Light is cool

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Highly recommended, and the price is reasonable. This keyboard has wonderful and large print keys, great for typing, I like the 3 led lights color, the lighting is adequate if you're simply typing to the light of your monitor and requires no extra drivers.
I love this keyboard, when the computer is rebooted, it maintain automatically same color led illumination that you selected. I consider a good investment and the print keys and numbers never erased more.
summary: Good price, beautiful product and perfect quality

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: i have been wanting one of these for awhile.  I just received it today, plugged it in and it popped up working with blue lighted keys.  you can also change the color using a button on the right side labeled LED illumination.  It has red and purple it seems to me but this color is fine.  All the letters, numbers, and most symbols are oversized for people with bad eyesight.  The only keys that don't light up well and are smaller in icons are the top row of buttons for email, the buttons for forward/reverse, etc. and the other keys in this row.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Compared this to the Logitech back-lit keyboard.  Although the Azio does not have white, the purple is almost as bright.  What sold me is the backspace, enter keys, etc., were standard size not compact for a laptop.  I love it and change colors depending upon the ambient light.  Would buy again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: It also means I end up hitting the wrong keys.  Decent key-feel. Nice big type and brightly lit. Takes a little getting used to.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I bought this keyboard on March 4, 2013 and today (May 22, 2013) it doesn't work.  I'm not sure why.  I went to type something and it either wouldn't type the correct characters or it would act as if i was pushing a couple keys at once (Slash for backspace...+ for enter on the number pad...would not disable num lock...win/alt/ctrl on the right did not work at all...when i typed H it would bring up the history in the browser i was using).  I also opened MS Word and tried to troubleshoot - only for it to start doing crazy stuff on its own - spaces...deletes...it was nuts. I could go on and on...i spent a good hour and a half trying to figure it out...I knew it was the keyboard and not the system but still wanted to figure it out and fix it.  I took some of the keys off and nothing out of the ordinary under them...but i cleaned the base anyway.  Still doesn't work.  I'm now on an old back up that i bought for $5....and viola! my computer is acting just fine.

They keys are a bit larger and so are the letters, but the color options were nice.  I wish it had lasted longer.  I'm now past my window for return.
summary: This was great when it worked

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: the colors are great nice big letters that you can see,if you been looking for a great keyboard this is it.i call it a gamers choice.
summary: best thing you will buy for your pc

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: 3 different backlight colors yea!! First of all nice keyboard for nighttiime the letters on the keys are big .has features on this i don't use like caculator,email volume control,and home button,The keys are flat like a laptop. The quality of the keys are ok not great. For a serious typer i might look for something else. the keys don't have a sturdy feel when typing fast,But for a basic general use keyboard for nighttime this cant be beat. I usually leave my led light on all the time cause .when light is not on its vey hard to see the letters on the keys. To turn off Led Illumnation hold down key for 5 sec,The other day i had a key stick on me ,I just lifted up the key a little and is working now. Only time will tell how long this keyboard will last.
summary: Best backlit keyboard for the price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I really love the multicolor backlights, especially the red for night time typing.

The only thing I was disappointed in was the angle of the keyboard.
With the legs extended out (not flat) it felt weird.  I had to add something underneath to elevate it a hair more.

Other users complained of the feel of the keys.  It does have a plasticy feel to it typing, but you get used to it and isn't a big deal.
Its more of a clickity type than a smooth gel type of keyboard.  But the backlights will over ride that and you'll be happy with it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This product is functional, and I like the back lighting, but many of the larger buttons (shift, enter, backspace), you have to hit the middle of the key in order for it to actually work. If you are used to hitting the edge of the keys, you will find yourself hitting the buttons over and over again. In short, the keyboard that came with my computer works better, it just doesn't have back lighting. When this one breaks, I will spend more for a better product.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I use this with my HTPC and it is easy and comfortable to use. I love the fact that you can turn off the backlighting when you don't need it but it is easy to turn back on by feel even in almost total darkness.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: If you don't care if the keys clack like those old IBM keyboards of the 1990"s and you want 3 different LED colors and some handy quick keys (that are not programmable) then this is the key board for you.
summary: Great lights but is not quiet...at all.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Product works exactly the way I was hoping.  Makes a big difference compared to the standard keyboards.  Would buy again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: We have been through several keyboards on my wife's computer and when the last one started going down hill I looked for a new one on Amazon and found this one. I ordered it, got fast service, and we put it to work. We really like the way the keyboard lights up and the big letters, with our old eyes it makes it a lot easier to see the letters.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard has great promise to be "THE" keyboard I've been looking for with the features that I like, that is Large Print, sharp, precise feel of the keys, not mushy at all, and, in general, large enough for my big hands.

I am brutal with keyboards, I must have a dozen or so, stacked up in storage, that either died, were going to die or I just plain did not like them, I moderate on several forums and am handicapped and disabled, so I'm usually always using the computer (and the keyboard).

This keyboard was packed very well and arrived quickly, I'm thinking seriously of ordering another one for my laptop bag that I take to the hospital with me, I just have to measure the keyboard and the bag, for the apparent quality and the low price, this is a must have!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My wife has some vision problems and was always looking for a light to shine on the keyboard.  With this lighted keyboard, the problem seems to be solved.  Being able to pick the color (she prefers the purple) is also nice.  She's happy...and when she's happy...well...you know the rest.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I bought this keyboard because ive always wanted a backlit keyboard but haven't had the money to drop on a high quality razer or steel series one. the keys on this keyboard aren't the best, some of them get stuck if you push them the wrong way but its not a huge problem. overall a good buy for $30
summary: Good backlit keyboard for the price

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Finally a backlit keyboard where the keys are NORMAL, with standard-sized Backspace and Enter keys. The color choices are fun, too.
summary: It's just what you need to type in the dark!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The title says it all. Letter size and illumination were just super. However there were a couple of keys that were sticky, meaning that they did not depress smoothly. This was more important to me than the visual aspects.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard is amazing!  Very bright colors, nice large keys that are easy to use.

Let me just sum it up:  You need a backlit keyboard?  This is the one to get!!!

I wish I could add a 6th star for the cheap price!!

Highly recommend!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I always liked the idea of a backlit keyboard. My first one I bought was a Firefly Borealis less than a year ago. I loved it for a couple of days. Then it turned out to be a sorry piece of junk. So I swore this time around I would buy a name brand and pay what it was worth. But, while comparing this type of keyboard on Amazon, I saw this Azio, a brand I never heard of. The amount of 5 star ratings and the very low price...I was pretty sure it just MIGHT be okay. Well, it is. Not worth 5 stars, but so far a nice solid 4 are in order.

PROS:
*It is a bargain, and even if you don't like it as much as expected, you are not out very much.

*It actually works very well, and the 3 backlighting colors you can choose from are easy to change. All of the colors look pretty amazing.

*It is better than the standard keyboard that came with my Dell XPS. BUT you still will not mistake either one for a very expensive keyboard. Just that this one is better.

CONS:

*This probably won't do the trick if you do a great deal of typing. I don't, and so far I am happy with it.

*The oversized keys take a bit of getting used to. Once you do get used to them, this keyboard is great to use in low light conditions.

*Even after your computer goes to sleep, this keyboard stays glowing. To turn it off, you must hold down on the same key that allows you to change colors for several seconds.

*It clacks kind of loudly while you type, so the cheapness is apparent. There is no smooth, fluid keyboard action you will find in a high quality (but much more expensive) keyboard. However, It stills works good enough for what I need. If I was ever to write a book, which I probably never will, I would certainly unplug this keyboard and swap it out for my un-backlit, but rock solid Microsoft keyboard that has served me great for years. But for late night hunt and peck typing, I would rather use this one.

Bottom Line:  After a few weeks of use, it is impressive. I could almost go 5 stars, but to be honest, if it did not have backlighting, it would rate 3 stars. About the same as with most standard keyboards just "thrown in" with name brand computers you pay hundreds or even a thousand or more for. However, for overall value, it is certainly a 4 star purchase. Recommended.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Choose from red, blue or purple backlit letters.  I find purple is easy on the eyes so I never use the other two colors.  Keyboard is comfortable enough for me.  The price was right and I'd buy this again.  As other reviewers have commented, change between the colors by pressing the button on the top right that is labeled "LED illumination."
summary: Love the glow in the dark letters!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard is perfect for me and it somewhat matches my mouse since it's black and blue.  I recommend this to anybody..

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Looks great but just not quite bright enough to really shine during the day. Could use an adjustable brightness control maybe?

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Other than an occasional stick of one or more keys, (You have to take the time to back space and delete), the product is a great deal for the price. I have had other lighted keyboards in the past but this one far surpasses the previous makes. The oversized lettering on the keys, coupled with the ability to change colors from Purple, Red, and Blue, makes this the best deal in any computer keyboard regardless of make or price. I highly recommend this product.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: good looks works ok quality of working parts (buttons) works like the old cheap keyboard that came out when computers were a new invention the buttons try to bend when you press them but like keyboards with these upgrade cost about$100 and this one being $30 it is what it is

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
With the letters worn off of half the keys on my previous keyboard, I had to make the choice between generic and this backlit beauty.  As I am on the computer often, especially at night, this keyboard was definitely worth the additional cost.  I love the 3 colors option, too!

edit: Not even a year later, I want to add that the paint on the keys has word off a fair amount already.  Not to an intolerable degree, but it's definitely not lasting as long as I'd hoped.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Bought it for the purple, but alas it is very pinkish, red is too bright... but with the blue it is still nice

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: ...but I will pass this keyboard along to one of the grand-kids. The touch just didn't "feel right" to me.  I do not like the "built in" palm rests they try to put on keyboards.  So, there is too much space between my Contour Roller Mouse, which already includes a palm rest, and the keys on this keyboard.  Goin' back to Logitech.  You get what you pay for.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I had a lighted Logitech keyboard and it had all the limitations that others found in it...like key lag...no key response. But this keyboard had none of those problems. This is a great keyboard for senior citizens(I am one) or those working in a darkened environment. Key response is good, if a little loud.  The three colors are awesome. I started with the red but found that the purple worked best for me. I read some criticisms of not being able to turn the keyboard off but that is not true. If you read the simple manual just press and hold the illumination button for three seconds and the keyboard shuts off. This keyboard not only works great, for the price it is exceptional!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keys are great lit up.  Letters are a little bigger than I need, but who cares?  Three LED settings!!!  Would work for gamers, though serious gamer's may want to step up a bit to a more expensive setup.  This works best  for me for typing in dark area's.  d:-)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Does what you need it to do for a LED keyboard. The keys are easy to type with and the available hotkeys are a nice touch.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I loved this keyboard so much I bought 3 for myself and one for a friend that has problems seeing as well and she loves it just as much as me. Tried to get her to give it back and she says HELL no you r not getting it back, hehehehe

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like the illuminating but wish it would and could be wireless. Which would make it better over all as a good keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I originally got this for my mother for her birthday last yr. & so far she loves it. But the downside to her review of it is the lower bottom wedge that doesn't support her wrist. So that's one thing she doesn't like about it. Other than that I love it and she loves it too.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: What a joy this keyboard is to use.  I just recently got this one, I have poor vision but this keyboard makes it so easy to find the the letters!  Even if you do not have poor vision, but want to be able to use your keyboard in low light situations, this one is a perfect solution.  The keys are a little clackety but it doesn't bother me at all.  It types smoothly, quickly and you can change the colored lights from red, purple or blue, whichever works best for you.  I like red.  I also love the little rubber feet on the bottom that keep the keyboard in one place while you type.  It has two back legs that you can flip down if you need the board on an incline.  The quality is good for the price.  I paid $24.99 and I'd say it's worth every penny.  One of my all-time favorite keyboards so far.  P.S. If you want to turn off the lighted keys, just long-press the on-off button on the top right and the lights will go out (not sure why you would want to though).
summary: Fabulous Keyboard For Low Vision Folks

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love this keyboard. Got it mainly to eliminate overhead or desk lighting, plus the eyes are going and the large letters makes it a breeze to see. The keyboard is closer to the feel of the newer laptops as has been mentioned in other reviews in that the keys don't stick way up from the keyboard, but i like that, and the touch is smooth and the color lites make it spectacular.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Big buttons. Love the colors. Allows me to work with no light. Not 1 problem. All the colors work great.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am rather particular about my keyboards.  This one has a great layout with, for me, the best placement of pageup/pagedown/home/end/del keys, number keypad is a must, led indicators for caps and num lock,  and full sized F keys for frequent shortcut use.  Keyboard not as sturdy as other well known brands but decent.  Love the built-in wrist bar and the large letters.  Last but not least, the colors!
Update:  Unfortunately, within in the year the H key started sticking.  Even though I would press, it would not go down.  Ended up tossing.  Seems quality needs some work.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The letters, etc. are quite large but the keys are the average size.  The keyboard is completely black.  All that lights up are the BOLD letters unlike some keyboards we've seen which have black letters and the face of the keyboard lights up.

Having alot of lighting next to your computer is not necessary because the letters are easily seen.

We had the computer off when keyboard was plugged in.  It booted perfectly, we did nothing else.

Three choices exist for the color of the letters, red, purple (really lilac-but not too bright) or blue (turquoise).  The brightness of the colors cannot be adjusted.

-working great for the week we've had it.
summary: For someone with very poor eyesight, I highly recommend this keyboard. (Those without too)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I purchased this in January 2013 and in March it quit working after about one month of use.  It lights up, but suddenly nothing I type shows up on the screen.  I tried returning it to Amazon but after more than 30 days they won't take it back, they referred me to the manufacturer.  I will just trash it, lucky it wasn't expensive and isn't worth more of my time.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I like the backlight feature.  It is great in low light. My only complaints are that this keyboard is not nearly as sturdy as the $15 Logitech keyboard (Logitech Desktop MK120 Mouse and keyboard Combo (920-002565)) at the same time; keys stick down; and it is about two inches bigger than it needs to be wide and long with useless plastic flaps sticking out. Look at the photos I added - you will want to saw-off the front lip. The legs fall out too easily, too, until one broke. It works just well enough, in the dark, not to get sent back. But for quality, fit and finish, and durability: two thumbs down.
summary: Backlight is Good; Keys stick down; light duty.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have generally poor eyesight, although I don't need to see the keyboard to type... but I do like the back lit keys and large letters just for 'easy'.  I had originally bought this for my Dad, who is in his 80's and has macular degeneration... but when the back lit one I bought for myself was a disappointment due was a poor key layout and small size...  I 'stole' this one and LOVE IT. I am a super fast typer and have larger hands and a firm key punch. This has good action and key spacing with the function keys in the right places and not on top of or 'attached' to the main keyboard keys.  I did end up ordering another one for Dad and he loves it, and his brother saw it and used it while in town for a visit and he's getting one too.  This is a winner!!!!  (see my other reviews for the one NOT to buy)
summary: Poor Eyesight, or in the dark??  HERE IS THE ANSWER

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: While I really do like the "lighted" keyboard and large print, there are a couple of drawbacks. They're are a couple of "sticking" keys, and it's more of a little "annoyance" than anything else. The keyboard has a "different" touch, especially for a fast typist. But as a whole, I'm satisfied with the keyboard, really like the lighted aspect, and since I'm not taking a typing test - lol - I've slowed down my speed a bit and I'm "good to go".......

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I wanted a keyboard that was not wireless, they suck, and had lighted keys that a normal person can see in low lite rooms. This fit the bill.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Would be even better if the leds would shut off when the computer goes into sleep/hibernate mode. Certainly a boon to those of us with failing eyesight.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Yes, this keyboard has giant "old people" letters which the near-sighted will enjoy. It also happens to be the best value for a keyboard I have seen. It also looks cool with a variety of color modes (or off by holding down the button), so don't consider the character size to be a detraction.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: For an old folk this board is perfact.  it plugs in through a USB and lights up.  How great it that?  When I can see the board lit up I know that the computer is on.  Three colors.  I am glad that I dumped my old board

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a great keyboard.  Love the back lighting and choice of colors.  I prefer blue myself, red is just a bit too creepy in the dark, he he.  The only reason I give it 4 starts is because of the flimsy feel of the keys.  It doesn't feel as rock solid as some of the other "normal" keyboards I have had in the past.  They feel almost a bit loose, but haven't had any problems with it.  Have had it about 3 months now with light use.  Hope it lasts.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Works great for those that are hard of sight, especially at night.  The backlight makes it easy to see at night and the large print makes it that much easier.  My main complaint would be the spacing of the keys, or the lack there of.  Difficult to type fast without button-mashing several keys accidentally every few seconds.
summary: Great if you're hard of sight

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
If you are looking for a lighted keyboard for the best price due to sight issues then IMO this is the keyboard to buy. I found a single color does not work well under all lighting conditions or @ day vs night. Having the ability to change colors is crucial. As some others have stated the large key size does seem to make one more prone to double keying but at least you can SEE the keys ! Some others have also complained that the keys seem to be  "clicky, sticky or too springy. Depending on the type of keyboard you have been using this may also be true but I wouldn't say excessively so and you'll likely quickly adjust to both conditions, as am I.  I do not believe at all that it is an indication of poor quality but of design, in fact, the keyboard is more heavy than my reliable old $60 Logitech multimedia keyboard. Do I LOVE this keyboard ? No, but I do love the price, the large letters and the 3 color feature and it seems to be well built & of good quality for the money which is why I rated it 5 stars. I use my PC about 12 -15 hrs per day and a few of those hours it it used by a 6 yr old (who isn't always so gentle with the keyboard) so it won't take long to see how well it holds up and I'll report back with any issues.

UPDATE: I have decided I DO Love this keyboard, as does my Grandson ! Ordered a second one of these for my Grandsons, new for Christmas, PC  and will buy a replacement for mine in a month or so because we've almost worn out the game keys ! This is the absolute best, and toughest, Keyboard I have ever owned.... We have broken off one of the stands but that was due to abuse ! I will soon replace mine with the newer 5 color version.
summary: Great value, very high quality ! Just Purchased number 3.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Plugged it in, my computer took a minute to load the driver software. I went through the back lighting and settled on the blue although the red is not bad.  With my older eyes, I truly appreciate the large print keyboard.  If it lasts, this is a great keyboard.

But alas, it didn't last.  For some reason some keys produced nothing and other keys sent multiple characters.  I bought the same keyboard for my sister and hers is still working.  That's the only reason I gave it two stars instead of one.

The story doesn't end there.  I emailed Azio and after I sent them proof of purchase and my broken keyboard (they sent me a prepaid Fedex ground label) I got a new keyboard. We'll see if it's better the second time around.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The reason this keyboard has scored so high is because the population purchasing it has to be over the age of 50. If you need a keyboard that you have to stare at and need LED lit keys in order to type, this is the product for you. This is the kind of keyboard that I would expect to see and feel on an undersized, poor quality, inexpensive lap top. There really is no other way to describe it.

It does light up properly as described and I didn't have a problem switching between colors.

Out of the box the shift key stuck like a keyboard that had something spilled onto it and wasn't cleaned properly.

As far as paying $29 for it, I've purchased keyboards for $10 that seem to have had a higher build quality.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: love this keyboard. Can not say enough good things about it. It types like a breeze, the keys are easy to see and it's so comfortable.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I hate leaving it 4 stars since the functionality is excellent, and the glowing keys are great when playing pc games in the dark.
You can turn off the lights so they're not glowing all night while the PC is in standby or off.

But, I have big hands and I think the Keys are too big.  Especially when playing games like ARMA2 where you have to use odd key combinations.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: oh i wrote the wrong thing on the last keyboard but i love it also the big print one is great no glasses needed for me one this one

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Update 3/25/2013:  I was able to make the lights turn off by going into the bios settings and disabling "USB Wake Up From S3".  When my computer goes to sleep the keyboard lights go off, and to wake the computer back up I just hit the power button on my tower instead of keyboard or mouse - and windows resumes where I was previously.  While I don't have any complaints per se, as noted below in my original review, I'd like to sell this and get a mechanical keyboard with higher profile keys. Unfortunately Amazon isn't allowing the resale of this item.

----------------------

Original post:
The keyboard works as advertised I guess.  They keys feel hollow and light and have a slight clack to them.  The big print is why I got it and boy does it ever.

Even though the lights don't go off by themselves in sleep mode (or hibernate), they can be turned off by holding the button that changes the color for a few seconds. No biggie.

My biggest gripe really isn't of the keyboard engineering, but Im a gamer and not fond of the flat keys. I realized this might be a problem for me when I ordered it so I cant say it's the keyboard's fault but mine for choosing one of this design because I should have saved up for a month or two and just get a mechanical keyboard with the raised "standard" keys.

If you're used to flat keys, then this is a winner - except for the manual way of turning off the backlight.
summary: Works fine, just not for me. I found how to turn lights off in sleep mode

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: No issues. Plugged it in and away it goes. Lighting is just right I prefer the blue at night, red during the day.  I would have like that be either weighted or have a better gripping feet as it has a tendency to move around. Highly recommend it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I wanted a well-lit keyboard to be able to work easily at night without the light on. After doing some searching and comparing I settled on this one, mainly because of the low price. This is a decent keyboard. All of the keys work and typing on this board is easy, day or night. Purple, blue and red are the colors you can select from and they definetly are easy to use in the dark. It's not a sleek, feature-rich board, it is a basic keyboard that is well lit. Good enough for me.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The feel of the keys is excellent, much better than the unit that we replaced.
The backlighting is bright enough to easily identify the keys in total darkness without being blinding, it's a nice soft, mellow backlight and it can be turned off by pressing the color change button for a few seconds if desired.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Key illumination is nice and bright. Keys are comfortable and respond well. The only exception is my Enter key is extremely stuck on the top middle and top left area. Works fine elsewhere on the key but it's an annoyance I'll have to work around. Took of the Enter key but didn't see an obvious problem underneath. I don't recommend removing the keys though as they're the type with the little metal clip under them and the little plastic parts that hold it could break easily. As far as I know all the other keys pass the 4 corners test.
