title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: After a few months the key action on this thing got really sloppy.  "Spongy" typing, keys wobbly, keys not registering unless you used a lot of pressure.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I can work with or without lights now thanks to this keyboard. The LED feature is very bright and the keyboard alpha-numeric keys are very legible. I have very poor eyesight and love to do video editing in near to total darkness. This keyboard has solved many of my problems. I should add that the keys are adjusted properly for response without lockup or repetitive key reaction. It is a very durable keyboard with three LED options (RED, BLUE & MAGENTA). The only feature it lacks is the ability to turn off the LEDs when they are not necessary (definitely not a deal killer).
summary: Great quality and a great price...

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: UPDATE  ..... This product has nice features and comes in handy in low lighting .... UNFORTUNATELY, it is very poorly designed with respect to its typeability ..... the keys are WAY too close together and the user will constantly be pressing 2 keys at once ..... This is EXTREMELY irritating to say the least ...... i do NOT recommend this product and would not purchase it again ........ P.S.  i am using it to type this review and have back tracked to retype over double key presses at least half a dozen times

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I gambled on this keyboard after researching reviews of illuminated keyboards. I love the huge letters and the illumination is excellent. The three colors are switched by a button that also turns off the keyboard when depressed for three seconds. As a professional writer I've had more than my share of hammering out keystrokes and I really like the action on this baby. I have big hands and fingers and it's very accomodating. So far I've not suffered from the accidental double-struck extra letters I was plagued with on my last keyboard.

The only thing missing is a USB pass-through for a wired mouse. Not a big problem if you have a free USB port on your computer, but since it's a wired keyboard a pass-through would have been nice.

Since it's new I can't vouch for its sturdiness but it seems to be very well made and has a 3 year warranty. So far it seems very sturdy.

UPDATE: I thought I should mention that on MAC systems the keyboard is plug'n'play, but the Alt and Command keys are REVERSED. It's not a big issue but Mac users need to be aware of it.
summary: Nice Keyboard but No USB Port for mouse

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: When they say large print, it certainly is.  Brighter LED back lighting than I thought it would be.  Which is a very big plus!  Sometimes, I game in the dark and type gibberish dues to not seeing the keyboard.  Not anymore with this thing.  Slim, light weight, and bright.  Just wish they had it in wireless.  Then, my life would be complete!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keyboard is a very clean design, has all the functionality you probably would want unless you waiste time gaming. the backlight is a great help if you are working under low light conditions. The larger letters were not a factor in my purchase of this keyboard but now that I have two of these keyboards I see the advantage and will look to that feature in the future.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Exactly what I needed... No more straining my eyes at night when doing my school work & I didn't have to pay an arm & leg for it. I hope it last me a very long time!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Left shift key sticks. hangs when depressing

When typing entering text  keyboard will freeze no way to recover other than turn computer off and back on, losing all your work

Amazon is sending a replacement will have to see how it works out.

No drivers were sent with the keyboard. very few instructions.  Wwhen typing memo to driver detective keyboard stuck on the letter w and filled up a sheet with tjhe ltr w.

I think this keyboard corrupted the driver in my computer.  at one point had to connect psn type keyboard to control computer.  USB controller was locked up and could not use keys to restart computer

GOT NO IDEA WHATS WRONG WITH THIS DEVICE. GUESS IT WAS TOO CHEAP TO BE ANY GOOD

unit failed in aug of 2015  the 4 and 5 keys quit working.  went back and ckd on warranty  it was originally 3 years but amazon says returns were cancelled back in apr of 2013

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The keys light up great for typing in low light, BUT, the keys are shaped all wrong in that the edge of each key borders on the adjoining and it is far too easy to hit two at a time.  I gave this board a more than fair trial, but had to go back to a standard keyboard with gaps between keys to minimize striking two or more.  I returned to my Logitech Y-RBN90 and it feels wonderful, no more double letters and constant mess ups.
To be fair, the Azio might work fine for those with smaller finger tips and pin point accuracy, but I cannot recommend this board!
Most keyboards have keys with a slight depression in the center to help the fingers stay in the center, AZIO's are flat, flat, flat.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Regardless of the lighting in the room, this keyboard helps define the characters when your eyesight isn't as sharp as it was in the past.  I have two and like both.
summary: great price and I can read it!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: love the keyboard! have limited vision, would recomend it to any 1 even with normal vision..AMAZONs service was great!!! the 1st 1 i got I thought didn't work rite, but it did found out the day before recueeved the replacement(sorry)anyway AMAZONS GREAT!!!!(& the keyboard)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is a well lit full sized keyboard.  I like to do banking in the wee hours of the morning and this is just the thing for that.  I guess I'm too lazy to turn on the nearby light but that's the way it is.

I had it a couple of weeks and spilled some soda on the keyboard.  After a day or so some of the keys began to stick.  So, I took it all apart and washed the keys section in my kitchen sink and used a damp cloth to remove any soda from the underlying plastic circuit sheets.  I blew the keys section dry with a can of compressed air, put it back together again, and it functions just fine.  I can't recommend that procedure to anyone but it worked for me.  (There are three types of screws that you need to keep separate from one another).

It's inexpensive, durable, and does the job!  Nicely lit keys, too.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Big letters, normal sized keys.  Three different light settings, plus ability to switch off entirely.  Good for gaming. I don't mind it for school, either.  I pound the keys when I type and it hasn't broke yet.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I am almost 60 and have to wear glasses. These babies do the trick. Mama likes hers too. Best keypad I ever had.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The good:
Awesome backlight.  Never fumble in the dark again.
3 color options.
Hold the LED key down for 3 seconds to switch off the backlight.

The (not so) bad:
The LED light won't stay off.  When the computer resumes from sleep, hibernate or a restart, it comes back.
The keys are little noisy (above average).

Neither of the above were bad enough for me to dock any stars.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: plugged it in and the computer recognized it right away it took right off and works great love the three color lighted keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I have had this keyboard for a couple of weeks now and have had zero problems with it.
No sticky keys. No problem with the lights.
I honestly don't know what some of the reviews are talking about when it comes to bad ratings for this product.
I don't know if they got a bonified lemon or if they're hard core gamers who use their keyboard for a place mat for catching
cookie crumbs and soda spills, but I am completely satisfied with this product.
summary: Could not be happier with it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The keyboard is  a very nice component that does exactly what the description says. The lettering is huge, and the backlighting can be adjusted to one of three different colors. There are some hotkeys in a row at the top that are useful for one-button access to the internet, or to adjust sound volume, and some other features. I deducted one star because the keys tactile quality is not equal to the higher priced keyboards, yet is serviceable for routine ordinary tasks, but a professional might want to investigate the better tactile quality of a truly better equipped keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I'm typing this review with the keyboard and its working!  The lights are very nice.  Instillation was a snap.  The only slight problem I have is the keyboard light stays on all the time when the computer is on or if it is asleep.  You can shut it off but this is a manual process.  Overall I enjoy the keyboard and the lights work very well.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I REALLY REALLY REALLY LOVE THIS KEYBOARD!!

my dad would love this as well!!!

i can work at night and there is not probelm knowing what letter i am typing since i can't type without looking at my keyboard!!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I am not a fan of the tactile response of this keyboard. I prefer the feel of a laptop keyboard. I use a BTC and was looking for a replacement. This is a good keyboard but not for me.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
You get what you paid for.
Pros:
- Illumination is great and does exactly what it should

Cons:
- Cheaply built plastic, shift key is getting stuck.
- Really bad "feel" of the keyboard. I switched from a generic DELL keyboard which is incomparably better in terms of typing. I am used to both laptop and desktop keyboards, and this is the worst I had in years.

Get it only if you really want a cheap keyboard with backlit and don't type too much.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Pros:
- Fits nicely in my keyboard drawer.
- Letters on keys are huge - particularly important for punctuation (esp. ;: key!).
- Multiple colors are a cool touch. (Purple was brightest, but blue seems less gaudy).
- Some important AV controls work on my Mac, even though it was not designed for the Mac (Music play, skip forward, skip backward, volume up, volume down, mute)

Cons: - Keyboard arrived with cosmetic flaws in black coating over several keys, as if paint had been put on unevenly.
- Not particularly designed with Macintosh computers in mind, but a simple adjustment made it work naturally:
( Go to "System Preferences" - "Keyboard". In the lower right, click on the button "Modifier Keys". Select "USB Keyboard" from the "Select Keyboard" menu. For "Option Key:", select "Command"; and for "Command Key:", select "Option". This will put the command key on either side of the space bar. At least in MacOSX 10.8.2)
summary: Nice, big letters and it looks pretty. Works with my Macintosh. Some cosmetic flaws

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I read many of the reviews about this keyboard prior to purchase. Everyone's experience with a product differs based on their expectation of the product, the price paid and so on. I bought this keyboard mostly because of price (their competitors offered no more at a higher price) which I thought was very reasonable. I've had zero issues with this keyboard and use it daily. It's tri color setting is really neat as the back light can be red, blue or purple. As far as build quality, I'd say its average for an aftermarket keyboard. Not nearly as well built as say a Dell keyboard or other OEM type keyboards but I much prefer a back lit keyboard for typing in low light.
summary: Large print keyboard that's easy to see in the dark

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: good price, the red was a little dim for my liking but i can see why many would want it dim. holding the led toggle will power off the lights. I was worried about the large font but it was easy to ignore. music and windows hot keys work out of the box whice was nice. Great addition if you really want the led.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: But the keys, particularly the space bar, do not always react.  Space needs a second push sometimes if your thumb is too far to one side or the other.  A center push is 99.99%.  Minor complaint.  Otherwise pretty solid product.  Tri-color lighting is nice, too.  Works for all lighting (but plain white would be awesome!)

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Does everything it says. The backlight is great. The only thing I can find wrong is the size of the enter button is too small.
FYI, to turn off the light, hold the color button down for 5 seconds.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
My eyes are crap in dim lighting, I actually wear a headlamp, like the ones for camping, pretty much all day because if my head makes a shadow on something I am looking at the eyestrain hurts. This thing is fantastic. The letters are very big, the light isn't blinding but it is bright enough that I don't need to squint to see. It makes everything from slightly dim to complete dark completely irrelevant to how well I type. All of the little media buttons work (I have NEVER had a keyboard that those did anything). It has a nice wrist/palm rest attached. (I'm not sure if it is detachable or not. I don't see a seam or anything) I like it though so I have no intention of finding out if it does detach. The multiple color options are great, and all of them are sharp and bright. Turning the light off completely is a simple matter of holding the change color button for like 3 seconds. The keys are lower set than a standard keyboard, but higher than a laptop. They aren't silent but they don't clack as much as traditional keys either. I actually like the sound myself.

Because the letters are so big some of the keys are abbreviated that aren't normally, print screen for instance only says PS, and Scroll Lock is SL, but I don't really mind that. If you use the keys much you already know what they are. If you don't they probably don't matter much anyway.

All in all, I would totally recommend this to anyone. And at the price, if anything does happen to this one (which seems unlikely as it seems pretty solidly built) I would defintely buy it again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I can see the keyboard with out eye strain or fatigue. The colors make the letters and numbers vivid.
I like the standard key action that I am accustom to..  Very nice product and great price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Standard Keyboard Layout.
VERY Bright Keys!
Very Big Letters.
Brighter then a Eclipse!

Even If this keyboard dies i will prolly buy one EXACTLY like it!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: For an $11 keyboard it works great.  I would have given this a 5 star rating but a few of the keys are sticky which will most likely workout in time.  My kids really like choosing between red, blue, and purple keys.
summary: Pretty good product for the money

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I am typing this review on the very keyboard I am reviewing.  I love the backlight display and multiple colors to choose from.  It has really large keys and letters that I can see even with my glasses off.  I enjoy the feel of the keys while typing and they give a satisfying "click-clack" sound.  To turn off the backlight, simply press and hold the LED Illumination button for a few seconds.  To turn it back on, simply press the button again.  It has plenty of media buttons and quick link buttons (even one for a calculator!) in a row at the very top of the keyboard.  Very easy to install and use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I have had intermittent issues with two different wireless mouse combos where either the keyboard or mouse would slow down or stop working altogether. As a techy by trade, I've spent hours trying to alleviate these issues, to no avail. Bottom line for me seems to be that they just stop working correctly after some time of use.

I bought this keyboard because it is backlit and because the key markings are large and easily readable. I've used the keyboard for about a week and I like it as much or more than any keyboard I have owned. the back lighting is nice, even when working lower light. Overall, so far, I have to say this is a great keyboard and If you're looking for a wired keyboard, I recommend it highly.
summary: Exactly what I expected. Good keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Amazing for the price.  The keys are legible and the lighting is terrific when you have the keyboard on a slideout shelf which keeps the room light off the keyboard.  In addition to the features of a regular keyboard, it also has 13 hotkeys which do things like launching email, or going to My Computer, controlling the media player, launching a calculator, etc.  Since the keyboard does not indicate that is is compatible with Windows 8, I wondered if all these functions would work with my Windows 8 PC.  They do.  The only quibble I would have is that the email button launches Outlook, which is not my preferred email app.  If you need a lighted keyboard, do not hesitate!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Fast Response, Smooth soft keys, lights up 3 different colors to make it even cooler! Big keys so grandma won't even need her glasses!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Works great .  Perfect for typing in dark areas like the one at my desk.
And the keyboard has a great feel to it.  It's worth twice what I paid.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Some of these electronics are manufactured at such a pace that the odd time you get a dud. I got a dud that was given as a gift unfortunately, more unfortunate was the seller "Better Choice Online"s refusal to replace. Fortunately Amazon stepped up to plate and issued a gift certificate for the amount spent on keyboard. Moral of the story: Very seldom Amazon.com is undercut by a third party seller for a dollar or two, do yourself a favor and pay the extra buck to buy it from Amazon.com, I learned this valuable lesson the hard way.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is an inexpensive keyboard. Quality follows. The keys don't lend a sense of sturdy building, but their large print faces and perfect glow in darker situations are redeeming factors. A great choice if you're looking to keep costs down, but I believe spending a bit more would have been a wiser choice. Shop for other backlit options before you buy.
summary: Colors look great, keys are clicky

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I've purchased two of these.  They are not the best keyboard action, but are decent, and the keyboard is almost throwaway cheap.  The letters are large, which is an advantage if you are just hopping onto the computer for a quick look at email, and don't want to don your reading classes
summary: Great inexpensive keyboard if you type in the dark

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Larger letters are distracting, cluttered.  Keys are flat so it is hard to type without looking to see if you are on the right keys. Would not recommend when you're used to scooped keys. But, my husband likes the bigger keys.  So, we will keep and maybe I'll get used to.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a good-quality product at a competitive price.  The oversize letters are great and I particularly like the 3 color choices as they each serve me well under different lighting (complete dark, dim light and full light).

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I purchased this keyboard because it was the cheapest illuminated keyboard i could find and since there were so many positive reviews for it. I like dumping an over-analyzed  pro/con list so here it is.

Pros:
`Illuminated with three colors- I only use red, though, its dimmest of the three colors; red blue, white. The white is nice. Blue is a bit freaky looking imo.
`Cheapest illuminated keyboard I could find- most of the other ones are in the $50+ range, making this ~$20 cheaper. (however, those definitely have more quality, not just more functions)
`Shortcut keys- includes the basic media buttons, volume, shortcuts to calculator etc.
`Includes the standard rubber placement grips and height elevator things on the back of the keyboard.
`has the finger placement guides on 'f' and 'j' keys

Cons:
`Keypad does not show the functions when num lock is disabled.
`numerous of the larger keys get caught when pressing on the corners so it's more or a crunch rather that a smooth key press. For example the top left of the enter key gets caught and the top of shift keys. They work fine if you press right in middle of the key but still a huge con for me.
`the various functional keys are shortened. Example given, page up/down are PU/PD. This could be detrimental to people not yet accustomed to using these keys.

Neutral/miscellaneous notes:
`Big letters- I'm a touch typist so this hardly matters to me. I'm sure it's useful for people with vision problems but it can also be hard to get used to.
`Shiny frame is fingerprint magnet
`Very low resistance keys - I'm more accustomed to keys with more resistance but I'm sure I can adapt eventually. Despite this, it's not oen of those quiet keyboards.
`The indicator lights for num lock, cap lock, scroll lock are too bright for my tastes.
`No brightness control- no big deal
`No macro keys- no prob don't need em
`Cannot reassign shortcut keys at top
`Standard keys that you can pop out in case you get something stuck underneath.
`Someone else mentioned that the keys are about 1/2 height of standard keyboard but I think that's just something else you become used to.
`Doesn't seem to have any key ghosting found on other a few other keyboards such as the logitech slim illuminated, but I only checked the common gaming combo shift+w+space
`You can turn off the lights by holding down the illumination key. They should have included this in the manual but didn't... No need to flip over the keyboard when watching movies in the dark.

My last keyboard was the MS Sidewinder x4 which simply deteriorated over time from heavy use. I would have repurchased that one but I never used the macro keys and the keys on that one were faded badly. And so I figured I'd try something else, something cheaper. I definitely preferred the X4 but this one will do.
summary: Good budget keyboard but you get what you pay for

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: very easy to see day or night, 3 colors can be chosen from, big letters light up are so easy to read. A+

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard is a godsend for the non-touch typist using computer in a poorly lit area.  The letters are large and very well illuminated; recommend using red illumination as red doesn't effect your low light vision if that is an issue. Plug and play - looks great next to my sidewinder mouse that also had red illumination in DPI window.  Keys are slightly softer push than say an old keytronics keyboard but still provide a effective level of tactile feedback.  Most highly recommend this item.

N. A. Roder

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I LOVE THIS KEYBOARD.....I WANT TO BUY TWO MORE I ADDED THEM TO MY WISH LIST.  BRIGHT BLUE LED COLOR MATCHES WITH MY COMPUTER SET UP IN PITCH BLACK DARKNESS I CAN TYPE NOW AND SEE KEYBOARD.  SOLID CONSTRUCTION TOO....HAS SOME SOLID WEIGHT TO IT GOOD QUALITY.  I WANT TWO MORE.
summary: BEST KEYBOARD I HAVE EVER OWNED.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I have needed a lit keyboard for a while, my desk has the keyboard in one of those under the desktop drawers and no matter what I do with the lamp it ends up at least partially in shadow.  I ordered the Azio and it arrived promptly and in good condition despite the poor padding in the manufacturers box. I plugged it in and it lit up right up.

The quality and feel of the keys themselves is at least as good as the unlit Logitech K120 I replaced with the Azio, and better than some other low profile keyboards I have had. The larger, flatter keytops give it a slightly loose feel compared to the Logitech, but overall they are about the same to type on. I do not really like the feel of the dome switch semi-chicklet keys that are pretty much the only thing available in this price range but I have gotten used to it since mechanical keyboards are out of the question with my current budget. I have not noticed the spacebar problem that a few other people have mentioned, but then I had to get used to typing with my thumbs very close to center to avoid that problem on my laptop and this keyboard is much nicer than that one.

In just the time I have had it it has survived a minor spill, something I did not expect and I was pleasantly surprised.

The keys are nice and bright and very easy to see and the color change works well though I usually just leave it blue.  I have no problem seeing the lit media keys either, though the none of the media keys work so far. I have to plug the keyboard into a USB extender because of the poor design of the corner desk I have and the extender is very old (it may be USB1.1) so I am going to try swapping the it for a new one I bought along with the keyboard when I get time to do the stringing to see if that makes a difference. I do not use media keys much anyway since most of the keyboards I have had did not include them so it is not a big thing either way.

I gave it four stars because of the huge difference it makes in seeing the board, I took one away for the feel of the dome style keys and the trivial inconvenience of the media key thing.  Overall I would strongly recommend it for those needing a lit, easy to see keyboard on a budget.

Followup: I upgraded to a new computer running Windows 8 and it recognized all of the special function keys without any problem.

The keys held up well under very heavy use in the close to a year I had it though the tops were starting to show some wear (it was still very legible even on the worst worn key tops though).  I would probably still be using the original one except that my cat chewed the cord which destroyed it (I replaced it with a SteelSeries lit gaming keyboard with keys that are less flat and a much heavier cord).

I would still recommend this keyboard and recently bought one as a gift.  The odd thing is that her system is a Windows 7 like my old one (though hers has an Asus motherboard)and all of the special keys (media,etc)all work well with it.
summary: Very good keyboard for the price

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
POSITIVES:
Cheap for a backlit keyboard.
Colors are bright and the keys are clearly visible for my aging parents.
Multi color (red, magenta, and blue)
Looks great!
Great frame, except for a flaw (see below)
Soft touch - not much finger force required

NEGATIVES:
Looks great until you touch it. The keys feel as cheap as ever. The keys are extremely flat with absolutely no contour for your fingers. You can't feel the boundaries of the keys and I often catch my finger slipping into nearby keys. The keys fall below the keyboard's frame. This is not much of an issue until you hit the space bar, which requires a semi angled thumb to depress it. Hitting the spacebar as we typers/gamers normally do often results in no input; the thumb will hit essentially the frame of the keyboard depressing the space bar just slightly but not enough to trigger the input.

I bought this to replace an old Saitek Eclipse II because its keys had faded so much. However, this Azio keyboard can't compete with the feel of the Eclipse II and many other competitors. I went back to my abused Eclipse II until I can find a cheaper replacement but not down to the quality of the Azio. Something in-between would be great. I would return this product but $30 ain't worth the trouble considering how much I would pay to send it back. Maybe someone around here could have a good use for it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
A lamp is not convenient in my desk area so the back light is just what I needed.  I didn't think I'd like the large letters, but I do, and the color change is a plus.  I don't like laptop style keyboards so the full size is a plus for me.  Key action is fine.

Even with the keyboard flat, the space bar is large and high enough to hit comfortably with my wrists right on the table. With the back feet down its an even better angle.  I'm not sure what other reviewers are talking about.

I love using a single keystroke to open a calculator, internet, email, volume control, my computer, etc, so its great to have so many of those shortcut keys in the top row. The icons on these buttons are a too small.  If I squint I can make them out and I have 20/20 eyesight.  Someone who NEEDS large number wouldn't be able to make them out at all. The buttons are narrow but maybe they could have labels on the frame above, like the num lock label.

The back light goes off when I turn off my computer and on when I turn it on.  The quick start instructions tell you how to turn the back light on and off during use as well as change colors.  With back light off, the contrast between grey letters and black keys is not great, some people may need to leave the back light on all the time.
summary: Even with a few faults, I love this keyboard!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: the price is great liked this product becuse letters ar vary large led back lihgting is the best many hot keys

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I type with two fingers so I can't really tell you touch-typists out there about the feel of this keyboard. But as to the legibility of the keys, it's hard to imagine it being better without being obtrusive. This keyboard is one of my smartest buys! I am very happy.
summary: Easy to read! I love it!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: this product is cheap along with the company who does not want to respond to my rma request. i have sent a request twice with no avil to aiding me in my returns.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Awesome keyboard...
I have punished this keyboard for a very long time.... putting it through its paces by using it for more than 16 hours a day.
I take it to work and use it, then I take it home and use it there.
I also constantly game with it and do many other heavy things with it.
lots of typing and coding. - A must have keyboard that will sustain huge punishments.
I recommend this keyboard and WILL purchase another soon.

bear in mind, if you use this keyboard very heavily eventually some most used keys will see some wear and tear ..
Which is of course expected. - Keys have NEVER come apartment or NEVER came off.
This has become my Go To Keyboard - and I love it a lot...
GO BUY IT...!!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I love the large letters and the option to change colors, It fits perfect for gaming as it simply laid out.  For the cost you cannot go wrong, plenty of options and options ill never use.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard is awesome I cant believe it is as cheap as it is. It lights up to be three different colors red, blue or purple very cool and easy to see the large letters. I read in one review that it was lagging if someone types to fast haven't even had a second of lag time. I bought this for my mom for xmas and what a great gift to go with her new computer, would highly high;y reccomend, cooest keyboard I have ever used.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Nice feel and very sturdy. the keys are nice and big and lit well. This is a must have for anyone working in low light!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I am using my Logitech wireless keyboard to write this review because I can not see to type on my new Azio keyboard. The key lettering is a dark gray on a matt black background and with the ambient light from the monitor I can not see the keys. With the back light on I can see some of the keys but most of the back light is overwhelmed by the light from the monitor.
I do like the layout, feel and quality of the keyboard but my 20/50 macular degeneration vision makes my normal Logitech white on black normal sized lettering much easier to use than this "novelty" keyboard.

If you don't have 20/20 vision and good low light/contrast vision don't bother with this keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The backlighting looks cool, but there are some drawbacks.

1. The backlighting will not work if you plug this keyboard into a USB hub, even a powered one, so make sure you can spare a USB port on your computer for the keyboard. And, if you can't activate the backlighting, you won't be able to see the letters on the keys at all. They will be very faint.

2. The pitch between the keys is closer than on a standard keyboard. I rather like it because I have small hands.

3. The icons on the small keys in the topmost row which control email, multimedia, etc. are so small as to be indecipherable, especially if the keyboard is sitting flat. I never use these keys anyway, so I don't care about that. And, when the keyboard is flat, the function keys in the second row from the top appear much fainter than the rest of the keys. If you flip the little feet down under the back of the keyboard so it sits on a slant, the function keys are easier to see. The topmost row, however, remains nearly invisible.

I think it's strange that this keyboard has oversized letters on the keys, which feature is normally targeted to people with vision problems, yet has these extremely tiny icons on the media row. Anyway, the letters are large and very easy to see, if that's what you're after, and I was. Still, I think this keyboard is best suited to teenagers with perfect vision, who like to use their computers in the dark. It's much easier to see the keys when most of the lights are out. Obviously this isn't a keyboard for a brightly lit office, but then they don't market it that way.

In spite of these issues, I like the keyboard, so far, and will keep it. It REALLY is cool looking.
summary: Cool looking but has a few issues

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keys stick like a very cheap board. But it is working.  Not happy, but will live with...blul..blul...blul...Will not buy from Azio again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Purchased this item as a gift for my father.  He has trouble seeing the small letters on a normal keyboard.  Additionallly, he has trouble seeing the keys in the shadow of his own hands.  This keyboard solves both those problems.  The keys on this product are larger, making for an easier experience using the computer.  The setup was absolutely easy.  Unplug old keyboard, plug new keyboard into USB port and you are done.
summary: Great for People with less than perfect sight

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is fantastic. I am using the blue and tho very bright it is easy on the eyes and extreemly easy to see. I highly recommend.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Keyboard is really good and helpful to see the keys.  Need better instruction as to shutoff the keyboard lights. Press and hold down light color selection switch.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I got this cuz the family room is not well lit up and that's where the computer is at.  I bought for the back lit keyboard and so far everything works fine.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The lights (red, blue, purple) are pretty and bright. Option to change and turn on/off. Standard keyboard that does what it should, but with lights and larger print. Only thing I don't like or may just take some getting used to is the keyboard is spaced differently/slightly so I go for keys in the wrong places. And the keys are flatter than what I'm used to. Not a problem for the slow typist, but someone who knows the keyboard will definitely notice the difference. This board has no usb port, but very minor issue, just something I noticed. Other than that, no problem.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: just received- plugged in(usb port) instant gratification! it comes with no documentation- thanks to the reviews which explained how to switch colors and turn off the backlight. it types just fine and feels great. now at night i won't need to turn on a lamp or light and disturb my wife- that alone makes it worth the price. the fact that it is a well thought out and functional is gravy.
summary: so much easier for tired eyes

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Got this for my mom who is in her upper 70s and she loves it. It has nice large characters on the keys and the illumination is perfect with three colors to choose from. Awesome keyboard for anyone who prefers to work in the dark or simply has trouble seeing the small, unlit characters on the common keyboard. They have a definite winner in this product.
summary: Mom loved this as a present

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The keys on the keyboard are huge! The letters are huge, this is the main reason for my purchase of this item. However, there are some cons. The keyboard is surrounded by an extra plastic piece, both on the top and the bottom of the keyboard. I find it very difficult to use "thumb keys" such as the space bar, etc. The space bar is level with the plastic piece so you actually have to lift up your thumb to use the bottom key functions. I inspected the plastic surround piece and there is no way (that I see) to remove it. It that were possible, I would give this a much igher rating.
 The keys themselves have a good responsive feel to them. They do make a click sound when using them, but that is what a keyboad does, no big deal there. The lighted feature is fantastic! I used the keyboard in the dark and it is totally cool! I found the blue color is most visible to me. The purple was a bit harsh, but everyone will have their own opinion about the color. Yes, the light can be turned off by pressing and holding the illiumination key.  Also, the keyboard is wider than the normal keyboard that comes with standard computers. It takes up more desk space.
 If anyone knows or has suggestions on how to remove the plastic surround, please let me know.

This is a follow up after using the keyboard for a couple of weeks:

I have decided to return this keyboard. Some of the keys have started to stick. The enter key being the worst. Unless you hit the direct center of the key, it will catch. I have also found that the height of the keys and the plastic surround had become very bothersome. The keys are almost flat even with each other and this had made typing difficult.
 This is not a terrible product, it just didn't suit my needs. I still give it three stars.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I had another brand with a backlit keyboard and this one is much much better.  Changing colors is a plus and the keys are easy to read.  I only wish the usb cable were a bit longer.  Other than that great product and super price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Combined with a g500 logitech gaming mouse, this keyboard is an absolute BEAST, it comes with a built in wrist wrest for when you need to use it for awhile. The three color options (Blue, red, and purple) go well with whatever your decor is (red for the g500). The full size backspace button is really handy.

It DID take a bit to get used to, as the keys are bigger and thus farther apart, but once you get used to them, this keyboard works wonders for a very affordable price. 10/10 would buy again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Well i have been wanting a lighted keyboard for awhile now, & after a little research i chose this one as it seemed to offer decent quality at a low price.
Set up is easy peasy, plug n play....did you know you can have two keyboards working at the same time? I can keep my wireless board hooked up for daytime use & the Azio lighted for night, sweeeet.
Quality seems pretty tight....no ugly suprises, everything works as expected.
The Keys are a bit bigger & the lettering is very big :) about twice normal size. And I like this, & it was easy to adjust to. The keys feel pretty good in use, a tad less cushy spring resistance than higher end units, yet within the comfort zone. The change in the key size does increase the probability of keystroke error....& some adjustment in technique is required.
The lighted keys are perfect, just what i was looking for, easy to see, & not so bright as to be a distraction.
It is nice to have options in the colors, & this is one of the few boards that boasts this feature.
All in all i think this is a very good product & i enjoy using it, no more squinting in the dark for me :)
The price point was the deciding factor, as there are a few other boards that are obviously better, but they cost twice as much & more. So, i wanted a good lighted board without the sticker shock....& this looked like about the only real contender in that regard, & so far it seems as though it was a good call.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Let my first start off with my daily use for this computer. I game, quite a bit too. I bought this keyboard with the intention for the backlit keys but I didn't know the style of these keys were similar to what I have in my laptop. Now I actually like the keyboard in my laptop so this was a good fit for me. But I know that some other people do not like it and like to have more of a mechanical feel. So If you are, look otherwise. But for me and the people who like the feeling of a laptop keyboard, this is great. Plus the colors (red, blue, purple) ad very soothing to the eyes even in the darkest of rooms. Would I recommend this product: Yes

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The longer I use it, the more I dislike this keyboard.

PROS: Good display, markings, layout and size.

CONS: The key action is NOT good. The keys catch if not hit squarely. The action is noisey and the touch feels cheap, wiggly, clacky and clunky. Total waste of money for me.

I would NOT recommend this keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I previously bought a logitech backlit for 100 bucks but had issues with it not being detected off and on.  I don't care for the large type on the keys - I only got it for the backlighting.  The keys are a tad too close together and it's not a mechanical keyboard.  Those are my only issues.  None of the function keys seem to work but that doesn't bother me as I never use them.  Not the regular function keys but the "bonus" ones that  lot of keyboard manufacturers include at the top - mail, music, browser, etc.  This didn't come with any software nor was there anything about going to a site to download drivers for this stuff in the very short user manual.  They also don't tell you how to turn the lights off (press and hold the light color change key).  The keyboard stays lit even after powering off your pc unless you manually turn it off.  But hey, what do you expect for under 30 bucks?  if you just want a backlit keyboard on the cheap, this is for you.
summary: tri color backlight for under 30 bucks?

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Our computer in the bedroom is a pain sometimes, trying to see the keyboard in the dark at night not wanting to turn on the over head light and disturb my partner... this light up model works great and I like I can change the colors to suit my mood...I also love the helpful buttons they put in above the function buttons... bringing up mail, explorer, adjust volume and so on.... the letters are nice and large which is great as I have poor eye sight,,,, I really love this keyboard and can't say enough about it... one more thing... beware of the keyboards with stick on letters.... they will peel off after time... not a problem with this one.
summary: Just what  my sore old eyes needed

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This a full sized keyboard that has back-lit keys - with a choice of three different colors. With that said, the only reason I give it 3 stars instead of 5 is because the "8" key is already starting to stick. This keyboard is not even a month old, and it is not getting high usage, except for the "W,A,S,D" keys. The failing "8" key will completely fail at some point, likely soon, and this is too bad for such an otherwise excellent product.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Getting up there in years, my eyes are not as good as they used to be. Kept hitting wrong key when typing. letters are large, and you have 3 colors to pick. I can see best with blue. Better then cheapest light up keyboads. Owned cheaper one before, and it did not last long. This one is semi-decent, but not great.***UPDATE***3/24/13 Keys, you really have to push them down, biggest problem, when using shift key to make a capital letter. I would wait and buy the logitec that costs more, but would be worth it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Its good to have biger keys and nice to have the lights so you can type at night with out having a light on for those times you cant remember where the key is...lol Thanks

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I have both osteo and rheumatoild arthritis in my hands so going to a keyboard with larger keys only made sense but I gotta say I am REALLY HAPPY that I decided to choose this Azio keyboard with backlighting as well as large keys - WHAT AN IMPROVEMENT both are to my lifestyle!  Now I can see the keys easily when I reduce the room lighting to multi-task between computer screen and TV screen.  I would recommend this keyboard as a gift for family/friends who would benefit from the backlighting and larger keys.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: even after I spilled tea into the keyboard - not a whole cup, just a little. Let it dry out and the keyboard works fine. Bought another for my 86 year old father.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The backlighting is very good, and comes in blue, purple or red, and you can turn it on and off with a button in the top right corner. I do gaming, and it is holding up very well.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Nice Subtle Soft Lighting... especially like the choice of three colors... nice feel on the keybord also... will order more as gifts.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I got 2 of these for my elderly parents, they love them! I hooked them up and they were like kids at Christmas!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Unfortunately, the keys catch a bit, as if it was a worn out keyboard.  That is, the keys don't always depress cleanly if you press it a little off center or off axis, and this is the problem that leads me to buy a new keyboard.

I do like the large letters.  This goes hand in hand with the need for a lighted keyboard.  I would love it if all the lighted keyboards out there used large lettering.

Some may also appreciate that this is a light and low profile keyboard.  I also has a bit of flex which some may take as flimsy, but I don't see it as a problem.

So, it seems I'll be replacing this right off the bat.  A responsive keyboard is more important than a visible keyboard.  I'll just have to go with one that is responsive and lit, and hope that one day I'll be able to find one that has all three of these very useful features.
summary: Not Very Responsive, Just Very Visible

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Recommend this for those who have the need for easy to read keys.....can change the color of the keys with your mood.  Keys are smooth and the function keys work properly.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: it works exactly as it should and the price is right. no complaints whatsoever and i would buy it again.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: After reading the reviews, and reading the specs I am about to order this keyboard. I was looking for a back-lit keyboard to go with my gaming setup and also something with large keys. Based off of the reviews I will be purchasing this keyboard today. I will follow up with my thoughts once I receive it.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: The price is right.  I was replacing a Microsoft gaming, back-lighted keyboard that the paint was wearing off of the most used keys, after a couple years.  This keyboard works fine unless you have any side pressure on the keys, in which case they have friction causing you not to depress the key right all the way.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
The vendor I purchased this from was honest, prompt, & charged a low price for this item! However, this keyboard had EVERY FEATURE that I could have wanted, except "quality"!
Pros:
Large print with key characters never wearing off!  3 colors of the "back-lit" keys!
Cons:
The keys are recessed below the surface of where the palms rest making it "very difficult" for a touch typist to hit the space bar easily! Finally, the "feel" of the keys as they are depressed, is not the best!
But I shall continue to use it because of the "plus" features!
summary: AZIO Large Print Tri-Color Backlit Keyboard

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: DOes great for large print and lighting. Don't really like the feel of the keyboard but types easily. Overall seems like a good product but time will tell. Bought it for lighting not the largeprint. Pretty bright works for me.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
WARNING DON'T BY THIS UNLESS YOU ARE THE HULK ! ,  This is the answer i was needing, because without my glasses i couldn't see the keys. now i can.
the key board stays lighted until you hold the illumination key down for 10 seconds and then the key board lights shut off.
lol it took me a little while to figure that out!  Keys have a cheap clicky feel to them, and sometime stick, but they are getting better
at not sticking the more i use them.

UP DATE:
the keys are starting to jam, so often that i'm now forced to replace it. its a shame, because i'm just 9 days past my return policy period with amazon.

HATE THE KEYS STICKING,  unless I hit the dead center they lock in place, so I'm having to hit the keys harder each time to make sure they
work.  maybe Its a bad key board, but the more I use it the more of the keys are starting to stick!  I hate it!  I actually broke a nail the other night
trying to type because the darn key locked / jammed and I had to hit it harder.  not a comfortable easy working key board at all.
summary: love the key size and triple colors, HATE THE JAMMING KEYS

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I just received this keyboard a short bit ago, I seriously eliminates a glare problem that I was having. There is a choice of three key colors, I think the purple is going to be the best choice for me. The click of the keys seems to be the same as my old keyboard. There is a little less travel on the keys, just a small thing to get used to. You may have already read this in other reviews but you turn the key light off by simple depressing the LED button for three seconds. You turn it on in that manner also. I hope this keyboard lasts, it seems to be well made but time will tell. My initial response is that I'm very satisfied.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
I just received this keyboard yesterday, and so far, am very pleased with it.  I usually work in the dark or with dim lights, so the illumation coupled with the large keys on this keyboard make navigating much easier.  My only slight complaint is that the keys are a little noisy when typing, but I can deal with this as long as I can see.  Being able to change the colors is also a nice feature.  As others noted, to disable the illumination, just hold in the same button for a few seconds that you would use to change the colors.

Great buy!
summary: Nice illuninated keyboard for the price

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is the best keyboard I've ever had! Fast response, easy to read and being backlit I can be up late at night without disturbing the whole household. I've owned several keyboards in the past but was never satisfied as they never seemed to meet my needs.

Well worth every penny I spent!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I ordered this keyboard to replace my OEM Dell keyboard. I was using the keyboard in an area with low lighting and at a desk that has a keyboard tray that pulls out of the desk. I actually found that the white print on my original keyboard were easier to see at the angle I am sitting. If I stared straight down on the backlit keyboard it was OK, but not looking at it from an angle. The keys were also very cheap. My standard OEM Dell keyboard that shipped with my system has a much better feel than this keyboard did. I also had issues with keys not responding. I ended up returning the item.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
For the price this is a fine keyboard, wish one of the selected backlilt colors was white. plus there is no way to turn off the backlite when computer is not in use, but overall, I am enjoying the keyboard.  I am a hunt and peck typist, and used to have to use a lamp to find the keys, this solved that problem. It arrived on schedule as promised.

CORRECTION, I  stated "there is no way to turn off the backlite when computer is not in use"
Read in a comment that to press the backlit key and hold for 3 seconds, the backlit will go to sleep. Tried it and it worked! Press again, the key board lights up! Wish the instruction noted it this.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This keyboard has great backlighting on the keys, and large letters for you old people. ;)

But it is uncomfortable to type on; the keys have a short travel distance, and unlike the Microsoft keyboard I've used, there is a hard stop when you press down the key fully; there is no padding in the keys.  The consequence of this is that your fingers get sore after an extended period of typing on this keyboard.  I have not tried to type any multi-page essays yet, and I don't want to.

But the keyboard does work well, and Windows 7 detected it and installed the driver without any work on my part.  All of the function buttons at the top of the keyboard work from the start.
summary: Well lit, large letters, but uncomfortable feel

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
This is a great big key keyboard that lights very well.
Not too bright, not too dim, but just right.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Okay bad joke.. keyboard looks nice,  the action sucks.. It's good for the price, the LEDs look sexy.. but the key action sucks.  It all works okay,  so I won't give it a total crap review,  but if typing on a thing of quality is something you are after.. you probably won't be too happy with this.

It's a good keyboard to give to your kid and tell them what a cool keyboard you got them.. but don't keep it for yourself.
summary: I'm ysusing the ksyepboard anow to type ths revweo

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: easy set up, cool media options, three colors to choose from, arrived at my door in perfect condition, product and packaging. Great light-up keyboard without spending a lot on the gamer keyboards. This one is where it's at! Would recommend in a heartbeat!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Major keys are easily discernible in the dark.  Function keys and number/symbol keys are less so.  So, visually-speaking, this keyboard works okay.

However, tactically-speaking, the keys are flat and mushy.  I'm used to keyboards that have slightly curved faces so that you can feel the edge of the keys easily.  And I'm used to keyboards that have a little more responsive "give" to them when depressed.  I find that using this keyboard is a lot more difficult than simply using a desk lamp with my regular keyboard.

So, while the backlit keyboard works, it doesn't work well enough for me to recommend.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: no sleep mode button at least one that works, no instructions came nor could find any website that had instructions. I tried holding down all keys ten seconds. could not find a sleep mode button and for $40 keyboard I want one that works. sending back for refund.
summary: no sleep mode button at least one that works

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: My husband and I are gamers and do play a lot of these on pc and there for need a keyboard.  The glare from lamps and overhead light interferes with the games so we turn them off but then it is very hard to see the keys to use them.  We tried the "glow in the dark" keyboards with very large lettering, but they must be exposed to bright light to charge up the glow in the dark keys and it slowly fades away and then is no better then the regular keyboards.  We saw this and said what the heck and decided to try this one out.  It arrived and the lettering is very large.  We plugged it in and turned off the lights.  WOW!  It is back lit with leds so no fading away or needing to charge up with sunlight.  Three colors to choose from you can choose how bright you need this to be.  It is perfect!  We are ordering a second for aging parents who we often see bending over and close to their keyboards to see the buttons.  I highly recommend!
summary: Perfect low light or old eyes keyboard.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This is a great keyboard. Finally. I've tried several others, including a Saitek. It only illuminated in blue. This is an odd thing to do, because the way human eyes work, the color blue is about the least visible of all colors in the dark. It has something to do with the wavelengths,rods and cone and cells. Anyway. Purple is quite easy to see, and so is orange. It doesn't hurt that the labeling on the keys is HUGE. Key action is nice. Layout is familiar as I am accustomed to a full size keyboard, and the colors can be toggled between,blue, purple and reddish orange. I've been using it for a few weeks now and it is wonderful. When I have insomnia and want to write or surf the WWW, I can see what I am typing without turning on the house lights, disturbing others.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
A pretty decent buy for the price, keyboard has large print keys with 3 available backlit colors; blue, lavender, & red.
There are also function key to bring up email, internet home page, music player, volume controls, and calculator to name a few. Gratefully previous reviewers revealed how to turn off the backlight (pressing LED key in upper right corner for 5-10 seconds) or I would not have any idea how to turn it off as there are no instructions included with product. Would be nice to have a neutral color backlight like white or yellow. Overall very satisfied with purchase.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I ordered this keyboard since I work at home early in the mornings and my undershelf is rather dark. I had installed an led light but it really wasn't sufficient for my needs. I also do not touch type so I have to be able to see the keys. This is the perfect keyboard for me.  The letters are nice and big and they are also quite bright without being annoying. The light is even across the keyboard without dark areas near the edges that I expected.  My only complaint is that the hot key images are rather small and hard to see.  Not that I use them often.  Would I recommend this board?  Oh yes.  You can't beat the price which makes it a great value.  Also the tri-color is a nice added touch. Just pick the one your most comfortable with.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Wow this keyboard is nice I like the feel also...Was tired of my Logitech board with small letters and numbers...And I mean small...My laptop has much bigger letters then the Logitech board. You can work so easy in low light with this board..I just hope it lasts..It is made in China and this company just puts in name on it..

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: Needed new keyboard for my home office, wanted one that was easier for me to see, (Now senior citizen), liked the idea of large letters on the keyboard and was backlit so I can use it in low light. I wasn't disappointed, loved the ability to change the colors, found that the purple one was easiest on the eyes. Would absolutely get this again if needed

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText:
Take a look at the 3 pics I uploaded!
I bought 2 of these, and I'm really impressed!  I've attached 3 pics showing the brightness of the color in a dark room.  The color intensity seems just right, and the letters are very easy to read.

Pros:
+ Solid build quality.
+ 3 colors & and an off mode (hold color-button for 3 seconds).
+ Keys are responsive, they sound & feel good too!
+ It's designed well, and I'm willing to bet that it'll last a really long time!
+ Very affordable considering all the features it has.
+ I'm a PC-gamer, and I approve this keyboard!
+ I think this keyboard is so neat, that I'd be willing to give it as a gift - to anyone!

Cons:
- No "white" color (not a big deal).
- Holding down the color-button to turn off the colors takes "2 seconds" too long: it should turn off after being held for just 1 second.

I'm a PC-gamer and I highly recommend this keyboard to everyone!  I like it so much that I guarantee I'll be buying more and using them as gift ideas :D
summary: Probably the best keyboard I've ever owned.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: I thought you couldn't turn off the light and that made me sad. see video. The manual (one page flyer, see scan of it in customer images) over and over and no mention. Thanks to a reply to my fuming review I discovered the answer - Just hold the color change button down and it turns off. I TRIED that before writing the bad review but thought it didn't work because... you have to hold it down for a long time. (5 seconds is an eternity) PROS: 1) brightest of any keyboard I have ever seen. I have had a saitek Saitek Eclipse Backlit Keyboard - Red LED ( PZ30AUR ) and a logitech Logitech G15 Gaming Keyboard (the logitech was the WORST, very very dim light even at the brightest setting) 2) the colors are awesome, surprisingly the pink color is very eye catching. 3) It is a quiet typer, not much clickety-clack keeping people up at night. Some people might like clickety clacking though so it is just a personal preference to be aware of. 4) great price, cheaper and easier than hacking my logitech keyboard with a brighter DIY led upgrade. (I looked online and it didn't look easy at all) 5) not much bleed through of the light / back lighting in between the keys, making it look very nice and clean. look at the other competing back-lit keyboards. you can see a massive amount of bleed around the backside of the keys, turning it into a visual mess! CONS: 1) the space bar is nearly flush with the wrist mount so you might have a harder time reaching it depending on your typing style. 2) people have mentioned how annoyingly small the del button is. if you use DEL a lot that might be an issue. 3) I don't like the feel of the key travel (they are listed on their site as a membrane switch) but that is just a personal preference. 4) the keys are flat and smooth, not contoured or cylindrical so if you are used to that feel of a raised edge to help typing then this will leave something to be desired. 5) Cruddy manual. not that you need one but I did and it didn't mention turning off the key lighting at all, hence the video 6) I'm not familiar with the reputation of this company but at this price who cares. 7) No dedicated calculator button and it is light on other media buttons. I guess you could customize/remap them with software like autohotkey. 8) no USB pass through hub - but one wasn't advertised. If you want one just buy one. This one is my favorite: Satechi 12 Port USB Hub with Power Adapter & 2 Control Switches 9) no USB-PS2 adapter included - but one wasn't advertised and new computers don't need them anyway. (SIDENOTE: Sometimes when you are diagnosing a failing computer you NEED a PS2 keyboard, so always have one lying around. otherwise if the USB controller gets damaged/crashes/uninstalls/whatever you cant do squat in the BIOS and can't press F8 on boot to enter safe mode to diagnose the problem. Native PS2 is best but if you don't want to have an extra keyboard around (always handy for recovery from spilled drinks though this one would be okay with that: Kensington Washable USB/PS2 Keyboard with Antimicrobial Protection!) you can buy an adapter such as this StarTech.com Replacement USB Keyboard to PS/2 Adapter - F/M (GC46FMKEY) to have just in case.) Docked a star for having flat keys. Im a hunt and peck kinda guy and I don't like my fingers sliding off and pressing other keys. not much of an issue in real life though. That said, it is probably one of the best lighted keyboard available (the logitechs are waaay too dim for me, they call it a "feature"), but before you ask - "WHY YOU NO TURN OFF LIGHT???" try holding down the color changing button and counting to ten.
summary: Video of colors changing - You can turn off the light!

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: good for the price.

title: Azio Vision Backlit USB Keyboard with Large Print keys and 5 Interchangeable Backlight Colors (KB506) - Wired
reviewText: This keyboard is awesome. Keys light up and you can adjust the brightness and change the colors. Letters are nice and large for my old and tired eyes!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
This would have been five stars, but I received a bad keyboard initially.  It functioned, but it was bad... read on:

After a poor review of the first keyboard I received, ChallengerUSA contacted me to get the board replaced.  Now that I have the new one, my first review is no longer accurate.

I had three (plus one) requirements of a keyboard, and this met all of them.

1)  Backlit.  Back lighting is great for this keyboard

2)  Low-profile.  Love low-profile/chiclet-style keyboards, but they don't seem to be super popular.

3)  Media controls.  As with backlighting, media controls are great, really just essential for any gaming keyboard.

The "plus one" requirement is that the keyboard MUST type well!  I thought that was tacit since a keyboard's sole design should revolve around a pleasant typing experience.  Anyway, the first keyboard I received had keys that liked to stick, either up or down.  I think the keys were poorly fitted to the board, because many took highly varying degrees of force to press, and sometimes they would get stuck down (like thissssssssss). Or they would be super difficult to press so ou nd up tping lie this.  As you can imagine, it was extremely frustrating.

I have since exchanged that keyboard for a replacement, and I have to say that the first one I got was just a bad one.  The first board I received felt very much like textured plastic, to the point that it was almost sticky (in an adhesive, gummy sort of way).  I think this was part of the issue in the keys getting hung up in the up or down position.  The replacement I'm using now still has a coarse texture, but it is more like a granite or rough-stone texture.  Obviously I can still tell that it's plastic, but it feels like this batch of polymer cured a little better than the previous.  The first keyboard was like undercooked cookies, this keyboard is like overcooked cookies... or something...  Regardless, the keys don't stick - a HUGE plus.

It's a great keyboard for the price. If you have problems like the ones I described, don't hesitate to contact ChallengerUSA.  They sent me a return label and took back my old keyboard even without the box.  I sent the old keyboard back Monday and got the replacement Friday, so awesome turnaround to boot.  Good folks.

Back to the keyboard:  I like low-profile keys a la the Dell XPS L502x laptop, and this looked to be the closest I could find for a desktop.  The keys have a lighter feedback than scissor-style switches; they really just feel like they're using the force of the rubber dome beneath to stay up.  Take from that what you will; if you like a light tactile feedback, these are great.  If you want something heavier, maybe look for scissor style switches or get away from chiclet keyboards altogether.

While it would be great if they put just a little more engineering into the key feedback, e.g. scissor-style switches, I can't really complain because the light tactile feel works for me too.

I would love to go with 5 stars, but I don't seem to be alone in receiving less-than-optimal keyboards, which leads me to believe Karura could stand to work on their quality control a little bit.

If you get a properly manufactured keyboard, it's a solid 5 stars for the price. If you have to suffer through a bad one first, I think you'll feel me when I only give it 4 stars.
summary: Updated review! Lots of cool features, great price, poor quality control?

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: Crapped out after a short period of time cheap quality 2 stars because manufacturer did offer a refund at my shipping expense though but i didn't waste my time or money and bought a Logitech keyboard you get what you pay for
summary: You get what you pay for

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: No issues after a year or two of frequent use. The wsad key caps do wear quickly for heavy use gamers.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I love these! The feel is so much nicer than the hard plastic keyboards!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
