reviewText: quite keys, different colors selections + breathing mode, windows key lock out. I like it.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I don't know how I managed to order this after I verbatim searched "Mechanical Keyboard" in Amazon search bar. This is NOT a mechanical keyboard, the packaging says "Mechanical Feel Keyboard", which is crazy misleading. This might be good for people that like tactile feel, but it wasn't even close to what I was searching for. Don't be mislead, do your research like I did not.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: very good

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
This keyboard only costs $35 for a reason. The matte finish wears off quickly, and the backspace key sticks on mine, which is very obnoxious. I have read on other reviews that the caps come off, but if that is true it must require quite a bit of force to achieve this. Also, the fact that the music control keys require holding down the FN key is a step down from my other keyboard.

I bought this keyboard as a silent alternative to my mechanical board, but overall I have been unimpressed by the way it feels and by the key layout (giant enter key -- I am a programmer and use backslash enough that this was obnoxious). I could only handle using this for a couple of weeks before I swapped it out for my old mechanical. I will spend the money on a more expensive brand next time.
summary: You get what you pay for.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: For the price and all I love it. In fact using it to type this right now. Good selection of backlight colors as well.
summary: For the price and all I love it. In fact using it to type this ...

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
I purchased this keyboard as a cheaper alternative to the "Razer DeathStalker Essential Gaming Keyboard" (they seem very similar in looks with its low profile, chiclet style keys) . I like the variable backlight colors and it actually feels sturdy with minimal flex which was a pleasant surprise for a keyboard at this price! I can use it on my lap when gaming out in the living room and works quite well for first person shooters. Braided cable is a nice touch. Awesome.  However!! ...there's always a catch, isn't there.

The keys are stiff - it takes considerable more pressure to actuate the keys than what I'm used to.  Now that's something you can eventually adapt to - the problem is, some keys, especially the horizontally longer keys to the right of the keyboard, such as the 'backspace', need more pressure than others, especially if you press the key off-angle and not right in the center (perhaps a little bit of binding is at play).  So while touch typing, this can be aggravating when a key press didn't register because you didn't press it hard enough despite using the same pressure as the other keys.

So in conclusion, great for FPS gaming (where your hand is over the WASD, shift and spacebar) but not so much when you're typing away.  I still think it's an overall decent value given the low price, but it could be a 5 star product if it weren't for that inconsistency. I've noticed other reviews have noted similar issues so just add me to that list.

Update: The backspace started to become more and more problematic with its binding, sometimes not working even after pressing it again, harder!  Returning this to Amazon and lowering it to 2 stars vs 3.
summary: Affordable, solid, nice look & feel keyboard, but inconsistently stiff keys

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: Bright color display with quiet keys that have several different programmable functions keyboard is a great size and wrist rest makes it very comfortable.
summary: comfortable quiet and useful even if not a gamer

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: Keys are mushy and typing on this gets annoying after a few consecutive hours. I recommend spending the extra for a mechanical keyboard or something that has scissor switches if you want the laptop chicklet key feel.
summary: Keys are mushy and typing on this gets annoying after a few consecutive hours

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Pros:
- Nice lighting options.
- Nice matte black.
- Keys feel nice and easy to push.
- Very quiet.
- Cable is good length.

Cons:
- Almost too much space between keys.
- Caps lock, Num lock, and Win lock status lights are very bright.

Other thoughts:
- Wish it came in all black.
- Not much tactile feedback on key presses.
- I am used to typing on a laptop, so the flat keys of this keyboard are nice.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I absolutely love the look and feel of this keyboard. Unfortunately, the caps lock key doesn't work. I can't even unlock my computer. How does this happen? One of the most important keys on a keyboard. Do they not even have any quality control? Such a nice design wasted.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Excellent budget tier gaming keyboard.

If you like the various "Razer Naga" type keyboards where there's a big ol' slab and then chiclet keys in them...this is basically that.

It honestly its a great example of a chiclet gaming keyboard.  Doesn't slide around the desk, the keys are responsive.

I know its heresy in the PC Gaming World, but I really dislike Mechanical Keyboards.  Too loud!  This is quiet and responsive, glad I bought it.
summary: Budget-Tier Chiclet Gaming Keyboard.  A good one!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Updated review.

The space bar has started to stick and this is driving me crazy. It isn't because of food or drink either as the keyboard has barely been used as I mostly use a wireless one with my tv. This keyboard I use in front of my monitor and the monitor is rarely used. Maybe the space bar is sticking because of the warping? The warping seems to be worse. The return window has passed and I am very disappointed. Lesson learned.

I like it... and like the ability to change colors. Also, the keys are low profile and very quiet. Nothing bothers me more than a clicky and noisy keyboard.

The only issue is that the keyboard is slightly warped so the front left corner floats off of my desk a little. I have tried the keyboard in another area and confirmed it is this keyboard that Ian slightly twisted. I was hoping it would straighten out with use but have had no such luck. With out this issue... I would absolutely give this 5 stars...
summary: Lesson learned. Dont Buy! Slightly twisted so doesnt sit on desk right.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: When I switched to Mac I fell in love with Chiclet keys and couldn't go back. Since switching back to a Windows machine I've struggled to find the right keyboard. This one is perfect. The keys feel really great (despite what a lot of the comments are saying). The colors are very bright. Having elevated wrists is really nice. I personally like the texture. It's like soft hard plastic. The plastic is hard and not elastic in any way, but its soft to the touch and comfortable. If this keyboard fails me, I'll just buy another one.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I bought this primarily as a silent keyboard so that I wouldn't wake up my husband while he was trying to sleep. It does a great job of being silent while I'm pounding on the keys. I have not noticed any difficulty pressing sticky keys like other posters have mentioned. Pros: Silent, color changing LED's , braided cable Negs:I'm used to a full size keyboard and something's just a little smaller about the spacing of these keys that makes my touch-typing a little off for the keys on the periphery (resulting in needing to slow down a little bit (but not a lot) if I'm touch typing lengthy amounts of text.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)

awesome and quiet little keyboard!
key brightness is really nice and the color selection is wide and perfect for anyone looking for a keyboard with backlighting

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Not bad, but not great. Backlights aren't anything to brag about, but they do their job. Can choose between 7 colors, or have a color-changing "breathing" mode by pressing fn+color key.

The keyboard is incapable of remembering color settings after shutdown. If you have a favorite color that isn't red, you'll have to switch to it every time you power on. This might be bypassed if you enable USB charging when powered down if your motherboard supports it, but I haven't confirmed this.

Wrist-rest takes up a lot of space, and is not detachable.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: Hard use hasn't degraded this puppy. Very nice.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
I primarily game using my Steam controller, so I didn't necessarily need a keyboard for gaming. Instead, I wanted a simple but stylish keyboard for typing that would match the rest of my red/black/silver color scheme. Since I'm used to laptop-style keyboards, this fit the bill nicely. I hardly miss keystrokes.

My only issue with the keyboard is how grease tends to accumulate where my palms rest along the bottom edge.

Overall, I am satisfied.
summary: Nice keyboard, may be a pain to clean

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: Works perfect :)

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
I was pleasantly surprised by this keyboard. It was recommended to me by Amazon's algo when I searched for a replacement for my Razer keyboard, which I like a lot.
This one has super smooth and VERY quiet keys (love that!), very low travel ( I love it, others hate that), and the back-lighting is surprisingly good (and yes you CAN change the colors, there's a button for that on the right).
The Return key is placed in a slightly different area than on the Razer so I tend to hit the forward slash button a lot, which is annoying but just takes some getting-used to.
The back-lighting is not super even, and I didn't expect that on a keyboard that's so cheap. But it's more than acceptable and chances are you won't notice. If the slight unevenness of the lighting drives you nuts, feel free to spend 4 times the price on a Razer or Logitech.
summary: Super smooth and quiet typing, nice quality

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
This is a horrifically awesome keyboard! Matches my red and black themed build quite well, feels fantastic, and allows me to play games without even thinking about it. It also has a Windows key lockout function, which is a blessing for when I'm in my game. I can't tell you how many times my gaming has been interrupted because of the forsaken Windows key.

There are a couple things that I don't like about this keyboard, however.

1) Sometimes the keyboard will register a single press as a double press of a key. This hasn't bothered me in gaming, but has become a minor pain when typing. Nothing serious to me, since I don't use this keyboard for anything super important (no office use here).

2) The red LED light is a little too dim. I wish it were a little brighter so that it better matched my overall theme. I have a gaming mouse from Redragon that is also red, and the LED light is much brighter.

If you're a gamer with a budget build, then definitely add this onto it if you are looking for an affordable, yet decent, gaming keyboard.
summary: This is a horrifically awesome keyboard! Matches my red and black themed build ...

reviewText: I like the performance of the keys, buy hate the backlighting.  Color selected does not stay when you turn the computer off, it reverts to red. They should make it to lock the color you select. Also, instead of locking the choice in to set colors (most of which I don't like at all) why not give it an RGB control allowing the user to set the color?  The red is too dim, as is the blue, the only yellow has a greenish tint, turquoise is okay but I don't care for it or the purple.  White is okay but again very inconsistent.  The lighting is very uneven, good on some keys bad on others.  The large illuminated Redragon logo is annoying.  I blacked it out.  It would also be good if they used non wear keycaps in which the black and the transparent parts are molded all the way through.  Some keys are already losing black, rendering the letters hard to read.  Other than that, it's a keyboard.
summary: Selected Color doesn't stay when you turn the computer off;  Reverts to Red

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
I received the Redragon Karura K502 Gaming Keyboard today, and am using it to write this review. I bought this keyboard to go along with my new custom gaming PC, and I think it will do an amazing job. I'm used to a Toshiba laptop keyboard, so the keys feel just fine to me. I read other reviews before purchasing, and will address some of the complaints I saw. Firstly, the space bar. Other reviews said the space bar was significantly harder to press compared to the other keys. I completely disagree. The space bar is just as easy to press as any of the other keys, but it must be noted that, at least with my keyboard, there is a slight spring sound after releasing the space bar, but that won't be noticeable at all when gaming. Secondly, the complaint that the keyboards build material easily picks up skin oils. To me, that claim is completely false. Lastly, and most importantly, the back lighting:

Cons:
-Some keys aren't lit as well as others, namely on the following keys:
  -Space bar
  -Backspace
  -F key
  -0 on the number pad
-The white setting seems to be less bright compared to the other colors
-Space bar noise (this is just being very picky, it's a 24$ keyboard after all)

Pros:
-Back lighting
-7 different color settings (green and cyan are particularly great in my opinion)
-Very smooth key strokes
-Great build material, doesn't feel cheap
-Fantastic braided black and red cable, with plenty of length

Neutral (up to reader):
-Num, Caps, and Win Lock LEDs are not changeable (solid red)
-Redragon logo at bottom center is the brightest/most well lit area of the keyboard

Edit:
After using the keyboard for a week, I now realize the keyboard does accumulate skin oils, but this is nothing a few seconds with a microfiber cloth won't fix

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
I liked everything about this keyboard except the placement/shape of the enter and backslash keys. Look closely in the product images. Basically the backslash key is next to the ' key instead of on the row above it. It irritated me enough after 3 days of use to just send the damn thing back. I suspect they did that to be different enough from the Razr keyboard (that it is similar to) to not get sued.

Returned it after 3 days.
summary: Backslash key on home row? WHY?

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
This is the best keyboard deal on the planet.  I work on my computer all day, so I type a lot.  I switch out keyboards frequently and I own many keyboards including several mechanical ones.  While I like mechanical keyboards, I also like flat, Chiclet-style keyboards with short keystrokes like this one.  It feels similar to Apple Macbook keyboards except the keys on this product have rubberized coatings.

The Redragon Karura key labels are highly visible in both bright and dark settings.  It's nice to be able to switch colors easily.  The keyboard looks fantastic and is very slim.  The palm rest is comfortable.  The cord is braided, heavy and has a velcro fastener so that you can keep excess cord out of the way.

For about $24, the Redragon Karura is an amazing deal.
summary: This is the best keyboard deal on the planet

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)

reviewText: I wanted to buy a Razer Deathstalker because I loved the design, but then this caught my eye. Right away, the keyboard feels great. The keys are a little cheap, and the led's don't light up a small part of the larger keys, but it's hard to complain at this price. The key's are soft, it's ultra quiet and it feels very close to a Razer Deathstalker. Im only giving it 4 stars due to the LED's not lighting up as well on the larger keys compared to the smaller keys. Otherwise, this is a fantastic keyboard.
summary: Don't buy the Razer Deathstalker, get this instead!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
First off let me say that I use Linux, Xubuntu to be specific. This Keyboard works perfectly with Xubuntu 16.10 probably because no Software is required -- all the controlling is done via the Keyboard itself. It's an almost perfect Keyboard.

If I had to complain about a feature it would be the Arm Rest -- it isn't removable. As unfortunate this may be for some people like myself, it's an easy enough oddity to work around. There are 8 colors you can cycle through (including off) and you can have it auto-cycle through them, or, 'breathing' as it's called. If they made the same Keyboard with a removable Arm Rest, I would purchase it and give this one to a friend or family member.

It kind of feels like a Laptop Keyboard with it's smooth feel and almost flat Keys. The Keys have some push-back to let you know that you are actually pressing a key. In pressing the very edge of a key it doesn't get 'stuck' like some of these flat key Keyboards. It looks like quality and it feels like quality.

The USB cable should be long enough for most people and it's covered in a fabric. I bought this with a "Redragon Centrophorus" Mouse from the same company, which is also quality. I don't know about longevity, time will tell. Many features are, as of yet, undiscovered by me and quite possible will never be used by me. I think you would be happy if you decided to purchase this Keyboard. 4/5

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Just because it looks like a decent Keyboard, I gave it a 2 star, Aside from the design and lighting, This is not a good keyboard, even for the price. The keys are mushy and feel like full membrane keys. They tend to get stuck and it feels like you have to put in extra effort just to push in a key. They do not feel pleasant at all to type with.

If you're someone that intends to get this keyboard for writing, DON'T. It's a waste of money.
If you want it cause it looks cool, that's all you're really going to get out of it.

The space bar is also very squishy and misses sometimes, not very good when using it for a game either. In fact none of the keys on the keyboard are adequate for gaming, this shouldn't have "gaming keyboard" in the title. It's horrible, barely good enough to have as a conversation piece. I was over all disappointed with the keyboard.

I put it back in the box almost as soon as I took it out and gave it a test drive. Mine, also had a sticky "H" key, due to the minimal effort into putting some kind of mechanical anything in the keys. It's nearly nothing but membrane so the keys tend to get stuck in the corners, that's very terrible. I figured mine was defective as I did not see anyone else have this issue. Not a great start, I do NOT recommend it at all.
summary: Squishy Membrane Keys - Not a good Keyboard.

reviewText:
Returning this soon.....so okay.

Pros:

It is backlit ; different colors ; chiclet style that were just like my laptop that i used for years.

Cons:

the keys were VERY HARD to press down , and when pressed at the edges, they would not depress correctly and fought being pressed down. You had to be directly in the center to push it; one of the F1-12 keys at the top got stuck when i pushed it....only way to get it unstuck was to pull a corner of the key outwards so it would come undone ; the space bar super stiff, as were all the keys, but this one especially; the long wrist rest is nice BUT its very solid and has a plastic feel to it, you might feel some slight unease since its just "there" because if you prefer the soft type of wrist rests or something thats softer, this board won't do you any good ; the sturdiness of the board isn't anything to boast about, no flex, but also doesnt look like it would withstand harsh punishment eg food and drink spilled on it ; some slight oil buildup on the keys may happen beacuse of its texture.

all in all it was perfect for me in visuals, but physically it fails for me.
summary: Great price, Not so great quality

reviewText:
This is an amazing keyboard for its price. Anti ghosting, LED backlit, braided cable, windows lock and switchable WASD and arrow keys. Its well built too, I was worried it owuld feel flimsy and cheaply made, but none of that, it feels solid and it has good weight, no rattle or anything. Bought another one wfor my cousin's gaming PC. title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I was skeptical when buying this keyboard. I recently owned a Razer Deathtalker. Recently I changed my desk setup to a white theme and I needed something cheap that was like the old keyboard and had white LED's. This got the job easily done, and with some white Carbon Fiber wraps over the red stripe and bottom portion of the keyboard, this thing feels AMAZING. The keys compared to the deathstalker are odd, but I can't complain because while off, they are actually quit nice. They are more rubbery feeling and would easily relate to being like a $300-ish laptop keyboard. The keyboard itself is sturdy and stays in place no matter what. I did some hit tests on it and it would barely slide an inch. The LED's are OKAY. The LED's on the keys are not as bright as they are in the picture, however the dragon logo on the bottom lights much brighter than all the keys even on the highest setting. The braided cable is amazing! For such a low price including a braided cable with red and black detail AND a GOLD plated usb end is just pure greatness. Overall, for the price, this keyboard is AMAZING! And if you decide to do some small modifications to it, it can literally be better than a $100 keyboard!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Pros:
Local LED control is awesome! (High end RGB keyboard manufactures PAY ATTENTION!)
Cheap
Large
Good wrist rest

Cons:
Rubberized, meh.
Some keys squeak, errr.
Enter key is way to narrow, '/' will be the new enter key for you typists.

I don't hate it, let's just put it out there. For a $25 keyboard it's pretty good. It functions just fine, no problems with ghosting or key failures. HOWEVER, the left shift and space bar have this annoying squeak. I know, first world problems. Where all the other keys have a subtle click sound, it's kind of a bugger. I don't know how I feel about the rubberized coating either. Thought I'd like it but now that I'm using it, meh. The one thing, of all things that this keyboard has that I do not prefer is the narrow 'Enter' key. Most keyboard have a longer, horizontally stretched Enter key but this one is more vertical as you can see from the pictures. I would understand for gamer's that this isn't a big deal but for someone that actually uses there keyboard for typing documents every now and then, it's annoying. You have to always remember to stretch your right pinky further over then usual to reach it or you'll end up hitting the slash button... ALL THE TIME! But again, for $25 what can you say.

What I like. The Local LED control is awesome! high end RGB keyboard manufactures need to listen. It's not that hard to have basic RGB control on the keyboard without installing some space/process hogging software just to modify colors not to mention how buggy they can be. Simple hard keys dedicated to LED color adjustments is all you really need. No one in the real world will be typing with their keyboard LED's gyrating 2.6 million colors. Other than that, the wrist rest is decent, though I wish it was sloped down a bit more and not flat. Braided cable is sharp and though he keys feel a bit numb when typing, they are fairly solid.

In conclusion, if key feel isn't too important to you and you want a good RGB keyboard, this is a pretty damn good price.
summary: For $25, don't expect a beast. Though it's still a contender.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)

======= Update.

I was sent a brand new one as a replacement. Outstanding customer service. The first one was just a lemon, the replacement works wonderfully. Thanks!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
First the good things: The keyboard comes with a gold USB plug that won't rust and the cable is braided. This makes me wonder why keyboards from other brands that there to go above $100 some times come with standard usb connections. The keyboard is very silent and I like the fact that the windows key was moved to the right side of space bar. I don't really care much about the led colors but it's a nice touch.

However, the keyboard falls a bit short on the quality of the keys. When I got the keyboard out of the box, the h key would get stuck after pressing it. The F8 and the number pad enter key had a time when they would do that too. It stopped doing it now but it was weird that  The spacebar is a bit flimsy and will not register keystrokes if you don't hit it exactly in the two points where it connects with the rest of the keyboard. I would have to go back and place spaces where it did not register. The keyboard stopped doing this but I think I got used to it. So if you have to get used to the keyboard, then it is no so well designed.

The keyboard is good, specially for the price, but it needs a bit more work in the quality of the keys to get a 5 stars rating.
summary: Great value for the price even with some flaws.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
For about $25, you get a keyboard almost exactly like the Death stalker from Razer. This keyboard has more backlight color options (I know that isn't important, but it's nice to pick your own color). And though some have said that since the existing accent color is red, it looks strange if you go with a different backlight, I disagree.

As someone who owns a Death stalker keyboard, I have to say this is almost indistinguishable when using it. Both have the chocolate style keys, which I personally find appealing. They're very responsive, without the excessive click! IMG and noise of the mechanical keyboards. I know those are considered to be tops in the gaming world, but there's definitely an element of personal preference there.

The anit-ghosting seems to work fine on this. I'm able to pay FPS as well as other online games that require simultaneous key presses. Using it on League of Legends, for example, with no trouble or dropped key presses at all. nd in that game it's extremely important to hit your combos correctly. So in short, if you want a good gaming keyboard and aren't completely set on mechanical keys, this is probably one of the best options out there and it's super inexpensive. And it looks cool...
summary: Excellent gaming keyboard for a very low price.

The lighting effects are amazing for this price range, with the brightness comfortable on the eyes and easy to see. The keys however leave much to be desired. All the keys have a bit of a wobble to them and the space bar is very mushy making typing a bit cumbersome at times. That being said, its function as a gaming keyboard far surpasses many other keyboards, with all the keys comfortably placed apart. If you're a gamer that needs a quality keyboard, and you don't mind mushy buttons, then absolutely get this

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I only ordered this keyboard because my old one broke and I was waiting for my good one to come nt. So, I didn't have very high expectations for this keyboard already, especially for the price. But, it's absolutely horrible. It's very hard to press the keys and they're so small and awkward (coming from someone with little hands). It also doesn't have the normal *click* of a keyboard, it makes more of a crunching sound when you click. And the keyboard is very light and thin, like nothing is there. The only cool thing about this keyboard is that it changes colors, but the keyboard is not backlight like the Razor and Corsair keyboards, it's just LED. There's a button to change the color (they don't continuously change) and the lights aren't bright at all, either.

Very disappointed will return for refund.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Looks sharp, simple, and has nice lights.

It's going to take me a while before I get used to typing on this keyboard.
Good key functions, very simple.

The warranty website does not work. The linked website is [...] But when you go to the site, itdoes notwork.

Also, thespacebar does not work like how I would like it to. maybe it will also take some getting used to. I feel it would be better if it were raised a slight bit so that it is easier to push.

EDIT:
Two days after owning this keyboard, I can say that I amdissatisfied. I do not enjoy typing on it. It is very quiet, but feels awkward. The spacebar squeaks when psushed, the space bar often misses spaces (I am a touch typist), and it collects fingerprints very easily. The CAPS LOCK and NUMLOCK and WINLOCK in the top right are far too bright compared to the rest ofthe backlighting. The back lighting also seems to be uneven on the keys, and some of the letters are brighter than others. I will exchangethis keyboard for one of higher quality.

Overall. This is a DECENT budget keyboard for web surfing. Not for serious gamers or college students like myself who have to type essays often.
summary: Decent,cheap keyboard, will take some getting used to.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Pros- As a gaming keyboard it is sleek, silent and subtle. Sleek, in that it is only 0.7" high, with a length of around 17" and a 8" depth, and while typing your  hands almost glide over the keyboard because of the material it is made of. The 4 settings for your LED lights are as so. OFF, low, Medium, High. There are 7 color options along with an off mode. (which I like if i'm not using my keyboard, i.e. gaming controller.) If you are looking for a color scheme to match your setup at home. all the keys and the Reddragon logo are led lights. The red bad separating the keys and the wrist pad is a constant red. The keys are very quiet when typing, and the entire feel of the keyboard is nice and subtle, not too many buttons or extra gadgets. Just what you need to game.
Cons- as far as typing goes, if you are using it for a keyboard to type an essay on or write a business report, I would look else where. The keys aren't like a standard keyboard in that they do not protrude as far out. I'm noticing now how much trouble i'm having typing. It's skips keys if you don't press hard. and every once in a while it skips shift and space-bar.

good gaming keyboard, not good for essays or business reports.

reviewText:
Aside from the couple small sections that appear to have the rubber feel coating worn or thin and a couple minor things this is an awesome keyboard for the price. The key lights are nice and not too bright. The operation of the keys is quiet and smooth.

The F-keys are offset a little from the dell keyboard I was using so it takes some training not to hit the wrong key in-game.
The Enter key is a little odd-shaped so I hit the \ key a lot when I want to hit Enter.
The lock indicator lights (numlock) are super bright and a little distracting when looking at the number pad in low light.

I've only had the keyboard for a few weeks so I can't comment on durability but for the price you can't beat it.

reviewText: I really like this keyboard, I learned a long time ago that mechanical keyboards were not my thing, and I always preferred the smooth, flat laptop keys, some people say the keys stick but I have not had that issue, the led lights switch colors fast, and I personally love the light blue color option, the cord seems very firm, and durable, and I have had zero issues with my keyboard.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: Ordered this with the matching mouse for my boyfriend for christmas. He has really enjoyed it, the keys click much more quietly than his last keyboard and it has a slim profile. The location/shape of the enter key is frustrating at times but we'll adapt. His favorite colors are black and red so this set is perfect for him. The computer automatically looked more expensive and suited for gaming (which he does... A LOT). The braided cords are excellent, and come with velcro ties to help keep wires organized. Products came with 18-month manufacturer warranty but so far we haven't needed them. Even if they stop working after a couple years they are cheap enough to replace without much fuss.
summary: Perfect for frequent - but not professional - gamer.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: The keyboard was initially fantastic, glad I waited a little while otherwise it would have been 5 stars and misinformation. A few reviews I read mentioned issues with keys in generally and specifically the spacebar as being problematic. When I first got the keyboard I plugged it in and it worked well off the bat. Hand rest is terrific, material of the keyboard emulates a high quality and I love the feeling of the keys, and overall between quality of the keyboard physically and its features operationally it really appeared to be ridiculous that this thing was only $26 and not closerto around $40 which is still better pricing than the higher end competitors it is emulating. But I have had this since Feb 5th so as of this review 6 days, LESS than a week and the spacebar is sticking like a mother! Spacebar being probably the most important key on a keyboard is making me contemplate getting a refund because its that much of a problem and its functionality is in question here. Think about it, how hard is typing if you cannot space your words. The space bar takes allot of force to keep from getting stuck, I feel like I am going to break it because of how hard I have to strike it, otherwise it gets stuck in and I have to hit it anyway to get it to loudly popout. Minus that its great but its such a huge flaw it destroys everything else good about it.
summary: You get what you pay for. If you can, buy a better keyboard.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
After 2 weeks the keyboard keys are getting stuck in place and have to be jiggled to get out.
Love the weight and feel of this keyboard only giving 2 star due to lack of instructions on key commands but i found them for yall online.

Function Introduction
1. Plug and play function: USB interface in the keyboard without the need to install the
 drive and software.
2. 7 backlight colors: Press the [ ] key to change the backlight color circularly.
3. Four-level backlight brightness: high light, medium light, low light, and no light.
 Press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the [Page Up] key to increase the backlight
 brightness in the keyboard.
 Press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the [Page Down] key to decrease the
 backlight brightness in the keyboard.
4. Backlight breathing effect: press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the [ ] key to
 start the breathing function. Repeat the above operation and stop the breathing
 function.
 Press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the [-] key to decrease the breathing speed.
 Press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the [=] key to increase the breathing speed.
5. Input speed adjusting function: press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the [Q] key
 to enter the rapid input mode. Repeat the above operation and restore the default
 speed.
6. Interchange function of direction key: press and hold the [FN] key, and then press the
 [W] key to interchange the function of four letter keys [W] [A] [S] [D] and four direction
 keys [UP] [Down] [Left] [Right]. Repeat the above operation and restore the previous
 setting.
7. Function of disabling the [WIN] key: firstly press and hold the [FN] key, and then press
 [WIN] key to forbid the function of the [WIN] key to avoid leaving the game interface
 by pressing the [WIN] key by mistake. Repeat the above operation and restore the
 function.
8. Multi-key conflict-free function: the keyboard supports the simultaneous and effective
 press of the following 19 keys:
 [Q] [A] [Z] [W] [S] [X] [E] [D] [C] [Ctrl-L/F] [Alt-L/V] [B] [Shift-L] [Space] [Tab]
 ['(UP)] ['(Down)] ['(Left)] ['(Right)].
9. Multi-media function: it supports over 12 media functions by combining the [FN] key
 and the key from [F1]-[F12]. It can perform the following media functions:
 FN+F1 : Open the media player.
 FN+F2 : Volume down.
 FN+F3 : Volume up.
 FN+F4 : Mute.
 FN+F5 : Stop.
 FN+F6 : Previous.
 FN+F7 : Play/Pause.
 FN+F8 : Next.
 FN+F9 : Open the email.
 FN+F10 : Open the homepage.
 FN+F11 : Locking key (press to lock the functions of all keys in the keyboard, and press
 again to unlock).
 FN+F12 : Open the calculator.
summary: You get what you pay for.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:

I just bought it because I wanted a red backlight and it was one of the least expensive options, but I have been pleasantly surprised with just how good it is. The only complaints I would have are the glowing logo at the bottom is a little much, but it was still the least gaudy of all the keyboards I was looking at  the only other thing is that the space bar is a little squeaky, but really only noticeable in a super quiet environment. Any time I was playing a game I couldn't hear it anymore.

I was a little worried after reading some reviews about keys sticking, but this hasn't been an issue for me after about a month of daily use. I'm glad I bought this keyboard.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Pros: It's stylish, and the backlight is great. The only other pro I can think of is that they gave me a full refund.

Cons: The spacebar is unusable. When pressing the spacebar, I encountered a great deal of resistance, and it rarely detected key presses. Upon removing the spacebar I noticed the reason: The spacebar is activated by a single switch in the center of the keyunpractical for gaming, typing, or any other use. It is assisted by fragile springs which barely help, if at all. When playing Fallout 3 with the keyboard, although I barely used the spacebar during gameplay, whenever I did need to it almost always took 2 or 3 presses to get it to work.

Not recommended. Returned immediately.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Good: The shape is comfortable to type on and the colors are bright and crisp. If you prefer laptop style chitlet keys its a good form factor.

Serous Deficiencies:
The finish is incredibly weak, the coating on the space bar started to erode after 5 hours of intermittent use.
The buttons are extremely soft and mushy, except for the space bar which requires double the pressure to activate.
Just all around poor quality control, the aluminum stripe that runs horizontally in between the keyboard and the palm rest is warped.

Nitpicking:
On larger buttons such as the backspace or shift, the led is placed in a way that leaves the ends of the words not illuminated.
No FN lock, you can lock the keys to just F keys but not to the actual function.
summary: Not a good product, even for the price.

reviewText: I'm a college student, so I'm using a laptop all day every day in class. When I go home at night, the last thing I want is to have to transition from the laptop keyboard to a big, clunky desktop keyboard. The Karura feels closer to a laptop keyboard than any desktop keyboard I've ever used. The keys are a bit more spaced out and a tiny bit larger, but the difference is almost negligible. The 7 LED colors are fun, but the big kicker for me is the price: $25, and it feels amazing. The only thing I wish could have been done differently: the Windows key is on the right side. It took all of a couple days to get used to it, so it's not a big deal. It just doesn't make much sense to me.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: This WAS the best keyboard I've ever owned (read update below)... I have no issues whatsoever with the Space Bar key, as others have... Just press the key towards the middle, not on the edges (there's no actuator there)... The keys are very quiet, and I love the low profile of the keyboard... The texture is absolutely amazing; I love the smooth, rubberized finish... Note that the red strip on the bottom has a plastic cover when shipped. You need to remove that for it to look right. Adjusting the Speed of the breathing affect could be a little more precise; it seems there's a big jump between the medium and medium-high settings... but anyway, I seriously love this keyboard. I would just say to be careful with the risers on the back. I accidentally broke one of mine when picking my keyboard up; even though I barely touched it. I would say the two flip-out risers on the back are the worst part of the keyboard, but that's an easy MacGuyver fix. ------------------------- EDIT: Its been almost a year, and I now use this keyboard at work, as I love how quiet the keys are. I work for a tech support company where I type all day, every day. The second riser in the back broke about a week after the first one did. I was still using it, while I would put a sticky notepad under the other side, so that it was even, but it didn't matter. The quality of the riser is just crap, and they should be ashamed for putting something like that on a keyboard like this. It really brought down the value and over quality. The lighting effects are still very good, and none of the keys show any sign of degradation. Little bits of dust and crumbs, etc, will get stuck in the bezel around the dragon emblem. Due to the very low resistance/feedback of the keys, I found myself making quite a bit of typing mistakes, as sometimes one or two keys just wouldn't register while I was typing. Honestly, this was not the best gaming keyboard, as it really doesn't seem to have all that many gaming features. I have since bought this keyboard for gaming (Pictek 104 Keys Anti-ghosting Mechanical Gaming Keyboard, Backlit Gaming Keyboards Computer Keyboard with Blue Switch, Water-Resistant for Gamers) and am about 500,000 times happier with it, although the Karura still works well after all this time.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
this keyboard is a budget keyboard and it's not mechanical but to be honest, for an entry-level gamer like me, it works great. To be specific, I just play league with it and league doesn't require you to have a high end keyboard. You'd be fine with DoTa too. But if you're looking for a high end keyboard then you shouldn't even be on this page. If you're looking to get a nice affordable upgrade from your stock keyboard that came with your PC, this is the best budget keyboard. The LEDs are nice and I didn't have any issues with them. I love the feature that fades the lights in and out (I use this when I'm not using my PC).

I will say it was weird at first because the keys are a bit closer together than my old stock Dell keyboard, but after an hour on notepad or word just typing sentences, it's a totally natural feel.
summary: Budget Keyboard: you know what you're buying

reviewText: I'm sure a lot of PC gamers won't let me live this down, but this keyboard does not work will with my MacBook.  Shift buttons won't work and a lot of buttons act wonky while holding them down.  Keyboard is nice though, very quiet (think the exact opposite of a mechanical keyboard).  The lighting feature is pretty neat as well.  I recommend taking a look at the instructions it comes along with because there are a few hidden features I would've never guessed it would have until I took a look at it.  I wish it had programmable buttons.

reviewText:
Pros: Budget gaming keyboard, cool backlight options, very nice braided USB cable

Cons: Difficult to type on due to mushy spacebar and placement of the "\" key (where the Enter key is on many keyboards).  There is only one Windows key, and it's on the right side of the keyboard: I understand this placement as it pertains to accidentally pressing the Windows key, which is normally right under the WASD keys, but this keyboard allows you to disable the Windows key, so I wish it was in the normal spot.

Basically, it's a great budget keyboard, but it takes some getting used to.  I wouldn't buy this to keyboard to do a lot of typing, but it's been great for gaming.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
First of all, the Redragon Karura K502 is an amazing gaming keyboard. I have used keyboards like Razer and Corsair,
and I can definitely tell that this keyboard is up on par with other great keyboards available in the market.

PROS
1) Backlighting is awesome. It has 7 distinctive colours, and all of them are wonderful. Breathe effect is a plus. There are 4 levels of
illumination (off, low, medium, high). If you turned the breathing effect on, it will circle through all seven colours. Simply fantastic.
2) High quality build. This is THE BEST gaming keyboard available under 70 usd range. It has a solid and rigid build, with rubber-like
texture. Looks elite and professional.
3) Good design. It is simple yet very elegant. The overall appearance of the keyboard is very stylish.
4) Wrist rest is wide and comfortable. The rubber-like finish makes it very comfortable to rest your wrist while typing or gaming. Of course,
it will leave a stain if you use it for a while, but after five minutes, the stain will disappear thanks to the materials used to build this keyboard.
5) Typing experience: The keys feels amazing and typing is extremely smooth. It is rather silent when typed on. Keys are incredibly responsive.
6) Gaming experience: Marvelous. Gaming is exemplary for this keyboard.

CONS:
1) Keys spring resistance are rather strong, making it slightly harder to know whether you typed successfully or not.
2) Springy sound of the spacebar. It is not really a bad touch, it is just different. I personally love the sound.

FINAL VERDICT:
An exemplary gaming keyboard from Redragon. It is my first time using their product, but I would like to express my thanks and appreciation
to Redragon for producing such a fine piece of technology. I love it very, very much. :D

I will be looking forward for the next excellence by Redragon. Keep up the awesome work guys. :)

reviewText: I'm just a casual gamer and this key board fits the bill.  I purchased it because it was back lit.  Has all the functions a basic gamer would need without the high price.  Keys are low profile but feel good when I type.  Plethora of different color back lights to match any case lighting you may have.  Sleek and stylish.  Looks great with my MSI theme (Dragon) setup.  Would highly recommend.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: This was a gift for my son.  He loves to play video games and really, really likes this keyboard.  I would say that short of going to a mechanical keyboard, this is really one of the nicest "fun" keyboards out there.  It types well, is lightweight, and the cord seems nice and sturdy.  (That's important because he is always moving it from computer to computer so that he can use "his" keyboard.)  The colors are nice without the keyboard being an eyesore.

reviewText: Great keyboard with nice sound feedback from the keys, very responsive and it is nice to be able to set the color based on mood at the time. title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: I ordered this keyboard after much debating and searching online, hoping that ALL of the reviews about defective keyboards were written by a small portion of customers, rather than their representing the greater bulk of customers. Long story short, nope. My keyboard was defective right out of the box, too. I decided to risk it going by the lovely colors of the backlighting. And they really ARE lovely - IF you can get them to stay on! My keyboard installed with no problem (of course, since the basic pre-installed Windows drivers are all you really need). The problems made themselves evident, however, from the first time I tried scrolling through the colors to see what each looked like. The red (which is the first color on the scheme), green, and blue worked fine, but every time I tried to change to yellow, cyan, pink, or white, the keyboard would shut off for a few seconds (fully disconnecting from my system), then finally restart, right back at red (not one of my favorite colors here). Trying to figure out how to call ChallengerUSA for replacement was an exercise in frustration, so your best bet is probably to go ahead and write a review here (although after I finally gave up and just reluctantly sent an email on their bare bones site, I did get a response the very next day). They emailed me a prepaid return label, and my mail carrier picked the parcel up, which was six days ago. Since then, I've heard nothing more back from ChallengerUSA, and have yet to receive my replacement keyboard. At this point, I'm just hoping to receive my replacement keyboard some time before the holidays are officially here, and a working one at that, but I'm just not holding my breath. The reviews declaring quality control issues are all completely accurate. A product is only as good as its functionality, and this one needs a serious overhaul in the quality control department. Yet another "made in China" item that feels like it's just Dollar Store value. So disappointed. Just as a P.S. - I got mine when the price was a penny less than a twenty note. Even THAT ended up proving to be too much to pay... The $36 price tag they're set at right now (12/15/14) is ridiculous, considering the quality control track record here. *UPDATE* So, here I sit, second keyboard in front of me, with the EXACT SAME PROBLEMS that I experienced with the first: attempting to set any color beyond the initial 3 causes the keyboard to reboot itself, shutting off, sitting completely unlit and unpowered for about 12 seconds, then restarting on red. Trying to set any color beyond red or the "breathing" effect of scrolling through each color is an exercise in futility. And it's not my system. I did a full driver check, purge, and update about two weeks ago (which took painstaking HOURS of time), deleting every single old and possibly corrupted driver in my Device Manager for any device that I had previously installed and subsequently uninstalled, then using multiple methods to update and double-check each remaining driver on my system. Everything is up to date, so the fault here lies solely with this keyboard, and the lack of quality control for it. And this is after I asked, MULTIPLE TIMES, that agents in ChallengerUSA's Quality Control/Tech Support/Customer Service department thoroughly check my replacement for full functionality. I guess asking four times isn't enough. The colors here, again, are great, IF you can get them to stay on, but at 0 for 2 on keyboards that SHOULD work, but don't, I won't be buying anything sold by ChallengerUSA ever again. Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me... *FURTHER UPDATE* I feel like I'm being given the runaround from CS here, being told that they're going to check with tech support for a workaround. A Windows 7 compatible keyboard either works on a Windows 7 system, or it doesn't. My system is Windows 7 x64 SP1, with the latest Windows Update, installed just this evening right before connecting the new (still defective) keyboard, and I'm STILL having the EXACT same problems. Getting nothing but the runaround at this point has pushed me to just give up on this and ChallengerUSA, and just go ahead and order an Azio PRISM USB Keyboard with 7 Colorful Backlights (KB507). Since new egg has them for twenty five bucks right now, that's just a few dollars more than this nightmare of non-functionality has cost me (not including the expense of my sanity). Save yourself some frustration, and just say no. It's not worth the headaches. *FINAL UPDATE* The Azio PRISM USB Keyboard with 7 Colorful Backlights (KB507) is working just fine on my system since I received and installed it this evening. Drivers installed perfectly, all 7 colors and multicolor setting come up just fine. I have not experienced any of the issues I dealt with with the Redragon Karura K502. So, yeah, again - my system wasn't the problem (as I suspected all along). It's the defective keyboards sent out by Redragon that caused my system to experience problems with it. Until ChallengerUSA does an obvious and decisive overhaul of their Quality Control department, again, I won't be buying anything else from them.
summary: Beautiful colors, IF you receive a working keyboard (I didn't - TWICE)!!!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
This is an absolutely stunning looking keyboard. The design and back-lighting make this thing a work of art.
You can cycle through several colors and they are bright.
Now the bad...
As stated by others, the action of the keys is hindered by the coating. The coating feels as though it makes the keys rub on the casing of the keyboard.
This issue may be more my own that anyone else's, The design of the enter key and placement of the "\" key make it difficult for me to effectively use this keyboard in everyday situations.
While these issues are a bit annoying to me, I am going to gift this keyboard to my son as he does not type much. He plays games. This will make the issue of the "\" being in the "wrong" place, a non-issue. Yes, the action of the buttons may be tough at first, I think that they will improve over time and use. Besides, I have to give myself every advantage I can over him at Portal 2... :D

reviewText:
this keyboard looks great and also has nice features on it...

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
Nope, nope, nope, take all my nope.

But first lets see what are the Pros and Cons comparing it to a regular 5-10 dollars keyboard:

Pros:

- Plug and play, you just have to plug it in, no need to go to Redragon's website to get some drivers or anything.
- LED backlight, easy to change color with a press of a key in the keyboard itself

Cons:

- No Windows Key on the left side of the keyboard. If you already are familiar with using that key on Linux or Windows 8 you will feel like there is something missing.
- every single key has like 2 different "feels" or "feedback" to the press. They feel "weird" at first. But then you get some feeling that the key is getting stuck or something and not even working. If you do type really fast you will find yourself frustrated by it. Specially when pressing the SPACE BAR. So. Freaking. Annoying.

It is not worth the money. No wonder it is not available on Redragon's official website.

Oh, and also, when I plugged it in, somehow messed up my AMD's graphics driver. Crashing my Battlefield 4 or any other game after a minute of gameplay. Freezing my PC completely.

I was so frustrated with that issue that I updated my BIOS and changed my GPU drivers and that finally got it working.

Another friend of mine told me that from the various different colors his keyboard can only light up in 3 out of the 7. It just doesnt want to show the others from out of nowhere.

Honestly, and i'm not hating, I love the design and the texture they  used on the keys and keyboard itself, but at the end of the day I would trade design and backlit for a good typing experience.
summary: Got me wishing to have a time machine, to get my money back...

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
UPDATE
After my initial review, I was contacted by ChallengerUSA to remedy my issues. And they have, their customer service is top notch. They do care about the people buying their products. Now,on to the review of the keyboard they sent me. There are some improvements. They grippy texture is now gone from the keys making speed typing much easier. The space bar issue seems more manageable than before. Same overall layout of they original keyboard, except now the backspace key actually says backspace. They keys seem a lot easier to press, as if the keyboard was pre broken in before I got it. Over all, I'm a lot happier this time around.

Now for a downside, Half of they keys you can see the LEDs illuminating from under them. May not be a problem for some, but with my OCD, having half my keyboard like that and the other half not will bother me, but this is something I can live with. This updated review was typed using the new keyboard without having to smash the space bar multiple times to operate as it should. Previous review was typed up with the original keyboard. Over all, if you're looking for a cheap keyboard to buy that lights up and has some good features,this isn't a bad purchase at all. If you have any problems with it, contact the seller. They will do what they can to insure you're happy.

Leaving previous review up for anyone who cares to read it.

You get what you pay for, so cant expect some excellent keyboard. For the price its not bad. Rather hard to type on as keys feel tough. The space bar sometimes requires multiple strikes to register. The keys have a grippy feel to them, so may have to adjust how you type. Some of the LEDs are brighter than others on some of the keys. Altogether, if you're on a budget its a nice keyboard. Maybe Im one of the unlucky few with the space bar and tough keys (a few reviews pointed to this) but overall its not a bad purchase.
summary: Not bad, but not excellent, but is getting better

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
It's ok.

Pros:

- Cheapest backlit keyboard that isn't trash.
- It's not glossy, it's not matte, it's GRAINY. It has a lot of traction, and I can feel my hands move over the keys very easily, even on my two fingers that have nerve damage, which is super cool.
- Did a bend test, really didn't bend much.

Worth noting for some:

- Keyboard makes a very unique sound when typing. Certainly not mechanical loud, but it's louder than my other keyboards (those are scissor-switch though)
- It pushes back a lot before it actuates. I know some would love this though, so despite my not liking it, I think it's just worth noting.

Cons:

- This space bar! Geeze. It's ten times harder to press than the other keys! I feel like on all the other keys I type, but I need to really punch that spacebar to get to do anything. It also makes a weird springy metal sound when pressed, that none of the other keys make.
- The lights on the upper-right, as well as the bottom are way brighter than the other backlit keys. The top right one always stays red. Doesn't look as cool.

Conclusion: I still suggest people get the Logitech K740 if they want backlit, even though it's just white. It types perfectly. Scissor-switch. Near-silent. Very pretty.

But if someone tells me they won't go over the price of $40, this is what I will suggest. (I got it for $26, but it's still the best in the range of $0 - $40)

This will probably now be my keyboard at work.

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText: It works reliably.  My keyboard is in a keyboard tray that is part of a big office desk/hutch combo.  I have several pricey wireless Logitech keyboards but the signal is blocked by my desk and frequently I would pound keys fruitlessly on those wireless keyboards.  So, I had to return to a wired keyboard.  I like this one because it is backlit constantly not only when I touch it (a function of wireless keyboards) and I can choose the color I want to illuminate the keys.  As mentioned by other reviewers, the feel of the keys when pressed is different.  I like the feel a little less than most of the keyboards that I have used in the past but this is not a deal breaker for me.  I am just thrilled that it types reliably unlike my three prior wireless keyboards.
summary: Works well and is lit by pretty colors!

title: Redragon K502 Gaming Keyboard RGB LED Backlit Illuminated 104 Key Silent Keyboard Karura with Wrist Rest for Windows PC Games (New Improved Version)
reviewText:
This keyboard looks really nice. It has 7 Different Leds and even the logo lights up. Overall, it is a really appealing keyboard to the eye.

However, here are the cons: The keys on this keyboard are really stiff. In order to press space, you have to click right in the middle of the space bar or else it will be really hard to press. I am even having a hard time righting a review for this right now without pressing the keys completely in the middle.
Another con is the enter key. In typical keyboards the enter key is in rectangular shape, which is what most of the people are used to, however, this keyboard does not have that type of rectangular enter key. If you buy this keyboard, you will need a lot of patience to not rage.

My advice to anyone who is looking to buy this keyboard is: DO NOT BUY IT. Save yourself the time and money and buy a keyboard that is not this one.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
I didn't think it would be possible with this set, but I've been using it every day with my desktop computer (which I am running Ubuntu, Linux on) and it has been working great. I am on my computer probably 12 - 14 hours a day (I work from home), so I have a good feel of how this set works and find that it fits in great with my daily routines and activities.

The layout of the keyboard is not quite like a regular keyboard, though. Delete, Home, Page Up, Page Down, End and even the Arrow Keys are all in a weird spot. After a few days, I got the hang of it and it didn't take me a few minutes to find those keys (I use most of them pretty regularly). I love the feel of this keyboard. The keys are low and very soft - you can't hear a sound when you type. It's so smooth typing on it. I also love the adjustable feet on the back (I hate typing on a flat keyboard - I like to have it elevated).

The mouse is very basic but works well. There aren't any extra buttons or even horizontal scrolling - only left click, right click and middle click. It's very lightweight (as is the keyboard) and wouldn't be a pain to take on-the-go with you. There's no delay or anything when using it.

I have no complaints about this set. It's easy to use, easy to setup and works really well. I was surprised that it worked right away as soon as I plugged it into my Ubuntu computer (not everything is always this flawless with Linux). Both the keyboard and mouse each use one AA battery. It's probably best to use rechargeable (at least that's what I use). Overall, I'm really happy with the set and plan to use it regularly.

I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review. All opinions are 100% mine.
summary: Loving this set. Works flawlessly on my Linux computer! Such a smooth and enjoyable experience.

It gives me the opportunity use a full sized keyboard and mouse without all of the excess cords. I really like that the mouse stores the wireless receiver. I've had issues in the past losing the receiver when I commute. This is a well thought out feature that works for people who travel for work.

reviewText: It's so compact and perfect in my small work area, I like it. The only thing that I don't care so much about is the number keys. Zero is below the #2 (which is not standard) instead of it being below #1. It's hard to get use to it.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: Both the keyboard and the mouse connect very well with the computer, and the mouse is great like most Jelly Comb's mice. However the keys of the keyboard are very close together, something I would expect from a compact keyboard, whatever that is. A few keys stick, but my biggest gripe is the numeric section of the keypad where the "0" key that usually takes up two keys, is only one and in the middle. Therefore when I'm adding up all the dog treats I've procured in my excel sheet, I keep pressing the right arrow when I mean to press the 0. But I'm a dog and maybe it's just my paws. I just can't imagine this keyboard is good for humans using the numeric keypad.
summary: Connects well, not good for people using the numeric keypad on the right.

reviewText: I go through a lot of keyboards between work and home and have very specific needs for each use. This one was going to replace our worn out multimedia computer keyboard attached to our main televisions so it needed to be compact and have good range. I didn't need a new mouse but I tend to go ahead a get a combo so I don't have multiple receivers. The form was perfect however the function was weak. The keyboard wouldn't sync at all and the mouse had to be within about a foot of the receiver. The USB hub that the receiver is in is situated to the left of the room and simply wouldn't work if you tried to use it with your right hand. I've never seen wireless so limited but I've also never seen good range when a keyboard or mouse only uses 1 battery.
summary: This one was going to replace our worn out multimedia computer keyboard attached to our main televisions so it needed to be compact and have good range. I didn't need a new mouse but ...

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: This is a great wireless keyboard and mouse combo! Both units sync with one usb connection via bluetooth, geat for those times when you have limited usb ports. Plug and play and best of all there was no lag at all that I noticed. Used it on my pc and my Nvidia Shield TV and had no issues. Keyboard keys were responsive and smooth and keyboard layout for my hands were fine, it seems to be about standard size. The mouse fit my hand well and was very responsive and had no connection issues. Both the mouse and the keyboard take one AA battery each. I use rechargeables so this works out well. The color combo of yellow and black is cool too.
summary: No lag, good connection, works great!

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
I managed to misplace the USB adapter on my HP silent keyboard, so I was looking for a replacement. I picked the Jelly Comb mostly for the yellow accent. I thought it would look cool. It's nice, but it looks cooler in pictures.
The mouse is the most silent I've ever had - no clicking sound at all. The keyboard, on the other hand, has almost a retro click. Exactly the opposite of what I had with HP. Feels odd, but it may be just a matter of getting used to it.
The one definite fault I can find is the square-ish font they chose to label the key. It is really hard to read. Don't get me wrong, you'll know what the keys are, but it's a font that does not register as quickly in the brain as others considered very readable. I feel like I make an effort reading it. Not a good idea when you're supposed just to glance at the keys once in a while.
It also feels a little crowded. Probably because they managed to add the arrow keys and still keep the same size as my old HP keyboard. It's a tradeoff. I don't like crowded, but I do like my arrow keys...

reviewText:
Revised: Jelly Comb offered me a refund for the keyboard, I was so shocked how proactive they were to reach out to me. Even though the keyboard isn't the best, their customer service is. Very impressed!!!

At first it was great. I sometimes work at night, and my husband appreciated how quiet it was while he was sleeping. BUT...after only about a month, the "whisper-quiet" keyboard turned into "HEY!!! Wake up everyone, listen my typing, isn't it AWESOME???". Other than the non-quietness, the keyboard works fine and the mouse is actually nice. Just wish it STAYED quiet when typing :-(
summary: It only stayed "whisper-quiet" for about a month

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: Got this for work, I was using the crappy stock keyboard and mouse that comes with the pc, and it's seen better days. I had high hopes for this based on the reviews, but it's fallen short. It's only been a week and keys are sticking, missing, and feel like they're stuck down (the space bar). The mouse is super silent, which I love, but I have to right click 3 or 4 times for it to respond. I have to carefully proof read everything because there are missing letters and numbers all over the place and I am not normally one for near that many typos ~ in fact I had to edit this review because of all the missing letters. Having to do that takes me twice as long and kills my productivity. Classic "you get what you pay for" with this, I will likely return this and spend more on a quality Logitech or something like that. Live and learn :P
summary: It's a $20 set, and performs like one..

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
I recently traveled with the family, and stayed in a hotel, and when they went to sleep, I tried to work on the computer. The click of my mouse was keeping people awake(!). I was mostly browsing, and not using the keyboard, so I bought a "silent" mouse, the SROCKER V2c. www.amazon.com/dp/B01D1NSW4I
I was very impressed with it, right up until the left button stopped working. At the price, I was going to buy another, but my daughter had recently bought this mouse and keyboard to use at school to not wake up her roommate. She recommended that I give it a try. The mouse is pretty quiet, but if you scroll too fast, the wheel can make a bit of noise. Nothing too bad. The keyboard's key strokes are pretty quiet, but some of the keys are _just_ loose enough to rattle a little as you take your fingers away. Again, nothing too bad, especially for the price.
I could probably get away with using these in that quiet hotel room, which is the test criteria I was using.
I wush it had grey or silver instead of neon blue as an accent color, but that's a minor thing indeed.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: This is the worst keyboard I've ever used. First off it constantly misses letters while typing. I can be typing a sentence and it will always skip at least one letter somewhere in every sentence I type, which results in so many typos and misspelled words. I have to constantly proof read everything to find all the letters the keyboard skipped. Secondly, while this keyboard isn't the loudest I've ever used, it should by no stretch of the imagination be considered quiet. One of the main reasons I purchased this keyboard was so I wouldn't have to listen to the loud clicking by the keys on my old keyboard. This one isn't much better. It was reviewed as one of the quietest keyboards on the market. Well if that's the case, then the market sure has changed, because I've owned much quieter keyboards over the years. Unfortunately I stuck it out way too long, so I can't return it now.
summary: Not all that happy with this keyboard.

Just not good quality - it definitely looks sleek and minimalist but the function isn't great.  I bought this set to use at the office, but the placement of the keys on the keyboard are off (and I understand it takes time to get used to) but it doesn't always take when I type in a key so I spend a lot of time re-clicking the space bar or hitting the backwards key to go back and fix my spelling.

The mouse is by far the worst mouse I have ever used.  The optical sensor doesn't work well so the speed and direction of my cursor is NEVER consistent.  At first I thought it was my desk, but even at my other desk where all my other optical mouses work fine, it does this weird jerk thing.  So then I bought a mouse pad - I thought for sure, it was just a surface problem.  Nope, even with a mousepad, it sometimes works and sometimes does't.  Just completely frustrating.  But I guess for the price it is what it is.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: This is my third Jelly Comb wireless keyboard/mouse combination in less than a year. Believing it to be of quality, I built my mobile production studio around its specifications. Now, this third keyboard is failing--missing every 10-50 or so keystrokes regardless of the key pressed or pressure applied. As the concept and design are sound, I have given it two stars. However, its long-term quality is now clearly in question and--this being my third and last purchase--felt it important that other prospective buyers be made aware of the Jelly Comb MK08 wireless keyboard/mouse's deficiencies and, if still purchased, recommend carrying a spare of some other brand and higher quality.
summary: Third and last Jelly Comb MK08 in one-year failing. Not recommended.
