title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: I bought this for building server and computers for work. The compact size is perfect for the limited space I have on my workbench. I typically buy name brand mice and keyboards, like Logitech and Microsoft but for only $17 I figured I would give this wireless combo a try. The mouse is just the right size, not too small for the average hand. The mouse buttons have a very soft and pleasing click, very difference from all my other mice, it kinda reminds me of the soft click of the old Microsoft Intellimouse ball mice had back in the 90s. The keyboard has good key travel, its not short at all and it has a numpad which you don't get on some of the compact keyboards. If I had any complaint it would be the right shift key, it's too narrow because of the placement of the end key. Overall though I'm very happy and I would purchase again.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: I like it. Originally, I purchased this for my son to use with his Raspberry Pi 3.  The keyboard worked fine but the mouse had horrible lag with the Pi.  I tried modifying the config file on the Pi to change the usb mouse poll rate with no success.  That said, mouse lag on a RasPi is not just the JellyComb problem.  I had unbearable lag on the Pi with another big name wireless mouse brand I tried, though not as bad.  The JellyComb mouse and keyboard work great with our PCs so I swapped it out with another older set.  The JellyComb is now happily connected on our xboxone.  I like the color/style and soft feel of the keystrokes.  They keys press a little deeper than I'm used to, but it's not too bad.  For the price, it's a good wireless keyboard and mouse set.
summary: Work great for PC, but not for a Raspberry Pi3

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: This is a pretty great keyboard & mouse combo. I dual-boot on a Mac Pro and it was plug and play on both OS X 10.12.1 and Windows 10. It's a mechanical keyboard style, so if you're accustomed to the modern mac keyboards, you may find this one requires a bit more effort for typing, but overall it's quite nice. Although it is a mechanical style keyboard, he keys are relatively quiet, and the mouse is absolutely dead quiet. If you have larger hands, you may find the mouse too small (as I do) but it's still pretty good. For the price, this is a great little combo!

reviewText:
This is the "softest" keyboard that I've ever used in my life. I type very fast but I can barely hear my fingers hitting the keyboard it's so quiet.
Also, I'm a computer tech and I purchase 90% of my supplies for my clients online. I saw this keyboard and decided to give it a try. The first keyboard that came in from Jelly Comb had a problem either with the receiver or the keyboard itself and often times would miss the first two letters when I started blasting away. Jelly Comb support responded to my request for help the very same day, They had me run a couple of tests which didn't solve the problem so they immediately sent me a replacement. During the process they were very courteous and apologetic as well.
Since I purchase so much tech gear online I know that the quality of a product is not only the product itself but the company that is supposed to stand behind it. Jelly Comb easily passes both tests as far as I'm concerned. This is the best keyboard and mouse I've ever used and the company backs it up 110%. I personally couldn't be any happier with the purchase and I will be recommending Jelly Comb to my clients.

reviewText:
Pros:
Looks fantastic
Mouse works very well

Cons
Keyboard is not very responsive.  I've had many issues where I typed a key and it did not register for some reason
Keyboard layout is confusing - Non-letter Keys are not in the "normal" order, which makes finding keys a little difficult.
No space between the arrow keys and the non-letter keys -- the "end" key and the arrow keys are right next to each other.  I've hit end a few times instead of the left arrow key.  I've also hit "end" instead of enter a few times as well.

If the last two issues were fixed, I would be thrilled with the purchase (even though sometimes the system doesn't register a key stroke).  However, the last two are deal killers. I'm going to buy a different keyboard/mouse combo.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: I got this combo to use on an Android Astro Tab A10 tablet I bought not long ago. I have large fingers and that tends to cause me a bit of trouble on smaller touch screens. This looked like just what I needed to solve this problem. I got it in today and proceeded to see what I had. First thing I noted was the keyboard was just the size I needed and so was the mouse. The keyboard's key feel is nice and quiet, yet very easy to use. I noted that the keyboard battery contacts were just a bit loose in that the spring wasn't pushing the battery forward enough to make really good contact with the forward terminal. (This was fixed by stretching the back spring a bit.) Beside that small problem, I encountered no other problem with the battery installation. After I got the batteries installed I plugged the USB receiver into the A10's standard USB port and both the mouse and the keyboard worked great. The only other problems I ran into were very minor with the first on really due to the design to save battery power. When the KB and mouse "go to sleep" it can sometimes be hard to wake up the mouse by moving it. I found that a sort of rapid jiggling motion or tapping on the KB space bar rapidly seems to work best. The only other thing I ran into was the that mouse had a tendency to get a bit jerky if the A10 was in landscape view and an app opened that forced it to go to portrait instead. It doesn't become non-function but just gets a little jerky in it's movements. Other than that. this combo really fit my bill. It's very compact KB really works well with my tablet and the mouse does too. This is just what I needed.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: Pretty cheap quality, but wasn't expecting much for the price I paid. Setup was simple plug & play, easy. The transmitter in the mouse is either very weak, or the usb receiver is crap, or a combination of the two. Either way, the mouse was very laggy/choppy, and sometimes would refuse to go in the direction I was moving it. I figured it was just having difficulty with the surface of my desk. It is a very light color, so I went and bought a proper mouse pad, solid black, but alas, the issue persisted. Finally I moved the receiver to one of the usb ports on the front of my computer, and that did the trick. Currently, the receiver is about 4ft away, and in direct line of sight with the mouse. I guess that extra 18 inches and having to go through my monitor was just too much for it. One other complaint with the mouse is the click buttons. They require next to no force to click, and don't click. In fact, it offers nearly no feedback at all. I'm finding it difficult to get used to. Also worth mentioning is that the mouse is small and un-ergonomical. The keyboard lights don't have the labels printed on the keyboard, but were added after the fact with a cheap sticker, which doesn't even correctly label the lights. The low battery indicator is pointing to the num lock light. The num lock points to the nothing. Only the caps lock light shows up where it is supposed to be. I'm guessing the actual low battery indicator light will show up somewhere, in time. Also, the left hand shift key is only half the size that it should be. It has been made smaller to fit a retarded & useless(at least for me) function key. I have to say, this is my biggest complaint by far. If you want to add a function key, then by all means, please do so...but, DO NOT EVER mess with the actual keys that perform critical functions...you know...like TYPING.
summary: Get What You Pay For. Poorly laid out keyboard

reviewText: Thanks to the photo accompanying the product, I knew that I was getting an odd bird. The shift keys are different sizes, the Windows key doesn't depict the Microsoft logo (it just says "WIN"), the lamps for CAPS LOCK and NUM LOCK aren't the usual green color, etc. Strangeness aside, the keyboard and mouse function well enough for my purposes. I'm a PC technician and will use this product to pair mostly with AIO machines we bring in the shop for service. Today I have them working with a particularly cheap Dell laptop that has the worst touchpad and keyboard I've ever encountered. Apparently; this is a product of China, so the oddities were expected on my part. Personally; I find Asian vehicles to be oddly designed, so it's no shock that this combo goes against the grain.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
I really love how this keyboard feels.  I wouldn't say that this keyboard is quiet. It has a really nice press and sounds much like that of an older mac keyboard (not the new ones where the key travel-distances are short). There are just certain days when I want that wholesome-key feel, versus the short taps (which then I whip out my Logitech Solar Keyboard). The keyboard is light enough that if you wanted to use it as a portable solution, you could (though I will be keeping this on my home desktop). I even like the font that they used for the lettering, a nice tech-oriented font. It takes a bit of time to get used to the fact that the arrow keys are embedded without any spacing, between the QWERTY and the Number Pad, but its not too troubling. It also means that you get a more compact keyboard and don't have to reach that far for your mouse. The only thing I do find a bit strange is that the F4 (Volume -) and F5 (Volume +) are reversed. On almost all keyboards that allow this function, it is sorted so that F5 is Volume +. Just a thought. Not a big deal but often I find myself turning it down rather than turning it up (or vice versa). I don't use the mouse, as I have a Kensington blade that I am married to, but it did have some delay with tracking on my clear desk mat, when I tried it a few times. I fiddled around with the settings and the problem still seemed to occur. Like I said, not a big deal to me since I'm not using it, but it might be if you are buying this for the entire set. The click is definitely quiet. It's just not a good mouse and I would personally recommend buying another mouse alongside it, if you don't have one.

Overall, I would recommend this set for the keyboard -- if you are looking for that feel of an older mac keyboard (this really is the quality that stood out for me). I wasn't looking for that when I purchased (I wanted something sleek and had some deeper keys), but it's become my favorite feature.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: Purchased this to go with an Odroid running Android, and needed a keyboard and mouse that would work with it.  This works perfectly with it and only uses up one of the USB slots.  I've also used it with my laptop, and it works beautifully with it as well.  If you were to want to use it for a tablet or smart phone, you would need a USB OTG cable.  Both the keyboard and mouse have a good weight and feel to them and are very quiet.  When the Odroid system boots, they connect immediately after clicking once with the mouse. The keyboard is compact, in that it does not have the excessive plastic around it that most full size keyboards have, but it also does not feel cramped when typing, and is quite comfortable to use.  There is some airspace between the keys and the keyboard itself, which will make it easy to use compressed air for cleaning purposes if any dust or debris fall into it.  After having it for about a month, I've experienced no problems with it whatsoever and would highly recommend it.
summary: Great keyboard and mouse combo for Odroid and PC

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
This compact wireless keyboard and mouse from Jelly Comb didn't work properly on my Dell PC initially. None of the alphabet keys were operable but all the numbers worked, and the mouse worked. Jelly Comb had sent me a followup email which I replied to, explaining my problem. I got a timely response over the weekend asking me to reinstall the receiver and press Esc/ Fn or Esc/ Q and hold for 3 seconds. I used Esc/ Fn and sure enough the alpha keys began to work. I logged out of Windows and back in and they still work.

Another quirk about this keyboard is that the left Shift key is much smaller than what I'm used to so I'm having a problem adjusting to that when capitalizing letters at the beginning of sentences. I think that anyone who keys by touch will have the same problem.

[Edit] After a couple of months use I've retired this keyboard mouse combination and it's on a shelf in my basement. The alpha keys stopped working again. Too late to return it.

I use two monitors and I have to move the mouse to find it sometimes, with this mouse I have to move it only to realize that it went into sleep mode and it doesn't wake up with movement, you have to press a button to wake it. I use the calculator a lot, with this keyboard the calculator short cut is 2 buttons, the function key and the insert key. Less than ideal but it worked, until the function key stopped working.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
Misery! If you touch type this is not your board combo. Skipped and double characters are the norm. serious typing is impossible. I missed the return window so I threw the keyboard away. I did keep the mouse.

Cons: Keyboard
No tactile (haptic) response just like most others in the price range.
Key switches are of an inconsistent quality. Tap one lightly and you may get double characters, another has to be pounded.  Double characters and lost spaces are the norm. Hence the low star count.  The keys float at high speeds or skip if you have a light touch.
LEDs are hidden from view under the delete key and make me wonder why they are there.  Most boards in this price range do not have them at all.

Cons: Mouse
Patterned, wood and dark surfaces that work well with Microsoft and Logitech do not work with this mouse.
Scroll is anything but smooth.  Slow scroll barely moves, fast scroll pages at a time.  I am constantly losing my place and use keyboard navigation instead. To be fair I am aging and getting slower.

Overall:
Jelly Comb exhibited an outstanding response to my original low star review.  They were genuinely concerned about their brand and my business.  I will try their other products.
I would buy this board again for Web TV or games or any use where a rugged, durable keyboard is necessary and where the keyboard only receives light typing. If you like to type you will not like this board
summary: Rugged as hell, durable. 101 keys, pgup, pgdn, Compact, Light. Great for adolescents.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
I love this keyboard!  The keyboard that came wth my new Asus Zen did not provide much feedback when typing, and the mouse was very ordinary.  I bought this keyboard/mouse combo as an upgrade and I am so glad I did!

PROS: The keyboard does not have a very definitive "click" when you type, but the keys have a lot of travel -- which for me makes it a lot easier to type fast and know you're hitting the right keys.  It just has a really good feel to it, though you do have to press the keys all the way down in order to get them to register.  I would prefer if it didn't require so much pressure on every key.  It could get tiring after a lot of typing.
I also love the way it looks, for whatever that's worth.
And despite having all of the keys including arrows etc., it's extremely compact -- taking up a minimal amount of real estate on my desk.  A huge plus!  All the benefits of a full-size keyboard (except for a separate numeric keypad) and yet very compact.
The mouse is very responsive -- I did not see any lag or any problems at all.  The mouse clicks nicely and the scroll wheel works fine.
CONS: The only thing I didn't like about this setup was that the mouse wheel was too tight.  With light pressure on the wheel, the rubber part slides but doesn't activate the mechanism -- so you have to kind of put pressure on the wheel to get it to turn.  I didn't like this at all.  But I took the mouse apart -- just one screw -- and with a jewler's screwdriver I very carefully pressed the metal detent that clicks when you turn the wheel, and now it takes much less pressure to spin the wheel and yet you still feel the clicks.
summary: Just a couple of minor gripes, but overall I love it.

Just got this and I'm very happy with it. I tried the HP Wireless Elite Keyboard v2., but the space bar was noisy compared to the rest of the keys. The Jelly keyboard isn't perfect, but it's very good. Moreover, the mouse is incredibly quiet, better in my opinion than the shhhhmouse that I also tried. I originally declined to buy the Jelly package because it seemed to be too cheap to outclass the competition including the Anker CB310 Full-Size Ergonomic Wireless Keyboard and Mouse, which I also tried and didn't have a quiet mouse to match the keyboard.

Though some buyers complain about the compact size - it does take a bit of practice to get used to - I like this feature as I can easily through it into my backpack and haul it with me.

I do executive coaching and really looked hard for a quiet keyboard - there aren't many to choose from. This is the best of the bunch by a long shot and it's low cost to boot!

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText:
This is a great keyboard for a workspace with limited room. I purchased it as I dumped my old Windows Desktop TV and replaced it with a ChromeBox the size of a paperback book. The ChromeBox did come with a workable Bluetooth Keyboard and Mouse, but I really wanted a more standard keyboard with rear legs to give it a forward tilt. This keyboard is big enough for more extensive keyboard entry, and it does have a separate numeric keypad. The mouse and keyboard are both cordless and are comfortable to work with.

The action is good-but-not-great, but I still give this 5 stars because the value is excellent and unless you really rely on lots of extra keys beyond the normal function keys this keyboard does have, It's fully functional.

After years of cables and "Tower CPUs" that I banged my shins on, and the hard drives that crashed, this keyboard and mouse mean that the only two cables I'm no connected to are the power supply to the Chrome Box and the cable between a USB 2.0 port and my 21" Dell 1080 dpi monitor (I found a great deal on a cable with a USB connector to use my old screen on the amazingly small Chrome Box, and am relying on Cloud Storage instead of onboard memory. Fee at last.
summary: Great Choice for Downsizing Workspace or Adding an External Keyboard/Mouse to your Laptop or Tablet.

reviewText:
So to be honest when I first using this keyboard, it is really weird because the key travel is deep, slow, and inert which made me thought that I will slow down my typing. However, after using it for a few days, it turned out to be very comfortable.

If you are an average typer and look for a set comfortable wireless keyboard and mouse, this is it
summary: it turned out to be very comfortable. If you are an average typer and look ...

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: Great key board and mouse... Better than expected... Just the right size and the keys have a good feel... Happy with purchase.

title: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse - Jelly Comb K025 Compact 2.4Ghz Wireless Keyboard Mouse - Keyboard and Mouse Combo- Compatible with PC Laptop Windows 7/8/10-Updated (Yellow and Black)
reviewText: Great keyboard and easy to type- not cheaply builty. I love the mobility of it and that it is wireless. You will need to add a battery to make both the keyboard and mouse work but overall I am very happy with the look, quality and feel of the keyboard. The keys are also very quiet.
summary: Great sturdy quality keyboard and mouse
